This script inject required settings into the autoinst.xml file. It injects the
required pre- chroot- and post- exitpoint scripts.
pre-exitpoint       to start the agent before the installation starts.
chroot-exitpoint    to stall the installation before the AutoYaST reboot between 
                    the 1st and second installation phase. This also triggers
                    the integration of the HP SA agent installation executed 
                    during the next reboot.
post-exitpoint      to write info file that the installation has finished                    

Usage:
	inject_required_ay.py [HP SA Agent Name]

		HP SA Agent Name
			The OGFS agent that needs to be started during installation.
			The name of the agent doesn't require quotes. 

Example:
	
		inject_required_ks.py SuSE Linux Enterprise Server 11
		Will inject required settings, and starting SuSE Linux Enterprise
        Server 11

Prerequisites:
- Target server runs a maintenance Linux OS.
- The user provided or default autoinst.xml file must be in /tmp/user.autoinst.cfg.

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
""" 
    (C) Copyright 2009-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Inject required options and move the file onto the boot
    partition.
"""

import sys

from osprov import helpers, media
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage, NotSupportedError
from osprov.osbp.constants import CODE_HEADER, CODE_FOOTER, CODE_WARNING, MONITORING_STOP_FLAG
from osprov.platform_util import isSLES
from osprov.profile import AutoYaST, ProfileError
from osprov.scripts import bootmode

LOG = logger.getIt("inject_required_ay")

BASE_AY_FILE = "tmp/user.autoinst.xml"


def injectRequiredOsprov(ayobj):
    """ Inject settings required for OS provisioning to work correctly. """
    # Make sure that keep_install_network is in the profile we rely on it
    # to do the mac association. We need this every time,  even if we are doing
    # DHCP provisioning, otherwise  the NIC won't get configured in the final OS
    keepNet = ayobj.createPath("profile/networking/keep_install_network")
    keepNet.setAttribute("config:type", "boolean")
    ayobj.setNodeTextValue(keepNet, "true")


def injectUefiPartitioning(ayobj):
    """Sles installer in some situations can not determine a valid partitioning plan for UEFI servers
    If the user does not have a defined partitioning plan, we will create a default one that works for these UEFI cases
    """
    partitioning = ayobj.getNode("profile/partitioning")
    if partitioning:
        # searching for a list of partitions
        for drive in partitioning.getElementsByTagName("drive"):
            if ayobj.getNode("partitions", drive):
                # In case the user defines a partitioning plan it's is expected to also set the disklabel accordingly
                LOG.debug("The found autoyast profile already has a partition list defined. Will keep it untouched.")
                return
    else:
        # Installer should be able to calculate a partitioning plan in this case
        LOG.debug("The found autoyast profile does not have a partitioning tag defined. Will keep it untouched.")
        return
    # Identifying the most appropriate drive to use for installation
    installdrive = None
    for drive in partitioning.getElementsByTagName("drive"):
        if ayobj.getNode("disklabel", drive):
            drivedisklabel = ayobj.getNode("disklabel/#text", drive)
            if drivedisklabel and drivedisklabel.data == "gpt":
                installdrive = drive
                break
        if not installdrive:
            installdrive = drive
    # Create new drive if no drive was found
    if not installdrive:
        installdrive = ayobj.createPath("profile/partitioning/drive")
    # Dealing with disklabel configuration
    disklabel = ayobj.getNode("disklabel", installdrive)
    if disklabel:
        if ayobj.getNode("#text", parentNode=disklabel).data != "gpt":
            LOG.warning("UEFI boot mode detected but the installation disk will not have a gpt partition table!")
    else:
        # Create a new disklabel tag
        disklabel = ayobj.document.createElement("disklabel")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(disklabel, "gpt")
        installdrive.appendChild(disklabel)
    # If we have found a gpt drive to partition we will add a list of partitions that will work for UEFI systems
    if ayobj.getNode("disklabel/#text", installdrive).data == "gpt":
        LOG.debug("Adding UEFI partitions list to autoyast profile.")
        partitions = ayobj.document.createElement("partitions")
        partitions.setAttribute("config:type", "list")
        installdrive.appendChild(partitions)
        efipartition = ayobj.document.createElement("partition")
        efipartition_nr = ayobj.document.createElement("partition_nr")
        efipartition_nr.setAttribute("config:type", "integer")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(efipartition_nr, "1")
        efipartition.appendChild(efipartition_nr)
        efipartition_fs = ayobj.document.createElement("filesystem")
        efipartition_fs.setAttribute("config:type", "symbol")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(efipartition_fs, "vfat")
        efipartition.appendChild(efipartition_fs)
        efipartition_mount = ayobj.document.createElement("mount")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(efipartition_mount, "/boot/efi")
        efipartition.appendChild(efipartition_mount)
        efipartition_size = ayobj.document.createElement("size")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(efipartition_size, "auto")
        efipartition.appendChild(efipartition_size)
        partitions.appendChild(efipartition)
        swappartition = ayobj.document.createElement("partition")
        swappartition_mount = ayobj.document.createElement("mount")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(swappartition_mount, "swap")
        swappartition.appendChild(swappartition_mount)
        swappartition_size = ayobj.document.createElement("size")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(swappartition_size, "auto")
        swappartition.appendChild(swappartition_size)
        partitions.appendChild(swappartition)
        rootpartition = ayobj.document.createElement("partition")
        rootpartition_mount = ayobj.document.createElement("mount")
        ayobj.setNodeTextValue(rootpartition_mount, "/")
        rootpartition.appendChild(rootpartition_mount)
        partitions.appendChild(rootpartition)


def removeConflictingOsprov(ayobj):
    """ Removes conflicting options from the autoinst.xml """

    #   <general>
    #       <mode>
    #           <reboot config:type="boolean">false</reboot>
    #       </mode>
    #   </general>

    if "profile/general/mode/reboot/#text" in ayobj:
        ayobj.getNode("profile/general/mode/reboot/#text").data = "false"

# using code from prelim. xml


def injectPre(ayobj, targetServer):
    """ Inject code in the pre hook to start the OGFS agent """

    agwIpPort = targetServer.getRandomAgentGateway()
    flags = {"mount": False, "async": True, "quiet": True}
    startCode = CODE_HEADER + \
        targetServer.localServer.getOgfsAgentStartupScript(agwIpPort, flags=flags)

    ayobj.addPreScript(scriptCode=startCode, scriptFileName="pre.sh", scriptInterpreter="shell")


def injectChroot(ayobj):
    """ Inject code to stall the installer"""

    chrootCode = """
#!/bin/sh
{header}
{warning}
# next line ends the monitor BP step
echo "DONE" > {stopFlag}
echo "Starting SA Integration .... "
# wait until the continue_hook.log file is present
touch /tmp/waitForContinuationOfPhase1;
while [ -f /tmp/waitForContinuationOfPhase1 ]; do
    if [ -f /tmp/continue_hook.log ]; then break;
    fi;
    if [ -f /mnt/tmp/continue_hook.log ]; then break;
    fi;
    sleep 5;
done
exit 0
{footer}
    """.format(
        header=CODE_HEADER,
        warning=CODE_WARNING,
        footer=CODE_FOOTER,
        stopFlag=MONITORING_STOP_FLAG
    )

    ayobj.addChrootScript(scriptCode=chrootCode, scriptFileName="chroot_wait4agent.sh",
                          scriptInterpreter="shell", chrooted=True)

    friendly_device = """@friendly_mpath_device:false@"""
    if friendly_device and friendly_device.lower() == "true":
        friendlyMPathCode = "echo \"defaults {\n \
user_friendly_names yes\n \
bindings_file /etc/multipath_bindings\n \
}\"> /etc/multipath.conf\n \
        sleep 1\n \
        cat /etc/fstab | sed 's/mapper\/.*_part/disk\/by-id\/scsi-mpatha-part/' > /etc/fstab.mod\n \
        mv /etc/fstab /etc/fstab.orig\n \
        mv /etc/fstab.mod /etc/fstab\n \
        sleep 1\n \
        mkinitrd -f multipath\n "
        ayobj.addChrootScript(scriptCode=friendlyMPathCode, scriptFileName=None, scriptInterpreter="shell",
                              chrooted=True, debug=True, feedback=False)


def injectPost(ayobj):
    """ Inject code to indicate the installer has finished"""
    postCode = """
#!/bin/sh
%s
#### DO NOT REMOVE THE ABOVE COMMENT ###
    echo "DONE" > /tmp/post_hook.log
    exit 0
### END OF HPSA CODE ###""" % CODE_HEADER
    ayobj.addPostScript(scriptCode=postCode, scriptFileName="post.sh", scriptInterpreter="shell")


def encapsulateShCode(code):
    return """#!/bin/sh\n""" + CODE_HEADER + code + """\n### END OF HPSA CODE ###"""


def getFirewallConfigBackupInstructions():
    return """
fwconf=/etc/sysconfig/SuSEfirewall2
cp -a $fwconf $fwconf.orig"""


def getFirewallEnableInstructions():
    return """
echo "Init-script start firewall: Permanently enabling the firewall"
chkconfig SuSEfirewall2_init on
chkconfig SuSEfirewall2_setup on"""


def getFirewallStartInstructions():
    return """
echo "Init-script start firewall: Starting the firewall"
service SuSEfirewall2_init start
service SuSEfirewall2_setup start"""


def getFirewallConfigManipulationInstruction(ay, node):
    # Will take in consideration just the nodes that start their name with FW
    property_name = node.nodeName
    if not property_name.startswith("FW"):
        if not property_name == "#text" and \
                not property_name == "enable_firewall" and not property_name == "start_firewall":
            print "WARNING: Did not recognize the %s setting as a valid firewall setting; it will be ignored!" % property_name
        return ""
    else:
        valuenode = ay.getNode("#text", node)
        if valuenode:
            property_value = valuenode.nodeValue
        else:
            property_value = ""
        LOG.debug("Composing the manipulation instruction for %s firewall setting" % property_name)
        #Composing the new definition line for SuSE firewall configuration file
        firewallProperty = '%s="%s"' % (property_name, property_value)
        # Composing the sh instruction
        return '''
grep '^%s=".*' $fwconf 1>/dev/null && \
sed -i 's/^%s=".*/%s/g' $fwconf || \
echo '%s' >> $fwconf''' % (property_name, property_name, firewallProperty, firewallProperty)


def injectFixForAutoYastFirewallSettingsIgnorance(ayobj):
    """ Inject code that will configure, enable and start the SuSEfirewall2 services if they were configured
    This is a work-around for a SLES 11 SP3 autoyast defect we have just filled in"""

    firewallServiceCode = ""

    fw = ayobj.getNode("profile/firewall")
    if not fw:
        return
    else:
        for node in fw.childNodes:
            firewallServiceCode += getFirewallConfigManipulationInstruction(ayobj, node)
    # Backup original configuration file if any manipulation is needed
    if len(firewallServiceCode) > 0:
        print "The SuSE firewall configuration file will be manipulated to apply the specified AutoYaST settings"
        firewallServiceCode = getFirewallConfigBackupInstructions() + firewallServiceCode

    fw_enable = ayobj.getNode("profile/firewall/enable_firewall/#text")
    if fw_enable and fw_enable.nodeValue.lower() == "true":
        print "The SuSEfirewall2 services will be enabled as specified in the AutoYaST"
        firewallServiceCode += getFirewallEnableInstructions()

    fw_start = ayobj.getNode("profile/firewall/start_firewall/#text")
    if fw_start and fw_start.nodeValue.lower() == "true":
        print "The SuSEfirewall2 services will be started as specified in the AutoYaST"
        firewallServiceCode += getFirewallStartInstructions()

    if len(firewallServiceCode) > 0:
        firewallServiceCode = encapsulateShCode(firewallServiceCode)
        ayobj.addInitScript(scriptCode=firewallServiceCode, scriptFileName="fixfirewall.sh", scriptInterpreter="shell")


def writeFinalAy(ayobj):
    """ Write the kickstart file onto the boot disk """
    ayfile = open(BASE_AY_FILE, "w")
    ayfile.write(str(ayobj))
    ayfile.close()
    print "AutoYaST file written to disk"


def main():
    """ Do the injection into the AutoYast profile """
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
        keys.platform.full_name = " ".join(sys.argv[1:])
        helpers.putDataStore(keys, targetServer)
        if keys.media.url:
            url = media.parseUrl(keys.media.url)
            if url.scheme == "https":
                print "Warning: SLES can't install if you have self signed certificates."
                print "Make sure that your http servers certificates are signed by a trusted CA. "
            if url.username:
                print "Warning: SLES only supports basic authentication."
                print "Make sure that your server isn't set up with digest or some other authentication method."
            if not isSLES(keys.platform.full_name, version="12") \
               and url.scheme == "nfs" and targetServer.isIPv6Managed():
                raise NotSupportedError("Provisioning %s with a media on NFS over IPv6 is not supported. Try with HTTP."
                                        % keys.platform.full_name)
        ayobj = AutoYaST(open(BASE_AY_FILE))
        removeConflictingOsprov(ayobj)
        injectRequiredOsprov(ayobj)
        if "UEFI" in bootmode.getCurrentBootMode(targetServer, LOG):
            injectUefiPartitioning(ayobj)
            if not ayobj.installsPackage("shim"):
                ayobj.injectPackage("shim")
                print("Injected package 'shim' since in UEFI mode")
        injectPost(ayobj)
        injectChroot(ayobj)
        injectPre(ayobj, targetServer)
        injectFixForAutoYastFirewallSettingsIgnorance(ayobj)
        writeFinalAy(ayobj)
        print "Successfully injected required settings"
    except (IOError, OSError, ShowErrorMessage, ProfileError), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to inject required settings.%s\n" % why)
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

allVersions.usage:
This script integrates a Windows OS install with Server Automation.
Features
 * Downloading the HP SA agent installer
 * Creating a script that will execute the HP SA Agent installer when the final OS first boots.
 * Copying the server's unique MID and cryptographic certificates into place
 * Setting up the agent installer to run at first boot

Usage:  [--systemdrive H] [--platform Windows 2008 x64] [--unattend="path_to_unattend"] [--installdir="path_to_install_agent"]
  systemdrive:
    (Optional) The Windows drive letter where OS is installed.  The default is  "C".
  unattend:
    (Optional) Path to the unattend file.  By default the script looks for the usual X:\Windows\Temp\Unattend.xml file.
  platform:
    (Optional) HP SA Platform name. Used to download the appropriate agent installer package. If not provided, the correct agent package will be auto-selected based on the running Windows PE environment (32 or 64 bit).
  installdir:
    (Optional) Agent installation directory. Default is "%SystemDrive%\Program Files\Common Files\Opsware\agent". The script  will append agent to  installdir if path does not end in agent.
Prerequisites:
 - Target server runs a maintenance Windows PE OS.
 - Target answer file must be a valid Unattend answer file.

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2009-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Integrates the HP SA Agent into a Windows Install

    This consists of:
    * Copying the MID and crypto into place
    * Downloading the agent installer binary
    * Computing the correct opswgw_addr_list args for the agent installer
    * Writing a wrapper .cmd that will install the agent
    * 2008 & later: Update Unattend.xml
"""
import glob
import optparse
import os
import re
import shutil
import string
import sys
import time
import random

from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer

DEFAULT_INSTAL_DIR = "\\Program Files\\Common Files\\Opsware"
PRODUCTION_INSTALL_DRIVE = "@SystemDrive:C@"
TMP_DIR = "/Windows/Temp/agent"
MID_DIR = ""
CRYPTO_DIR = ""

WINPE_CRYPTO_DIR = "X/Program Files/Common Files/Opsware/crypto/agent"
OGFS_MID = "../../.id"

EC_USAGE = 1
EC_INSTALLER_MISSING = 10
EC_TARGET_DIR = 11
EC_NO_UNATTEND = 12
EC_EXCEPTION = 100


class LocalException(Exception):
    pass


def setup_tmp(midDir="/etc/agent", cryptoDir="/crypto/agent"):
    global TMP_DIR
    global MID_DIR
    global CRYPTO_DIR
    TMP_DIR += "_" + str(random.randrange(100000, 999999, 1))
    MID_DIR = TMP_DIR + midDir
    CRYPTO_DIR = TMP_DIR + cryptoDir


def copy(src, dest):
    """ Recursively copy files and folders and overwrite them """
    if os.path.isdir(src):
        if not os.path.isdir(dest):
            os.makedirs(dest)
        files = os.listdir(src)
        for f in files:
            copy(os.path.join(src, f),
                 os.path.join(dest, f))
    else:
        shutil.copyfile(src, dest)


def findSystemDrive(systemDrive):
    """ Note that this will not work with multiple windows installs """
    if os.path.isdir(systemDrive + "/Windows") or os.path.exists(systemDrive + "/boot.ini"):
        return systemDrive
    # We want letters c-z. A and B are for floppy drives
    driveLetters = list(string.letters[2:26].upper())
    # X is for WinPE
    driveLetters.remove("X")
    for driveLetter in driveLetters:
        if os.path.isdir(driveLetter + "/Windows"):
            return driveLetter
    # Well, the default system drive is not there
    # Nor is any other drive letter
    # Just fall back to the default and let things proceed
    return systemDrive


def findInstallerByPlatform(targetServer, platformName):
    twistServer = targetServer.twistServer
    if not platformName:
        envVars = targetServer.rosh().getStdout(["cmd.exe", "/c", "set"])
        # The windows agents are all the same on a given architecture,
        # So if they are running 32 bit WinPE, just grab the Windows 2008 agent,
        # Ditto for WinPE 64 bit
        if re.search("^opswbasig=WINPE32", envVars, re.M):
            platformName = "Windows 2008"
        elif re.search("^opswbasig=WINPE64", envVars, re.M):
            platformName = "Windows 2012 x64"
    if not (platformName or platformName.strip()):
        raise LocalException(
            "Platform could not be guessed based on the WinPE environment. You must provide a platform name as a command line argument to this script.", EC_USAGE)
    from pytwist.com.opsware.search import Filter
    unitFilter = Filter()
    unitFilter.setObjectType("software_unit")
    # Customer ID 15 is "Opsware"
    unitFilter.setExpression('('
                             '(PackageVO.fileName BEGINS_WITH opsware-agent-) & '
                             '(UnitVO.unitType EQUAL_TO UNKNOWN) & '
                             '(PackageVO.fileType EQUAL_TO UNKNOWN) & '
                             '(software_customer_id EQUAL_TO 15) & '
                             '(software_platform_name EQUAL_TO "%s"))' % platformName)
    refs = twistServer.search.SearchService.findObjRefs(unitFilter)
    vos = list(twistServer.pkg.UnknownPkgService.getUnknownPkgVOs(refs))
    # Sort them and choose the one with the most recent (greatest) modified date
    vos.sort(lambda x, y: cmp(x.getModifiedDate(), y.getModifiedDate()))
    if vos:
        return vos[-1]
    else:
        raise LocalException("Unable to find HP SA Agent Installer package for platform '%s'. Most likely your platform name is incorrect or misspelled." %
                             platformName, EC_INSTALLER_MISSING)


def downloadInstaller(targetServer, pkgVO, systemDrive):
    """Stages the HP SA Agent Installer binary on the target system in a temporary location"""
    tmpDir = systemDrive + TMP_DIR
    if not os.path.exists(tmpDir):
        try:
            os.makedirs(tmpDir)
        except OSError, info:
            raise LocalException("Unable to create target directory '%s'. %s" %
                                 (tmpDir, str(info)), EC_TARGET_DIR)
    pkgPath = systemDrive + ":" + TMP_DIR.replace("/", "\\") + "\\" + pkgVO.getFileName()
    targetServer.downloadUnitToTarget(pkgVO.getRef().getId(), pkgPath)
    print "HP SA Agent installer binary downloaded to %s" % pkgPath
    return pkgVO.getFileName()


def copyMidCrypto(systemDrive):
    """Copies the essential identity files from the OGFS Agent to the agent installer tmp
    This include the unique machine identifier (MID) and the device  specific crypto certificates
    """
    try:
        os.makedirs(systemDrive + MID_DIR)
    except IOError, info:
        raise LocalException(
                "Unable to create dir '%s'. %s" % (systemDrive + MID_DIR, str(info)), EC_EXCEPTION)

    try:
        copy(OGFS_MID, systemDrive + MID_DIR + "/mid")
    except IOError, info:
        raise LocalException(
                "Unable to copy '%s' to '%s'. %s" % (OGFS_MID, systemDrive + MID_DIR, str(info)), EC_EXCEPTION)
    try:
        os.makedirs(systemDrive + CRYPTO_DIR)
    except IOError, info:
        raise LocalException(
                "Unable to create dir '%s'. %s" % (systemDrive + MID_DIR, str(info)), EC_EXCEPTION)
    try:
        copy(WINPE_CRYPTO_DIR, systemDrive + CRYPTO_DIR)
    except IOError, info:
        raise LocalException(
                "Unable to copy cryptographic material. It's probable that the agent files are already present in the WIM Image. %s" % (str(info)), EC_EXCEPTION)
    print "This server's unique MID and crypto material successfully installed"


def setup_agent_install_cmd(gwIpPort, logPath, pkgName, tmpPath, installPath):
    installCmd = """@echo off
setlocal
setlocal EnableDelayedExpansion
set LOG="${logPath}"
mkdir /s ${installPath}
if exist "${tmpPath}\\${pkgName}" (
    echo Waiting for network interface to get an IP Address >> %LOG%
    set tmpFile=%TEMP%\ipconfig%RANDOM%
    set retryCount=5
    :RECHECK
    ipconfig > !tmpFile!
    find /i "Autoconfiguration IPv4 Address" !tmpFile! > NUL
    if !ERRORLEVEL! == 1 goto IPOK
    timeout /T 10
    set /a retryCount=retryCount-1
    if "%retryCount%" == "0" (
        echo ERROR: No connected adapter was detected. We will run the HP SA Agent Installer anyway >> %LOG%
        goto IPOK
    )
    echo No connected adapter was detected. Waiting 10 seconds. >> %LOG%
    goto RECHECK
    :IPOK
    echo Copying files to agent install dir ${installPath} >> %LOG%
    robocopy "${tmpPath}" "${installPath}" -e
    echo Running HP SA Agent installer >> %LOG%
    ipconfig >> %LOG%
    "${installPath}\\${pkgName}" -s ${installArg} --settime --force_full_hw_reg --force_sw_reg --logfile "${logPath}" --opsw_gw_addr ${gwIpPort}
    if !ERRORLEVEL! == 0 (
        echo HP SA Agent installed successfully
        echo HP SA Agent installed successfully >> %LOG%
        echo Deleting temporary files >> %LOG%
        del /q /f "${tmpPath}"
        del /q /f "${installPath}\\${pkgName}"
    ) else (
        echo ERROR: HP SA Agent installer failed. Exit status !ERRORLEVEL!.
        echo ERROR: HP SA Agent installer failed. Exit status !ERRORLEVEL!. >> %LOG%
        exit /B !ERRORLEVEL!
    )
) else (
    echo HP SA Agent Installer executable not found at ${tmpPath}\\${pkgName}
    echo ERROR: HP SA Agent not installed
    exit /B 5
)
"""
    installCmd = installCmd.replace("\n", "\r\n")
    template = string.Template(installCmd)
    dataDict = {"pkgName": pkgName,
                "tmpPath": tmpPath,
                "gwIpPort": gwIpPort,
                "logPath": logPath,
                "installPath": installPath,
                "installArg": '--installdir "%s"' % installPath if "%SystemDrive%" +  DEFAULT_INSTAL_DIR != installPath else ""
                }
    installCmd = template.safe_substitute(dataDict)
    return installCmd


def get_agent_install_cmd(pkgName, installPath, targetServer):
    global TMP_DIR
    agwIpPort = targetServer.getRandomAgentGateway()
    tmpPath = "%SystemDrive%" + TMP_DIR.replace("/", "\\")
    logPath = installPath + "\\agent_install.log"
    return setup_agent_install_cmd(agwIpPort, logPath, pkgName, tmpPath, installPath)


def parseArgs(args):
    """
    Parse the arguments.
    """
    # setup and return parsed arguments
    parser = optparse.OptionParser(
        description=__doc__,
        version="0.2.1",
        usage="%prog [Platform Name]"
    )
    parser.set_defaults(systemdrive="@SystemDrive:C@", platform="", installdir=None)
    parser.add_option("-s", "--systemdrive", dest="systemdrive", metavar="DRIVE_LETTER",
                      help="The Windows drive letter where OS is installed")
    parser.add_option("-i", "--installdir", dest="installdir", metavar="FILE_PATH",
                      help="Agent installation directory")
    parser.add_option("-u", "--unattend", dest="unattend", metavar="FILE_PATH",
                      help="Windows file system path to the Unattend.xml file to update")
    parser.add_option("-p", "--platform", dest="platform", metavar="PLATFORM_NAME",
                      help="HP SA Platform name. Used to download the appropriate agent installer package. If not provided, the correct agent package will be auto-selected based on the running Windows PE environment (32 or 64 bit).")
    return parser.parse_args(args)


HPSA_CMD = "hp_sa_agent_install.cmd"
HPSA_CMD_PATH = "%SystemDrive%\\" + HPSA_CMD
HPSA_CMD_LAUNCHER = 'if exist "%s" ( "%s" )' % (HPSA_CMD_PATH, HPSA_CMD_PATH)


def updateSetupCompleteCmd(setup_complete_contents):
    setup_complete_contents = setup_complete_contents.replace(HPSA_CMD_LAUNCHER, "")
    setup_complete_contents = "\n" + HPSA_CMD_LAUNCHER + "\n" + setup_complete_contents
    return setup_complete_contents


def main(argv=None):
    if argv is None:
        argv = sys.argv
    opt, args = parseArgs(argv[1:])
    opt.systemdrive = opt.systemdrive.upper()

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
    twistServer = targetServer.twistServer


    # This is the drive that the WinPE mapped, the production one might be different (for production we rely %SystemDrive%)
    opt.systemdrive = findSystemDrive(opt.systemdrive)
    if not opt.installdir:
        opt.installdir = "%SystemDrive%" + DEFAULT_INSTAL_DIR
        setup_tmp()
    else:
        opt.installdir = opt.installdir.rstrip("\\")
        if opt.installdir.split("\\")[-1].lower() != "agent":
            # append agent folder so that the installer is consistent
            opt.installdir = opt.installdir.rstrip("\\") + "\\agent"
        setup_tmp("/etc", "/crypto")
    print "Agent will be installed in: [%s] " % opt.installdir
    unattend_xml = opt.unattend or opt.systemdrive + ":\\Windows\\Panther\\unattend.xml"

    try:
        copyMidCrypto(opt.systemdrive)
        pkgName = downloadInstaller(
            targetServer, findInstallerByPlatform(targetServer, opt.platform),
            opt.systemdrive)

        if os.path.exists(targetServer.pathToOGFS(unattend_xml)):
            setup_complete_path = opt.systemdrive + ":\\Windows\\Setup\\Scripts\\SetupComplete.cmd"
            setup_complete_ogfs_path = targetServer.pathToOGFS(setup_complete_path)

            if not os.path.exists(setup_complete_ogfs_path):
                if not os.path.exists(os.path.dirname(setup_complete_ogfs_path)):
                    os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(setup_complete_ogfs_path))
                setup_complete_contents = HPSA_CMD_LAUNCHER
            else:
                # useful so we don't add up lines
                print("Found existing SetupComplete.cmd, updating it...")
                setup_complete_contents = updateSetupCompleteCmd(
                    open(setup_complete_ogfs_path, "rb").read())

            targetServer.writeFile(opt.systemdrive + ":\\" + HPSA_CMD,
                                   get_agent_install_cmd(pkgName, opt.installdir, targetServer))
            targetServer.writeFile(setup_complete_path, setup_complete_contents)
    except LocalException, ex:
        sys.stderr.write(ex.args[0] + "\n")
        return ex.args[1]

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

    Inject required options and move the file onto the boot
    partition.
"""

import sys
import os

from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage, ProcessExecutionError

BASE_AY_CONT_FILE = "tmp/continue_hook.log"
LOG = logger.getIt("complete_ay_installation_phase")


def rootPartition():
    """ Get the root partition  """
    # fixed as this is for SLES / AutoYaST only for now
    return "/mnt"


def main(argv=sys.argv, stdin=sys.stdin,
         stdout=sys.stdout, stderr=sys.stderr):
    """ trigger completion of AutoYaST phase 1"""
    sys.stdin = stdin
    sys.stdout = stdout
    sys.stderr = stderr

    # let the AutoYaST continue...
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        contfilename = os.path.join(rootPartition(), BASE_AY_CONT_FILE)
        targetServer.rosh(overall_timeout=10).getStdoutStderr("touch \"%s\"" % contfilename)
        print ("Successfully triggered completion of AutoYaST phase 1")
    except (IOError, OSError, ShowErrorMessage), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write(
            "Failed to trigger completion of AutoYaST phase 1. %s\n" % why)
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
""" (c) Copyright 2009 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
   bundle together all the steps into a single install boot image step
"""

import os
import sys

from pytwist.com.opsware.common import NotFoundException
from pytwist.com.opsware.osprov import RunScriptPlanStep
from pytwist.com.opsware.osprov import InstallZIPPlanStep
from pytwist.com.opsware.script import ServerScriptRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.script import OGFSScriptRef

from librunplan import PlanRunner
from librunplan import PlanOutputHandler

from osprov import sa
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer
from osprov.osbp import logger
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage

Steps = (('Linux/Create Stub Partition', None), ('Linux/Copy Boot Media', None), ('Linux/ESXi Installation Utilities', '/tmp'), ('Deploy Agent', '-d /opt/hpsa_agent/ogfs-agent.zip -p "Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 5 X86_64" -u'), ('Linux/Add ESXi Module', '-s /opt/hpsa_agent  -d'), ('Linux/Add ESXi Module', '-s /tmp/user.ks.cfg -a ks.cfg'), ('Linux/Install bootloader for ESXi', '--kernel_arguments="@kernel_arguments@"'))


def main(argv=sys.argv, stdin=sys.stdin, stdout=sys.stdout, stderr=sys.stderr):
    sys.stdin = stdin
    sys.stderr = stderr
    sys.stdout = stdout
    Twist = sa.getTwistServer()
    Target = ThisTargetServer(twistServer=Twist)
    runnerOH = PlanOutputHandler(stdout, stderr, logger.getIt("Composite step"))
    runnerOH.NO_APX_PROGRESS = True  # don't break the papx reporting
    runnerOH.ADV_STEP_MSG = None  # don't update the main message
    runnerOH.ADV_STEP_MSG_LONG = "\nSub Step: %(action)s '%(name)s'"
    runnerOH.ERR_HEADER = "\nErrors from sub step %(current)d '%(name)s':\n"
    Runner = PlanRunner(None, targetServer=Target, outputHandler=runnerOH)
    for scriptPath, parameters in Steps:
        scriptElems = [x for x in scriptPath.split("/") if x]
        try:
            stepRef = Twist.folder.FolderService.getFNode(
                ["Opsware", "Tools", "OS Provisioning", "OS Build Plan Steps"] +
                scriptElems)
            if isinstance(stepRef, ServerScriptRef) or isinstance(stepRef, OGFSScriptRef):
                step = RunScriptPlanStep()
                step.setScript(stepRef)
                step.setParameters(parameters)
            else:
                step = InstallZIPPlanStep()
                step.setZip(stepRef)
                step.setInstallPath(parameters)
            Runner.doStep(step, stepNo=int(os.environ["CURRENT_STEP_NO"]))
        except (NotFoundException), why:
            runnerOH.exception("Error : sub step '%s' not found! %s" %
                              (scriptPath, why), why)
            sys.exit(101)
        except ShowErrorMessage, why:
            runnerOH.exception("Sub Step '%s' failed: %s" % (scriptPath, why[0]), why)
            sys.exit(100)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2010-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Assigns the target Server to the specified Customer.
"""

import sys
import optparse
# pylint: disable=F0401,E0611

from pytwist.com.opsware.fido import AuthorizationDeniedException
from pytwist.com.opsware.locality import CustomerRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.server import ServerRef

# pylint: enable=F0401,E0611
from osprov import sa
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer

twistServer = sa.getTwistServer()

EC_USAGE = 1
EC_AUTHORIZATION_DENIED = 120
EC_NOT_FOUND = 125
EC_TARGET_SERVER = 5
EC_INPUT_ERROR = 20
INTERNAL_ACCOUNTS = ["15", "0", "opsware", "customer independent"]

parser = optparse.OptionParser(
    description=__doc__,
    version="0.0.1",
    usage="%prog [Customer Id | Customer Name]"
)


def getCustomer(customer):
    custRef = ''
    filters = ['(CustomerVO.displayName = \"%s\")']
    if customer.isdigit():
        filters.append('(CustomerVO.pK = %s)')

    if customer.lower() in INTERNAL_ACCOUNTS:
        print ("Cannot assign server to the reserved internal Customer "
               "(Name/ID: %s)." % customer)
        return EC_INPUT_ERROR

    for filt in filters:
        try:
            custRef = twistServer.search.SearchService.findObjRefs(filt % customer, "customer")[0]
            break
        except IndexError:
            pass

    if not custRef:
        print ("Unable to locate Customer (Name/ID: %s). It does not exist, or you do"
               " not have the proper permissions." % customer)
        return EC_NOT_FOUND

    if not twistServer.locality.CustomerService.getCustomerVO(custRef).getFacilities():
        print ("Cannot assign server to the Customer (Name/ID: %s), as "
               "this Customer is not  associated with any Facilities." % customer)
        return EC_INPUT_ERROR

    return custRef


def assignCustomer(mid, customer):
    custRef = getCustomer(customer)
    if not isinstance(custRef, CustomerRef):
        return custRef

    try:
        server = twistServer.server.ServerService.getServerVO(ServerRef(mid))
        if server.getCustomer().getId() == custRef.getId():  # pylint: disable=E1103
            print "Server (ID: %s) is already assigned to Customer (Name/ID: %s)" % \
                (mid, customer)
            return 0
        server.customer = custRef
        twistServer.server.ServerService.update(ServerRef(mid), server, 1, 0)
        print "Server successfully assigned to Customer (Name/ID: %s)" % customer
        return 0
    except AuthorizationDeniedException:
        print "You do not have sufficient permissions to perform customer assignment"
        return EC_AUTHORIZATION_DENIED


def main(argv=None):
    if argv is None:
        argv = sys.argv
    opt, args = parser.parse_args(argv[1:])

    if len(args) != 1:
        parser.print_help(sys.stderr)
        return EC_USAGE

    try:
        mid = ThisTargetServer().id
    except (IOError, OSError), ose:
        sys.stderr.write("Unable to read the target server's MID in the OGFS. %s\n" % ose.args[0])
        return EC_TARGET_SERVER

    cust = args[0].strip()
    return assignCustomer(mid, cust)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Inject required options and move the required boot files onto the stub partition.
"""
import os
import sys
import optparse
from StringIO import StringIO

from osprov import helpers
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp.helpers import getMediaURL
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.profile import Kickstart, ProfileError
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Script, Directive

HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""

BASE_KS_FILE = "tmp/user.ks.cfg"


def initKickstart(baseFile):
    """ Initialize a Kickstart object """
    return Kickstart(open(baseFile, "r"))


def removeConflictingOsprov(ksobj):
    """ Remove conflicting directives  """
    if hasattr(ksobj, "install"):
        for instance in ksobj.getDirectiveList("install"):
            print "Removing %s from the profile" % instance
            instance.name = "#%s" % instance.name


def injectRequiredOsprov(ksobj, mediaUrl):
    """ inject settings required for OS provisioning to work
            currently it only injects the nfs share. ESX uses different syntax.
    """
    if not hasattr(ksobj, "install"):
        inst = Directive("install")
        if mediaUrl.scheme == "nfs":
            inst[1] = "nfs"
            inst["server"] = mediaUrl.netloc
            inst["dir"] = mediaUrl.path
        elif mediaUrl.scheme in ["http", "https"]:
            if mediaUrl.username:
                raise ShowErrorMessage(
                    "ESXi 4.1 doesn't support installing from a media server that requires authentication.", 100)
            inst[1] = "url"
            inst[2] = mediaUrl.canonical()
        else:
            raise ShowErrorMessage(
                "ERROR: %s is not supported at this time" % mediaUrl.scheme)
        ksobj.directives.append(inst)


def hasEncPasswd(ksobj):
    """Check if the root pwd is encrypted """
    try:
        if ksobj.rootpw["iscrypted"]:
            pass
        return True
    except (KeyError, AttributeError):
        return False


def injectPost(ksobj, unsupported, agentGW, mid, crypto):
    """ Inject code to stall the installer"""
    # Don't inject the IP change script  if this is static provisioning

    for script in ksobj.scripts:
        if script.type == "post" and \
                "###  CODE BY HPSA ###" in [x.strip() for x in script.contents]:
            return

    agentSrv, opswareCaCrt = crypto

    contents = []
    contents.append("###  CODE BY HPSA ###")
    contents.append("#### DON'T REMOVE THE ABOVE COMMENT ###")

    contents.extend(("""

cat > /tmp/hpsa_agent_mid << EOF
%(mid)s
EOF

cat > /tmp/hpsa_agent.srv << EOF
%(agentSrv)s
EOF

cat > /tmp/hpsa_ca.crt << EOF
%(opswareCaCrt)s
EOF

cd /tmp
tar xzf /hpsa_agent.tar.gz
cd usr/hpsa_agent
cp osprov/esxi_reg.sh /tmp/esxi_reg.sh
chmod 755 /tmp/esxi_reg.sh
if which localcli ; then
    localcli network firewall set -e false
    localcli network firewall get >> /tmp/hpsa_osprov.out
fi
/tmp/esxi_reg.sh "/tmp/usr/hpsa_agent" "%(agentGw)s"
RC=$?
if which localcli ; then
    localcli network firewall set -e true
    localcli network firewall get >> /tmp/hpsa_osprov.out
fi
exit $RC
""" % {'mid': mid, 'agentSrv': agentSrv, 'opswareCaCrt': opswareCaCrt, 'agentGw': agentGW}).split("\n"))

    contents.append('### END OF HPSA CODE ###')

    post = Script("post")
    if unsupported:
        post["unsupported"] = None
    post["interpreter"] = "busybox"
    post["ignorefailure"] = "false"

    post.contents.extend(contents)
    ksobj.scripts.append(post)


def writeFinalKs(ksobj):
    """ Write the kickstart file onto the boot disk """
    ksfile = open(BASE_KS_FILE, "w")
    ksfile.write(str(ksobj))
    ksfile.close()
    print "Kickstart file written to disk"


def handleOsprov(ksobj, keys):
    """ change the profile to suit the environment """
    removeConflictingOsprov(ksobj)
    injectRequiredOsprov(ksobj, getMediaURL(keys))


def parseArgs(args):
    """Parse the command line arguments"""
    parser = optparse.OptionParser(description=__doc__, version='0.0.1', )
    parser.add_option('--accept-encrypted-password', default=False, dest="acceptencrypted",
                      help="Continue installation even if user has given an encrypted password ",
                      action="store_true")
    parser.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                      default=False,
                      help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")

    opt, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    return opt


def injectDevice(ksobj, targetServer):
    ksobj.network["device"] = targetServer.getMACAddress()


def getProvisioningNIC(netinfo):
    """ Searches for and return the provisioning NIC """
    provisioningNics = [nic for nic in netinfo.nics if nic.provisioning]
    if len(provisioningNics) > 1:
        print "Warning: Only one provisioning NIC will be configured from the netconfig"
    return provisioningNics[0]


def main():

    opt = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])

    unsupported = False
    unsupported = True
    # parse out flags
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        ksobj = initKickstart(BASE_KS_FILE)
        # exit if unable to retrieve password from ks.cfg
        try:
            ksobj.rootpw[1]
        except (KeyError, AttributeError):
            print "Unable to read root password from kick start file. "\
                  "Please verify kickstart configuration in the build plan"
            return 10

        if hasEncPasswd(ksobj) and not opt.acceptencrypted:
            print "Can not proceed with installation as the root password is encrypted"
            return 11
        else:
            # Save the root password for lather use
            keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
            keys.profile.username = "root"
            keys.profile.password = ksobj.rootpw[1]
            helpers.putDataStore(keys, targetServer)
        # Extra steps
        # Below comment is used to generate scripts with additional actions,
        # don't remove
        handleOsprov(ksobj, keys)

        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(
            StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
            activeMacAddress=targetServer.getMACAddress(),
            ipv6default=targetServer.isIPv6Managed()
        )
        netinfo = netconfigParser.info()
        if netinfo.oldSyntax and not opt.disableWarning:
            newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
            print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

        typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
        if typosList:
            print("The following keys were not recognized in the netconfig CA and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

        provisioningNIC = getProvisioningNIC(netinfo)

        if not (provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks or provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks):
            agwIpPort = targetServer.getRandomAgentGateway()
            mid = targetServer.getId()
            agentSrv = targetServer.readFile(
                os.path.join(targetServer.localServer.CRYPTO_DIR, "agent.srv"))
            opswareCaCrt = targetServer.readFile(
                os.path.join(targetServer.localServer.CRYPTO_DIR, "opsware-ca.crt"))
            injectPost(ksobj, unsupported, agwIpPort, mid, (agentSrv, opswareCaCrt))
        injectDevice(ksobj, targetServer)
        writeFinalKs(ksobj)
        print "Successfully injected required settings"
    except (IOError, OSError, ProfileError, ShowErrorMessage), why:
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to inject required settings.%s\n" % why)
        return 1

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

This can be handled automatically when the BIOS setting for the VID is set to "Hidden".
When using SA functionality to use iLO and WinPE service OS of the Gen8-specific Intelligent Provisioning (G8IP),
the VID is visible. To prevent the Windows OS installation from installing Windows to the VID,
this step must be included early in the build plan.

While this build plan step is specific to WinPE G8IP service OS, it will not fail under other service OSs
(embedded or not) or on non G8 targets when used with the default settings. (See parameters below)

      device that runs the embedded WinPE service OS and can't discover the disk)
   -c ca_name | --ca ca_name

     carry the disk number found to be used as target disk

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Prepares the disks to be used as part of an OS installation on a HP ProLiant Gen8.
    This step works with both Linux and WinPE service OS.
"""
import sys
from optparse import OptionParser
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.osbp.vid import HPVid
from osprov.osbp.vid import DISK_CA_PARAMETER, DISK_CA_LINUX, DISK_CA_WINDOWS
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage, ProcessExecutionError, DiscoveryError, NotSupportedError
from osprov.osbp.TargetServer import GaiusWinPETargetServer

LOG = logger.getIt("Prepare Disks")

# ScriptWeaver will parametrize the @data@ below at run time
presetCA = {DISK_CA_LINUX: "@SystemDiskDevice@", DISK_CA_WINDOWS: "@SystemDiskNumber@"}

EC_SUCCESS = 0
EC_ERROR_MSG = 10
EC_PREP_DISK_ERROR = 20
EC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 30


def parseArgs(args):
    """ parse and normalise arguments for the script """
    parser = OptionParser()
    parser.add_option("-c", "--ca", metavar="CA",
                      default=None,
                      help="The name of the custom attribute to set")
    parser.add_option("-s", "--strict", metavar="STRICT",
                      action="store_true", default=False,
                      help="Preparing disk discovery errors are treated as fatal errors")
    parser.add_option("-v", "--withVID", metavar="WITHVID",
                      action="store_true", default=False,
                      help="HP ProLiant Gen8 VID handling")
    options, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    if args:
        parser.error("Additional positional arguments are not supported")
    return options


def main():
    """ Main entry point. """
    options = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        # Checking that the embedded WinPE OS was booted
        if not isinstance(targetServer, GaiusWinPETargetServer):
            if options.strict:
                print "Strict check option enabled - This step should be run on a Gen8-specific Intelligent \
Provisioning WinPE service OS, aborting the step as you don't use one"
                return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED
            else:
                print "You are not using the Gen8-specific Intelligent Provisioning WinPE service OS; \
skipping this step"
                return EC_SUCCESS
        vid = HPVid.factor(targetServer)
        if options.ca:
            # add content of the CA to the presetCA list
            presetCA[DISK_CA_PARAMETER] = vid.getTargetDeviceCA(options.ca)
        targetdevice = vid.findTargetBootDisk(presetCA, options.withVID)
        if targetdevice:
            print "Setting disk %s as boot target disk" % targetdevice
            vid.setTargetDeviceCA(targetdevice, caname=options.ca)
    except ProcessExecutionError, why:
        print "Execution error - Failed to prepare disks:"
        print why
        print why.stderr
        return EC_PREP_DISK_ERROR
    except NotSupportedError, why:
        print "Error while preparing disks:"
        print why
        if options.strict:
            print "Strict error handling option enabled - ending with error."
            return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED
        print "Step did not complete but returning success since the strict error handling option was not used."
        return EC_SUCCESS
    except DiscoveryError, why:
        print "Discovery Error - while preparing disks:"
        print why
        return EC_PREP_DISK_ERROR
    except ShowErrorMessage, why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        print why
        return EC_ERROR_MSG

    print "Preparing disks finished successfully."
    return EC_SUCCESS

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# lint_ignore=E501,I0011
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2010-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    This program will inject personalized settings into the autoinst.xml
    file.
"""

import sys
from cStringIO import StringIO

from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser, OptionValueError
from osprov.profile import AutoYaST
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.networking import validation
from osprov.networking.discovery import GenericNetworkDiscovery
from osprov import helpers

EC_NO_ERR = 0
EC_NO_CA = 20
EC_EXCEPTION = 100
AY_PATH = "tmp/user.autoinst.xml"

LOG = logger.getIt('inject_ay_pers')

HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""

def injectOesAddon(ay, oesMediaUrl):
    """
        Inject Novell OES Addon
    """
    ay.setNodeTextValue(ay.getNode("profile/add-on/add_on_products/listentry/media_url"), oesMediaUrl)



def initializeInterface(ay, provisioningNIC, netinfo, ipv6Managed):
    """ Initialize the interface definition in the AY profile

        Configure static vs DHCP configuration
    """
    ay.createPath("profile/networking/interfaces").setAttribute("config:type", "list")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(ay.createPath("profile/networking/interfaces/interface/device"), provisioningNIC.deviceName)
    ay.setNodeTextValue(ay.createPath("profile/networking/interfaces/interface/startmode"), "auto")
    interface = ay.createPath("profile/networking/interfaces/interface")

    # A static configuration will always have priority if static network info is defined
    bootproto = "dhcp"
    # Will always use the provided dns server names if provided
    dhcpdns = "true"
    # Will always use the provided hostname if provided
    dhcpname = "true"
    if ipv6Managed:
        if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks and provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks[0] and not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
            bootproto = "static"
        elif not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
            print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                  "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"
            sys.exit(37)
        if len(provisioningNIC.ipv6DnsServers) > 0:
            dhcpdns = "false"
        elif not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
            dhcpdns = "false"
        if netinfo.hostname:
            dhcpname = "false"
        elif not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
            dhcpname = "false"
    else:
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks and provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks[0]:
            bootproto = "static"
        elif not provisioningNIC.dhcpv4:
            print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                  "DHCP is turned off for IPv4 and there is no static address defined"
            sys.exit(38)
        if len(provisioningNIC.ipv4DnsServers) > 0:
            dhcpdns = "false"
        elif not provisioningNIC.dhcpv4:
            dhcpdns = "false"
        if netinfo.hostname:
            dhcpname = "false"
        elif not provisioningNIC.dhcpv4:
            dhcpname = "false"
    print "Configuring boot protocol to: %s" % bootproto
    ay.setNodeTextValue(ay.createPath("profile/networking/interfaces/interface/bootproto"), bootproto)

    dhcp_hostname = ay.createPath("profile/networking/dns/dhcp_hostname")
    dhcp_hostname.setAttribute("config:type", "boolean")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(dhcp_hostname, dhcpname)
    dhcp_resolv = ay.createPath("profile/networking/dns/dhcp_resolv")
    dhcp_resolv.setAttribute("config:type", "boolean")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(dhcp_resolv, dhcpdns)
    return interface


def personalizeDns(ay, provisioningNIC, ipv6Managed):
    """ Personalize the DNS settings """
    # will use just the DNS servers specific for the SOS mode ipv4/ipv6
    if ipv6Managed:
        providedDnsServers = provisioningNIC.ipv6DnsServers
    else:
        providedDnsServers = provisioningNIC.ipv4DnsServers
    if providedDnsServers:
        print "Will use name server(s): %s" % ",".join([str(x) for x in providedDnsServers])
        nameservers = ay.createPath("profile/networking/dns/nameservers")
        nameservers.setAttribute("config:type", "list")
    for dnsServer in providedDnsServers:
        nameserver = ay.document.createElement("nameserver")
        ay.setNodeTextValue(nameserver, dnsServer)
        nameservers.appendChild(nameserver)

    searchlist = ay.createPath("profile/networking/dns/searchlist")
    searchlist.setAttribute("config:type", "list")
    if provisioningNIC.dnsSearch:
        print "Will use search domain(s): %s" % ",".join(provisioningNIC.dnsSearch)
    for dnsSearch in provisioningNIC.dnsSearch:
        search = ay.document.createElement("search")
        ay.setNodeTextValue(search, dnsSearch)
        searchlist.appendChild(search)


def personalizeFqdn(ay, netinfo):
    """ Personalize the server FQDN """
    if netinfo.domainName:
        print "Setting domain name to: %s" % netinfo.domainName
        ay.setNodeTextValue(ay.createPath("profile/networking/dns/domain"), netinfo.domainName)
    if netinfo.hostname:
        print "Setting hostname to: %s" % netinfo.hostname
        ay.setNodeTextValue(ay.createPath("profile/networking/dns/hostname"), netinfo.hostname)


def personalizeGateway(ay, provisioningRoute):
    """ Inject Gateway settings """
    print "Will use default gateway: %s" % provisioningRoute.gateway
    routes = ay.createPath("profile/networking/routing/routes")
    routes.setAttribute("config:type", "list")
    route = ay.document.createElement("route")

    netmask = ay.document.createElement("netmask")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(netmask, "-")
    route.appendChild(netmask)

    destination = ay.document.createElement("destination")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(destination, "default")
    route.appendChild(destination)

    device = ay.document.createElement("device")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(device, "-")
    route.appendChild(device)

    gateway = ay.document.createElement("gateway")
    ay.setNodeTextValue(gateway, provisioningRoute.gateway)
    route.appendChild(gateway)

    routes.appendChild(route)


def injectPersonalization(ay, netinfo, ipv6Managed=False):
    """ Inject static networking configuration into the ay profile"""
    provisioningNIC = netinfo.getProvisioningNIC()
    print "Going to provision using interface with MAC address %s" % provisioningNIC.macAddress
    interface = initializeInterface(ay, provisioningNIC, netinfo, ipv6Managed)
    personalizeFqdn(ay, netinfo)
    personalizeDns(ay, provisioningNIC, ipv6Managed)

    if ipv6Managed:
        if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks and not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
            ipv6Network = provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks[0]  # we will configure just the first network
            print "Configuring IPv6 network: %s" % ipv6Network
            ipv6_config = ay.createPath("profile/networking/ipv6_config")
            ipv6_config.setAttribute("config:type", "boolean")
            ay.setNodeTextValue(ipv6_config, "true")
            ipaddr = ay.document.createElement("ipaddr")
            ay.setNodeTextValue(ipaddr, ipv6Network.ip)
            interface.appendChild(ipaddr)
            netmask = ay.document.createElement("prefixlen")
            ay.setNodeTextValue(netmask, ipv6Network.prefixlen)
            interface.appendChild(netmask)

        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Found IPv6-based service OS, ignoring IPv4 network personalization"

    else:
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            ipv4Network = provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks[0]  # we will configure just the first network
            print "Configuring IPv4 network: %s" % ipv4Network
            ipaddr = ay.document.createElement("ipaddr")
            ay.setNodeTextValue(ipaddr, ipv4Network.ip)
            interface.appendChild(ipaddr)
            netmask = ay.document.createElement("netmask")
            ay.setNodeTextValue(netmask, ipv4Network.netmask)
            interface.appendChild(netmask)

        if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
            print "Found IPv4-based service OS, ignoring IPv6 network personalization"

    if ipv6Managed:
        provisioningRoutes = [iproute for iproute in netinfo.ipv6Routes if iproute.nic == provisioningNIC]
    else:
        provisioningRoutes = [iproute for iproute in netinfo.ipv4Routes if iproute.nic == provisioningNIC]
    if len(provisioningRoutes) > 0:
        personalizeGateway(ay, provisioningRoutes[0])  # will keep just 1 gateway


def writeAyFile(ayFile, ay):
    """ Write the autoyast file to disk  """
    ayf = open(ayFile, "w+")
    ayf.write(str(ay))
    ayf.close()


def getOptions():
    """Returns the command-line options."""
    optparser = OptionParser()
    optparser.add_option("--require-netconfig", default="false")
    optparser.add_option("--oesMediaUrl",
                         metavar="URL", default=None,
                         help="Specify the Novell OES add-on path.")
    optparser.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                         default=False,
                         help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")
    (options, args) = optparser.parse_args()
    del args
    if not options.require_netconfig.lower() in ("true", "false"):
        raise OptionValueError(
            "Invalid value for --require-netconfig: %s.\nShould be 'true' or 'false'.")
    options.require_netconfig = options.require_netconfig.lower() == "true"

    return options


def main():
    """ Parse and inject netconfig in the AY profile """
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        options = getOptions()

        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(
            StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
            activeMacAddress=targetServer.getMACAddress(),
            ipv6default=targetServer.isIPv6Managed(),
            log=LOG
        )
        netinfo = netconfigParser.info()
        if netinfo.oldSyntax and not options.disableWarning:
            newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
            print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

        typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
        if typosList:
            print("The following keys were not recognized in the netconfig CA and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

        if not HPSA_NETCONFIG and options.require_netconfig:
            print "Network configuration (hpsa_netconfig) for this server was not found, even though "
            print "it is required by the value true of the CA require_netconfig. "
            print "Check the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and verify the target server "
            print "has been configured for static networking."
            return 1

        validation.validateProvisioningNIC(netinfo.getProvisioningNIC(), targetServer)
        # Populating device names according to SOS detection
        GenericNetworkDiscovery(targetServer).discoverInterfaceNames(netinfo)

        ayObj = AutoYaST(open(AY_PATH))
        injectPersonalization(ayObj, netinfo, targetServer.isIPv6Managed())
        if options.oesMediaUrl:
            injectOesAddon(ayObj, options.oesMediaUrl)
        writeAyFile(AY_PATH, ayObj)
    except (OSError, IOError, ShowErrorMessage), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        print "Failed to inject personalization settings:\n%s" % why
        return EC_EXCEPTION


if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# lint_ignore=E501,I0011
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2009-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Injects personalization settings into Unattend.xml

    This consists of the following:
    * The magic custom attributes: ComputerName, ProductKey, AdminPassword
    * Network settings from the DHCPless feature
"""
import os
import re
import sys
from cStringIO import StringIO

from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser, OptionValueError
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.profile import unattend
from osprov import helpers
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.networking import validation

LOG = logger.getIt("inject personalization")

EC_NO_ERR = 0
EC_USAGE = 1
EC_TARGET_SERVER = 5
EC_NO_CA = 20
EC_NO_UNATTEND = 12
EC_EXCEPTION = 100
USAGE = "Usage: %s Unattend_path_in_OGFS"

HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""
COMPUTER_NAME = """@ComputerName@"""


def determineHostname(netinfo):
    """ Determin the hotname based on hpsa_netconfig and ComputerName CAs """
    if COMPUTER_NAME and "@" not in COMPUTER_NAME:
        LOG.debug("Computer name set from CA %s", COMPUTER_NAME)
        return COMPUTER_NAME
    elif netinfo.hostname:
        LOG.debug("Computer name set from hpsa_netconfig %s", netinfo.hostname)
        return netinfo.hostname
    else:
        return "*"


def getOptions():
    """Returns the command-line options."""
    optparser = OptionParser()
    optparser.add_option("--require-netconfig", default="false")
    optparser.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                        default=False,
                        help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")
    (options, args) = optparser.parse_args()
    if not options.require_netconfig.lower() in ("true", "false"):
        raise OptionValueError(
            "Invalid value for --require-netconfig: %s.\nShould be 'true' or 'false'.")
    options.require_netconfig = options.require_netconfig.lower() == "true"
    return (options, args)


def injectXmlPersonalization(unattendPathOGFS, netinfo, isIPv6Managed):
    """ Inject the personalization in the XML profile """
    provisioningNIC = [x for x in netinfo.nics if x.provisioning][0]
    print "Going to provision through interface with MAC address %s" % provisioningNIC.macAddress

    if isIPv6Managed:
        if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
            print "Configuring IPv6 networks: %s" % str(provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks)
        elif provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: auto ipv6"
        else:
            print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                  "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"
            sys.exit(37)
    else:
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
            print "Configuring IPv4 networks: %s" % str(provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks)
        elif provisioningNIC.dhcpv4:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: dhcp"
        else:
            print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                  "DHCP is turned off for IPv4 and there is no static address defined"
            sys.exit(38)

    if not isIPv6Managed and provisioningNIC.ipv4DnsServers:
        print "Will use name server(s) %s" % str(provisioningNIC.ipv4DnsServers)
    elif isIPv6Managed and provisioningNIC.ipv6DnsServers:
        print "Will use name server(s) %s" % str(provisioningNIC.ipv6DnsServers)

    provisioningRoutes = [iproute for iproute in (netinfo.ipv6Routes if isIPv6Managed else netinfo.ipv4Routes) if iproute.nic == provisioningNIC]
    provisioningRoute = provisioningRoutes[0] if provisioningRoutes else None
    if provisioningRoute is not None:
        print "Will use default gateway: %s" % provisioningRoute.gateway

    unattendFile = unattend.Unattend(unattendPathOGFS)
    unattendFile.addInterface(provisioningNIC, provisioningRoutes, isIPv6Managed)
    unattendFile.addDns(provisioningNIC, netinfo, isIPv6Managed)
    unattendFile.replaceComputerNameXml(determineHostname(netinfo))

    return unattendFile.toXml()


def discoverUnattendPath(args):
    """ discover the path to the anwser file  """
    if args:
        return args[0]
    else:
        commonPaths = [
            "X/Windows/Temp/Unattend.xml",
            helpers.getSystemDrive("@SystemDrive:C@") + "/Windows/Panther/unattend.xml",
        ]
        for unattendPathOGFS in commonPaths:
            if os.path.isfile(unattendPathOGFS):
                return unattendPathOGFS
        raise ShowErrorMessage(USAGE % sys.argv[0] + "\n")


@HandleShowErrorMessage("Inject Personalizations", LOG)
def main():
    """ Main entry point """

    options, args = getOptions()

    if not HPSA_NETCONFIG and options.require_netconfig:
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Network configuration (hpsa_netconfig) for this server was not found, even though \n" +
            "it is required by the value true of the CA require_netconfig.\n" +
            "Check the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and verify the target server\n" +
            "has been configured for static networking."
        )

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
    isIPv6Managed = targetServer.isIPv6Managed()

    netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(
        StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
        activeMacAddress=targetServer.getMACAddress(),
        ipv6default=isIPv6Managed,
        log=LOG
    )
    netinfo = netconfigParser.info()
    if netinfo.oldSyntax and not options.disableWarning:
        newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
        print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

    typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
    if typosList:
        print("The following keys were not recognized in the netconfig CA and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

    validation.validateProvisioningNIC(netinfo.getProvisioningNIC(), targetServer)

    unattendPathOGFS = discoverUnattendPath(args)
    profileContents = targetServer.readFile(unattendPathOGFS)

    if unattendPathOGFS.lower().endswith(".xml"):
        profileContents = injectXmlPersonalization(unattendPathOGFS, netinfo, isIPv6Managed)
    else:
        print "Nothing to inject for: %s" % unattendPathOGFS
    LOG.debug("Using profile:\n%s", profileContents)
    try:
        targetServer.writeFile(unattendPathOGFS, profileContents)
    except (IOError, OSError) as why:
        raise ShowErrorMessage("Unable to write unattend file: %s" % why, cause=why)
if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2012-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
"""

import sys
import os

from optparse import OptionError
from osprov.profile import unattend
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage, NotFoundError
from osprov import helpers


# pylint: disable=F0401,E0611
from pytwist.com.opsware.custattr import NoSuchFieldException
# pylint: enable=F0401,E0611

LOG = logger.getIt("inject required unattend")

USAGE = "Usage: %s Unattend_path_in_OGFS"
EC_EXCEPTION = 100
SYSTEM_DISK_NUMBER_CA = """@SystemDiskNumber@"""
WINDOWS_PARTITION_ID_CA = """@WindowsPartitionID@"""


class InjectRequiredUnattendOptionParser(OptionParser):
    """ Option parser for this step """

    def defineOptions(self):
        self.add_option("--WindowsPartitionID", type="string",
                        help="Specifies how to handle <PartitionID> tag from unattend.xml"
                             "Arguments:"
                             "--WindowsPartitionID=Skip : doesn't change the <PartitionID> tag from unattend.xml"
                             "--WindowsPartitionID=Autodetect : try to autodetect the the correct partition id and write it to unattend.xml"
                             "--WindowsPartitionID=1 : a number representing the partition id to be used in unattend.xml")
        self.add_option("--unattend", type="string",
                        help="Specify the path to unattend.xml file")

    def validateArgs(self, opt, args):
        if opt.WindowsPartitionID:
            validArgument = False
            if opt.WindowsPartitionID.isdigit():
                validArgument = True
            if opt.WindowsPartitionID.lower() in ['skip', 'autodetect']:
                validArgument = True
            if not validArgument:
                raise OptionError(
                    "Invalid value for '--WindowsPartitionID' " + opt.WindowsPartitionID, "WindowsPartitionID")


def handleCredentials(targetServer):
    """ Persist the credentials to access the server """
    keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
    keys.profile.username = "@DomainName@\\@DomainUser@"
    keys.profile.password = "@DomainPassword@"
    helpers.putDataStore(keys, targetServer)


def injectWindowsPartitionId(targetServer, unattendFilePath, options):
    partitionId = None

    # check if we have to change <PartitionID> tag
    if not options.WindowsPartitionID:
        return
    if options.WindowsPartitionID.lower() == "skip":
        return

    # check if we have to autodetect the partition id
    if options.WindowsPartitionID.lower() == "autodetect":
        # get partitionId from datastore
        datastore = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer=targetServer, log=LOG)
        if datastore.windows.partition_id:
            partitionId = datastore.windows.partition_id
        else:
            raise ShowErrorMessage(
                "Unable to autodetect Windows Partition Id", EC_EXCEPTION)

    # check if client provided to us the partition id
    if options.WindowsPartitionID.isdigit():
        partitionId = options.WindowsPartitionID

    if partitionId == None:
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "No valid value for Windows Partition Id", EC_EXCEPTION)

    # replace PartitionID
    try:
        unattendFile = unattend.Unattend(unattendFilePath)
        unattendFile.replacePartitionIdXml(partitionId)
        targetServer.writeFile(unattendFilePath, unattendFile.toXml())
    except OSError, error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)
    except IOError, error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)


def handleProductKey(targetServer, unattendFilePath):
    try:
        unattendFile = unattend.Unattend(unattendFilePath)
        trimmed = unattendFile.trimProductKey()
        if trimmed:
            print "Warning: Whitespaces were removed from the product key."
        unattendFile.validateProductKeyThroughUnattend()
        targetServer.writeFile(unattendFilePath, unattendFile.toXml())
    except NotFoundError as error:
        LOG.exception(error)
    except OSError as error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)
    except IOError as error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)


def handleDiskIdChange(targetServer, unattendFilePath):
    # get partitionId from datastore
    datastore = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer=targetServer, log=LOG)
    if datastore.windows.disk_id is None:
        return
    diskId = datastore.windows.disk_id
    # replace DiskId
    try:
        unattendFile = unattend.Unattend(unattendFilePath)
        unattendFile.replaceDiskId(diskId)
        targetServer.writeFile(unattendFilePath, unattendFile.toXml())
    except OSError, error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)
    except IOError, error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)


def handleUnattendXML(targetServer, options):
    targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
    if not options.unattend:
        discoveredDefault = False
        commonPaths = []
        commonPaths.append("X/Windows/Temp/Unattend.xml")  # 2012 OS Media
        commonPaths.append("@SystemDrive:C@/Windows/Panther/unattend.xml")  # 2012 WIM
        for unattendPathOGFS in commonPaths:
            if os.path.isfile(unattendPathOGFS):
                discoveredDefault = True
                break
        if not discoveredDefault:
            raise ShowErrorMessage(USAGE % sys.argv[0] + "\n")
    else:
        unattendPathOGFS = options.unattend

    # inject the proper "<PartitionId>?</PartitionId>" if necessary
    injectWindowsPartitionId(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS, options)
    # inject the proper "<DiskID>?</DiskID>" if necessary
    handleProductKey(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS)
    handleDiskIdChange(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS)
    # do cleanup in unattend.xml
    cleanUnattendXML(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS)


def cleanUnattendXML(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS):
    try:
        profile = unattend.Unattend(unattendPathOGFS)
        cleanEmptyElementsXML(profile)
        targetServer.writeFile(unattendPathOGFS, profile.toXml())
    except OSError, error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)
    except IOError, error:
        LOG.exception(error)
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to update answer file over OGFS. %s" % error.args[0], EC_EXCEPTION)


def cleanEmptyElementsXML(profile):
    settings = profile.doc.getElementsByTagName("settings")
    nodes_under_specialize_pass = profile._getNodeListByNameValue(settings, "pass", "specialize")
    if nodes_under_specialize_pass:
        specialize_node = nodes_under_specialize_pass[0].parentNode
        profile.removeEmptyElements(specialize_node)
    return profile.toXml()


@HandleShowErrorMessage("Inject Required Unattend", LOG)
def main():
    """ main entry point in the script """

    # get and parse arguments
    options, remainingArgs = InjectRequiredUnattendOptionParser().parse_args()

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    handleCredentials(targetServer)
    handleUnattendXML(targetServer, options)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())
