#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    This python script tries to boot a machine into the user selected Service OS.
"""

import sys
from cStringIO import StringIO

from osprov import boot
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.power import getPowerController
from osprov.errors import PowerControlException
from osprov.boot import OTBNotSupportedError, NetworkBootController
from osprov.osbp.TargetServer import GaiusWinPETargetServer, SlesSOSTargetServer


from pytwist.com.opsware.common import OpswareException, OpswareSystemException

log = logger.getIt("Boot")

EC_OK = 0
EC_INVALID_ARGS = 1
EC_UNSUPPORTED = 2
EC_FAILED_BOOT = 3
EC_FAILED_BOOT_SETUP = 4
EC_FAILED_POWER_OFF = 5

HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""
REQUIRE_NETCONFIG = "@require_netconfig:false@"


class BootStepOptionsParser(OptionParser):

    def defineOptions(self):
        self.add_option("--serviceOS",
                        help="The Service OS to boot into."
                        "Possible options: linux32, linux64 (linux), linux64_6, linux64_7, winpe32, winpe64 (winpe), winpe64_40, solaris")
        self.add_option("--method", default="auto",
                        help="it represents the boot method to be used.")
        self.add_option("--force", action="store_true", default=False,
                        help="Forces the boot configuration and reboot of the target server.")
        self.add_option("--ipv6", action="store_true", default=False,
                        help="Starts the selected Service OS in IPv6 mode")
        self.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                        default=False,
                        help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")


def isSameStack(targetServer, ipv6Opt):
    return targetServer.isIPv6Managed(cached=False) == ipv6Opt


def isSameBootMethod(targetServer, bootMethod):
    return ("embedded"
            if isinstance(targetServer, GaiusWinPETargetServer) or
            isinstance(targetServer, SlesSOSTargetServer) else
            "network") == bootMethod


def isSameArch(targetServer, serviceOS):
    return targetServer.is64bit(cached=False) == ("32" not in serviceOS)


def isSameOS(targetServer, bootcontroller, serviceOS):
    if isinstance(bootcontroller, NetworkBootController):
        serviceOS = bootcontroller.getPXEOptionForServiceOS(serviceOS)
    if ("linux" in serviceOS) and ("linux" in targetServer.PXEOption):
        return ("7" in serviceOS and "7" in targetServer.PXEOption) or \
               (not "7" in serviceOS and not "7" in targetServer.PXEOption)
    else:
        # it's ok to not differentiate winpe64 from winpe64_40
        return serviceOS[:5] in targetServer.PXEOption


def shouldSkip(targetServer, bootcontroller, options):
    return isSameOS(targetServer, bootcontroller, options.serviceOS) \
           and isSameStack(targetServer, options.ipv6) \
           and isSameBootMethod(targetServer, bootcontroller.getName()) \
           and isSameArch(targetServer, options.serviceOS) \
           and not options.force


@HandleShowErrorMessage("boot target server", log)
def main():
    """ build plan script to boot the target system """
    parser = BootStepOptionsParser()
    options, args = parser.parse_args()

    serviceOS = options.serviceOS
    method = options.method

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()

    print("Boot method: " + method)
    bootController = boot.getBootController(targetServer, serviceOS=serviceOS,
                                            ipv6=options.ipv6, method=method, log=log)

    if targetServer.isMaintenance():
        if not targetServer.isAccessible():
            print "The target server is in MAINTENANCE but not accessible, continuing..."
        elif shouldSkip(targetServer, bootController, options):
            print "Skipping boot configuration, the target server is booted into the same Service OS with the same architecture, IP stack and boot method."
            return EC_OK

    powerController = getPowerController(targetServer, log=log)
    try:
        # powering off so that the running system would not interfere with changing system settings
        if not targetServer.isAgentListening():
            print ("Agent is unreachable. Powering off server...")
            powerController.poweroff()
    except PowerControlException, why:
        log.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to power off server: %s" % str(why))
        return EC_FAILED_POWER_OFF

    try:
        print("Configuring boot to Service OS: %s" % serviceOS)
        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
                                                   activeMacAddress=None,
                                                   ipv6default=targetServer.isIPv6Managed(),
                                                   log=log)
        netconfig = netconfigParser.info()
        if netconfig.oldSyntax and not options.disableWarning:
            newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
            print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

        typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
        if typosList:
            print("The following keys were not recognized in the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

        try:
            bootController.configureBoot(serviceOS, netconfig, ipv6=options.ipv6)
        except OTBNotSupportedError as why:
            log.exception(why)
            print('Warning: The server needs to boot from the network, but no suitable management path was found to set '
                  'one time boot. Ensure that "Network" is set first in the boot order if it fails')

        print("Rebooting the target server...")
        targetServer.reboot(powerController)
    except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException), why:
        log.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to boot:\n%s\n" % str(why))
        return EC_FAILED_BOOT
    return EC_OK

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

CURRENT_STEP_CHECKPOINT_CA = "CurrentStepCheckpoint"


def getCurrentStep():
    return long(os.environ["CURRENT_STEP_NO"])


def main():
    argsParser = ArgumentParser()

                            default=CURRENT_STEP_CHECKPOINT_CA,

    args = argsParser.parse_args()

    currentStep = getCurrentStep()
    ThisTargetServer().writeCustomAttribute(args.name, str(currentStep))
    print "Created checkpoint '%s' to step %d " % (args.name, currentStep)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2009-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Injects personalization settings specific to Domain and WorkGroup into Unattend.xml

    This consists of the following:
    * The magic custom attributes: DomainName, DomainUser, DomainPassword, WorkGroup
"""
import os
import sys

from osprov.profile import unattend
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov import helpers

LOG = logger.getIt("inject domain or workgroup")

EC_NO_ERR = 0
EC_USAGE = 1
EC_TARGET_SERVER = 5
EC_NO_CA = 20
EC_NO_UNATTEND = 12
EC_EXCEPTION = 100
EC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 21
USAGE = "Usage: %s Unattend_path_in_OGFS"


def _open(filePath, fileMode="r"):
    return open(filePath, fileMode)


def injectXML(unattendFile):
    """inject into XML """

    # Check for the specialize pass. This is not a required pass.
    settings = unattendFile.doc.getElementsByTagName("settings")
    nodes_under_specialize_pass = unattendFile._getNodeListByNameValue(
        settings, "pass", "specialize")

    if not nodes_under_specialize_pass:
        # There is no specialize_pass. We must create everything.
        specialize_node = unattendFile.createSpecializePass()
        # Put <settings pass="specialize"> inside of <unattend>
        settings[0].parentNode.appendChild(specialize_node)
    else:
        specialize_node = nodes_under_specialize_pass[0].parentNode

    #...
    specialize_components = specialize_node.getElementsByTagName("component")
    component = unattendFile.domainOrWorkGroupConfiguration(
        """@DomainName@""", """@DomainUser@""", """@DomainPassword@""", """@WorkGroup@""")
    specialize_node.appendChild(component)

    # QC 151176 - specialize phases will fail if there are empty elements, for some known elements.
    unattendFile.removeEmptyElements(specialize_node)


def injectDomainWorkGroupSettings(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS):
    """ Do the injecting """
    unattendPathOGFS = targetServer.expandEnvVars(unattendPathOGFS)
    unattendPathOGFS = targetServer.pathToOGFS(unattendPathOGFS)
    if not os.path.isfile(unattendPathOGFS):
        raise ShowErrorMessage("Could not find Unattend file at %s." %
                               unattendPathOGFS, EC_NO_UNATTEND)
    #"""This step will only support Windows 2008 or higher as it only supports xml"""
    if unattendPathOGFS[-3:].lower() == "xml":
        unattendFile = unattend.Unattend(unattendPathOGFS)
        injectXML(unattendFile)
        fileData = unattendFile.toXml()
    else:
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Not supported type of Unattend file.", EC_NOT_SUPPORTED)

    try:
        outFile = _open(unattendPathOGFS, "w")
        outFile.write(fileData)
        outFile.close()
        print "Answer file at '%s' successfully updated\n" % unattendPathOGFS
    except OSError, error:
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "Unable to write updated answer file over OGFS. %s. " % error, EC_EXCEPTION)


@HandleShowErrorMessage("Inject Domain or Workgroup", LOG)
def main():
    """ Main entry point """
    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())

    unattendPathOGFS = None
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        discoveredDefault = False
        commonPaths = []
        commonPaths.append("X/Windows/Temp/Unattend.xml")  # 2008 OS Media
        commonPaths.append(helpers.getSystemDrive(
            "@SystemDrive:C@") + "/Windows/Panther/unattend.xml")  # 2008 WIM
        for unattendPathOGFS in commonPaths:
            if os.path.isfile(unattendPathOGFS):
                discoveredDefault = True
                break
        if not discoveredDefault:
            raise ShowErrorMessage(USAGE % sys.argv[0] + "\n")
    else:
        unattendPathOGFS = sys.argv[1]
    injectDomainWorkGroupSettings(targetServer, unattendPathOGFS)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

allVersions.usage:
Step to hide or unhide the Virtual Installation Device (VID) of HP ProLiant Gen8 devices.
When the BIOS setting for the VID is set to its default "Hidden" this is handled automatically.
When using SA functionality based on iLO and a Gen8-specific Intelligent Provisioning service OS (Linux or Windows PE) the VID is visible during the execution of the embedded Service OS.
To prevent OS installations from trying to install the OS to the VID, this step can be used early in the build plan. It uses the hponcfg utility.

While this build plan step is specific to HP ProLiant Gen8 servers, it will not fail on non HP ProLiant Gen8
targets when used with the default settings. (See parameters below)

Usage:
   [-s | --strict ] [-h | --hideVID ] [-u | --unhideVID ]

Where:
   -s | --strict 
      HP ProLiant VID handling errors are treated as fatal errors
   -h | --hideVID
      Hide HP ProLiant VID
   -u | --unhideVID
      Unhide HP ProLiant VID
      This step has no default behavior.
      Exactly one of the options -h (--hideVID) or -u (--unhideVID) must be used

Prerequisites:
- Target servers runs a maintenance Linux or Windows PE OS.

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-

#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Prepares the disks to be used as part of an OS installation on a HP ProLiant Gen8++ .
    This step works with both Linux and WinPE service OS.
"""
import sys
from optparse import OptionParser
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.osbp.vid import HPVid
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage, ProcessExecutionError, NotSupportedError

LOG = logger.getIt("Handle ProLiant VID")

EC_SUCCESS = 0
EC_ERROR_MSG = 10
EC_HANDLE_VID_ERROR = 20
EC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 30


def parseArgs(args):
    """ parse and normalise arguments for the script """
    parser = OptionParser()
    parser.add_option("-s", "--strict", metavar="STRICT",
                      action="store_true", default=False,
                      help="HP ProLiant VID handling errors are treated as fatal errors")
    # using -d and not the maybe more logical -h here as -h is reserved for help ...
    parser.add_option("-d", "--hideVID", metavar="HIDEVID",
                      action="store_true", default=False,
                      help="Hide HP ProLiant VID")
    parser.add_option("-u", "--unhideVID", metavar="UNHIDEVID",
                      action="store_true", default=False,
                      help="Unhide HP ProLiant VID /n"
                      "This step has no default behavior. /n"
                      "Exactly one of the options -h (--hideVID) or -u (--unhideVID) must be used.")
    options, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    # checking proper options
    if args:
        parser.error("Additional positional arguments are not supported")
    if options.hideVID and options.unhideVID:
        parser.error(
            "Options -d (--hideVID) and -u (--unhideVID) are mutually exclusive - please use only one of them")
    if not options.hideVID and not options.unhideVID:
        parser.error(
            "No option given. Exactly one of the options -d (--hideVID) or -u (--unhideVID) must be used")
    return options


def main():
    """ Main entry point. """

    options = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        vid = HPVid.factor(targetServer)
        if options.hideVID:
            vid.hideVID()
        elif options.unhideVID:
            vid.unhideVID()
    except ProcessExecutionError, why:
        print "Execution error - Failed to handle HP ProLiant Virtual Installation Device (VID):"
        print why
        print why.stderr
        return EC_HANDLE_VID_ERROR
    except NotSupportedError, why:
        print "Error while handling HP ProLiant Virtual Installation Device (VID):"
        print why
        if options.strict:
            print "Strict error handling option enabled - ending with error."
            return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED
        print "Step did not complete but returning success since the strict error handling option was not used."
        return EC_SUCCESS
    except ShowErrorMessage, why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        print why
        return EC_ERROR_MSG

    print "HP ProLiant VID handling finished successfully."
    return EC_SUCCESS

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
    (C) Copyright 2012-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Clean up old MAC addresses from source VM
"""

import os
import glob
import ConfigParser
import StringIO

from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov import constants

LOG = logger.getIt("cleanup_old_macs")


def cleanup_persistent_rules(root_mount_dir):
    net_rules_path = root_mount_dir + '/etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules'
    if os.path.exists(net_rules_path):
        os.unlink(net_rules_path)
        LOG.debug("Cleaning up file with old MAC address: " + net_rules_path)


def is_a_backup_file(ifcfg_filename):
    filename, extension = os.path.splitext(ifcfg_filename)
    # bak is from observations, the rest are documented here
    # https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/pdf/Networking_Guide/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux-7-Networking_Guide-en-US.pdf
    return extension in ['.bak', '.old', '.orig', '.rpmnew', '.rpmorig', '.rpmsave']


def extract_interface_name(ifcfg_filename):
    return ifcfg_filename.split("/ifcfg-")[-1]


def remove_quotes_from_string(interface_type):
    single_quote = "'"
    double_quote = '"'
    return interface_type.replace(single_quote, '').replace(double_quote, '')


def is_ethernet_type(ifcfg_filename):
    sectioned_content = '[root]\n' + open(ifcfg_filename, 'r').read()
    fp = StringIO.StringIO(sectioned_content)
    config = ConfigParser.RawConfigParser()
    config.readfp(fp, filename=ifcfg_filename)

    try:
        interface_type = config.get('root', 'TYPE')
        unquoted_interface_type = remove_quotes_from_string(interface_type)
        return unquoted_interface_type.lower() in ['ethernet']
    except ConfigParser.NoOptionError, e:
        return True


def is_loopback_interface(interface_name):
    return interface_name == "lo" \
        or interface_name.startswith("lo:") \
        or interface_name.startswith("lo-")


def find_ethernet_interfaces(network_scripts_dir):
    result = []

    ifcfg_path = network_scripts_dir + '/ifcfg-*'
    for ifcfg_filename in glob.glob(ifcfg_path):
        if is_a_backup_file(ifcfg_filename):
            continue

        if is_ethernet_type(ifcfg_filename):
            interface_name = extract_interface_name(ifcfg_filename)

            if is_loopback_interface(interface_name):
                continue

            result.append((interface_name, ifcfg_filename))

    return result


def reset_ifcfg_files_to_allow_guest_customization(root_mount_dir):
    interfaces = find_ethernet_interfaces(root_mount_dir + '/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts')
    LOG.debug("guest customization will minimize contents of NICs: " + str(interfaces))

    for dvc, ifcfg_path in interfaces:
        # QC150287 - when these files contain more than the minimal information, then guest customization fails
        # Over-write contents of file to minimal information.
        # This minimal information will be over-written when Guest Customization script
        #     performs network personalization.
        ifcfg = open(ifcfg_path, "w")
        ifcfg.write("DEVICE=" + dvc + "\n")
        ifcfg.write("BOOTPROTO=dhcp\n")
        ifcfg.write("ONBOOT=yes\n")
        ifcfg.write("PEERDNS=yes\n")
        ifcfg.close()


def disable_kudzu(root_mount_dir):
    kudzu_path = root_mount_dir + '/etc/init.d/kudzu'
    if os.path.exists(kudzu_path):
        LOG.info("Disabling kudzu. New network interfaces were already configured:" + kudzu_path)
        kudzu_rc_path = root_mount_dir + '/etc/rc*.d/*kudzu'
        filenames = glob.glob(kudzu_rc_path)
        for filename in filenames:
            LOG.debug("Removing symlink for kudzu:" + filename)
            os.unlink(filename)


def main():
    TARGET = ThisTargetServer()
    MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR = TARGET.pathToOGFS(constants.OGFS_SYSTEM_ROOT)

    # clean up files with old MAC addresses while still in maintenance mode
    cleanup_persistent_rules(MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR)

    # for each ifcfg file, use minimal settings to avoid issues in guest customization
    reset_ifcfg_files_to_allow_guest_customization(MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR)

    disable_kudzu(MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

"""
    (C) Copyright 2011-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    This python script executes a sleep command for a specified number of seconds
"""

import sys
import time

from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp import logger
from optparse import OptionValueError

log = logger.getIt("Sleep")

EC_OK = 0
EC_INVALID_ARGS = 1

DEFAULT_BRAKE_VALUE = 0


class SleepOptionsParser(OptionParser):

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """  init the option parser """
        OptionParser.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
        self.add_option("--seconds", default=DEFAULT_BRAKE_VALUE, type="int",
                        help="Specify how many seconds we should sleep before executing the next step in the build plan.")
        self.add_option("--minutes", default=DEFAULT_BRAKE_VALUE, type="int",
                        help="Specify how many minutes we should sleep before executing the next step in the build plan.")

    def validateArgs(self, opt, args):
        if not opt.seconds and not opt.minutes:
            raise OptionValueError("Missing required argument: seconds or minutes")
        if (opt.seconds == 0 and opt.minutes == 0) or (opt.seconds < 0) or (opt.minutes < 0):
            raise OptionValueError("Invalid arguments or argument values. Seconds or minutes should be integer and "
                                   "have values larger than 0.")


@HandleShowErrorMessage("sleep step", log)
def main():
    """ build plan script to boot the target system """
    parser = SleepOptionsParser()
    options, args = parser.parse_args()

    seconds = int(options.seconds)
    minutes = int(options.minutes)

    secondsToSleep = minutes * 60 + seconds

    print("Delaying next step for %i seconds..." % secondsToSleep)
    time.sleep(secondsToSleep)
    return EC_OK

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

    will take advantage of the Flow Control and preferably skip

"""

import sys

from osprov.osbp import logger
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser
from optparse import OptionValueError

LOG = logger.getIt("skip steps based on custom attribute")
VALID_VALUES = (['yes', 'y', '1'], ['no', 'n', '0'])


class SkipStepsCAOptionParser(OptionParser):
    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        OptionParser.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
        self.usage = "Skip steps based on Custom Attribute"

    def defineOptions(self):
        self.set_defaults(CA="", skipSteps=0)
        self.add_option("--CA", dest="CA", type='string',
                        help="Value of the specified CA.")
        self.add_option("--skipSteps", dest="skipSteps", type="int", help="Number of steps that will be skipped.")

    def validateArgs(self, opt, args):
        if opt.CA.lower() == "":
            print "The mentioned Custom Attribute is not present or it's value is null. Will not skip any step."
            return
        if opt.CA.lower() not in (VALID_VALUES[0] + VALID_VALUES[1]):
            raise OptionValueError("The provided CA value '%s' is not supported. Please provide one of the following : %s" % (opt.CA, str(VALID_VALUES)))
        if opt.skipSteps < 0:
            raise OptionValueError("Invalid arguments or argument values. SkipSteps should be integer and have values larger than 0.")


def skipNumberOfSteps(CAValue, skipSteps):
    if (CAValue.lower() in VALID_VALUES[0]):
        print '''
Begin Flow Control:
    Forward to step +%s
End Flow Control''' % (skipSteps + 1)


@HandleShowErrorMessage("skip steps based on custom attribute", LOG)
def main():
    parser = SkipStepsCAOptionParser()
    options, args = parser.parse_args()
    skipNumberOfSteps(options.CA, options.skipSteps)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    This python script controls the boot mode of a ProLiant target server.
"""

import sys
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser, OptionValueError
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from pytwist.com.opsware.common import OpswareException, OpswareSystemException
from pytwist.com.opsware.ilo import ServerBootMode
from osprov import ilo

log = logger.getIt("Control Boot Mode")

EC_OK = 0
EC_INVALID_ARGS = 1
EC_UNSUPPORTED_BOOTMODE = 2
EC_FAILED_SWITCHBOOTMODE = 3
EC_ERROR_SWITCHBOOTMODE = 4


class CtrlBootModeOptionsParser(OptionParser):

    """ Custom option parser """

    def defineOptions(self):
        """ add the options """
        self.prog = "ctrlbootmode"
        self.set_usage("%s [options]" % self.prog)
        self.add_option("-m", "--bootmode", default=None,
                        help="The boot mode to switch to. "
                        "Possible options are: %s" % ' '.join(ilo.VALID_BOOTMODES))

    def validateArgs(self, opt, args):
        """ parameter validation """
        if not opt.bootmode:
            raise OptionValueError("Missing mandatory parameter --bootmode\n")
        if not opt.bootmode in ilo.VALID_BOOTMODES:
            raise OptionValueError("Value for --bootmode parameter is invalid: %s\n" % opt.bootmode)
        if args:
            raise OptionValueError("No other arguments allowed: %s\n" % args)


@HandleShowErrorMessage("control target server boot mode ", log)
def main():
    """ build plan script to control boot mode of target system """

    # parameter handling
    parser = CtrlBootModeOptionsParser()
    options, args = parser.parse_args()

    bootmode = options.bootmode.upper()
    print("Boot mode to switch target server to: %s" % bootmode)

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    iloServer = ilo.getIlo(targetServer, log=log)

    # first testing target server for supported and current boot mode to
    # prevent unnecessary switching
    if not iloServer.isBootModeSupported(iloServer.getBaseBootMode(bootmode)):
        print("Requested boot mode %s not supported on target server\n"
              "Stopping and leaving boot mode unchanged." % bootmode)
        return EC_UNSUPPORTED_BOOTMODE

    currentbootmode = iloServer.getCurrentBootMode()
    if currentbootmode == bootmode:
        print ("Target server is already in boot mode %s" % bootmode)
    else:
        print ("Switching target server from current boot mode %s to %s. "
               "This will take some time..." % (currentbootmode, bootmode))
        iloServer.switchBootMode(bootmode)
        # double check...
        if iloServer.getCurrentBootMode() == bootmode:
            print ("Target server successfully switched to boot mode %s. "
                   "Target server is POWERING OFF now." % bootmode)
        else:
            print ("Switching to boot mode %s was unsuccessful." % bootmode)
            return EC_FAILED_SWITCHBOOTMODE

    return EC_OK

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

    End Flow Control""" % str(step)


def main():
    argsParser = ArgumentParser()
    argsParser.add_argument("--name", type=StringType, metavar="NAME",
                            default=CURRENT_STEP_CHECKPOINT_CA,
                            help="Name of the custom attribute to use. "
                            "Defaults to '%s'" % CURRENT_STEP_CHECKPOINT_CA)
    args = argsParser.parse_args()

    gotoStep = ThisTargetServer().getCustomAttribute(args.name)
    if gotoStep:
        print "Continuing from checkpoint '%s' to step %s" % (args.name, gotoStep)
        print printFlowControlForwardInstruction(gotoStep)
    else:
        print "No checkpoint to continue from..."
    return 0


if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Inject required options and move the required boot files onto the stub partition.
"""
import os
import sys
import optparse
from StringIO import StringIO

from osprov import helpers
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp.helpers import getMediaURL
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.profile import Kickstart, ProfileError
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Script, Directive

HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""

BASE_KS_FILE = "tmp/user.ks.cfg"


def initKickstart(baseFile):
    """ Initialize a Kickstart object """
    return Kickstart(open(baseFile, "r"))


def removeConflictingOsprov(ksobj):
    """ Remove conflicting directives  """
    if hasattr(ksobj, "install"):
        for instance in ksobj.getDirectiveList("install"):
            print "Removing %s from the profile" % instance
            instance.name = "#%s" % instance.name


def injectRequiredOsprov(ksobj, mediaUrl):
    """ inject settings required for OS provisioning to work
            currently it only injects the nfs share. ESX uses different syntax.
    """
    if not hasattr(ksobj, "install"):
        inst = Directive("install")
        if mediaUrl.scheme == "nfs":
            inst[1] = "nfs"
            inst["server"] = mediaUrl.netloc
            inst["dir"] = mediaUrl.path
        elif mediaUrl.scheme in ["http", "https"]:
            if mediaUrl.username:
                raise ShowErrorMessage(
                    "ESXi 4.1 doesn't support installing from a media server that requires authentication.", 100)
            inst[1] = "url"
            inst[2] = mediaUrl.canonical()
        else:
            raise ShowErrorMessage(
                "ERROR: %s is not supported at this time" % mediaUrl.scheme)
        ksobj.directives.append(inst)


def hasEncPasswd(ksobj):
    """Check if the root pwd is encrypted """
    try:
        if ksobj.rootpw["iscrypted"]:
            pass
        return True
    except (KeyError, AttributeError):
        return False


def injectPost(ksobj, unsupported, agentGW, mid, crypto):
    """ Inject code to stall the installer"""
    # Don't inject the IP change script  if this is static provisioning

    for script in ksobj.scripts:
        if script.type == "post" and \
                "###  CODE BY HPSA ###" in [x.strip() for x in script.contents]:
            return

    agentSrv, opswareCaCrt = crypto

    contents = []
    contents.append("###  CODE BY HPSA ###")
    contents.append("#### DON'T REMOVE THE ABOVE COMMENT ###")

    contents.extend(("""

cat > /tmp/hpsa_agent_mid << EOF
%(mid)s
EOF

cat > /tmp/hpsa_agent.srv << EOF
%(agentSrv)s
EOF

cat > /tmp/hpsa_ca.crt << EOF
%(opswareCaCrt)s
EOF

cd /tmp
tar xzf /hpsa_agent.tar.gz
cd usr/hpsa_agent
cp osprov/esxi_reg.sh /tmp/esxi_reg.sh
chmod 755 /tmp/esxi_reg.sh
if which localcli ; then
    localcli network firewall set -e false
    localcli network firewall get >> /tmp/hpsa_osprov.out
fi
/tmp/esxi_reg.sh "/tmp/usr/hpsa_agent" "%(agentGw)s"
RC=$?
if which localcli ; then
    localcli network firewall set -e true
    localcli network firewall get >> /tmp/hpsa_osprov.out
fi
exit $RC
""" % {'mid': mid, 'agentSrv': agentSrv, 'opswareCaCrt': opswareCaCrt, 'agentGw': agentGW}).split("\n"))

    contents.append('### END OF HPSA CODE ###')

    post = Script("post")
    if unsupported:
        post["unsupported"] = None
    post["interpreter"] = "busybox"
    post["ignorefailure"] = "false"

    post.contents.extend(contents)
    ksobj.scripts.append(post)


def writeFinalKs(ksobj):
    """ Write the kickstart file onto the boot disk """
    ksfile = open(BASE_KS_FILE, "w")
    ksfile.write(str(ksobj))
    ksfile.close()
    print "Kickstart file written to disk"


def handleOsprov(ksobj, keys):
    """ change the profile to suit the environment """
    removeConflictingOsprov(ksobj)
    injectRequiredOsprov(ksobj, getMediaURL(keys))


def parseArgs(args):
    """Parse the command line arguments"""
    parser = optparse.OptionParser(description=__doc__, version='0.0.1', )
    parser.add_option('--accept-encrypted-password', default=False, dest="acceptencrypted",
                      help="Continue installation even if user has given an encrypted password ",
                      action="store_true")
    parser.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                      default=False,
                      help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")

    opt, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    return opt


def injectDevice(ksobj, targetServer):
    ksobj.network["device"] = targetServer.getMACAddress()


def getProvisioningNIC(netinfo):
    """ Searches for and return the provisioning NIC """
    provisioningNics = [nic for nic in netinfo.nics if nic.provisioning]
    if len(provisioningNics) > 1:
        print "Warning: Only one provisioning NIC will be configured from the netconfig"
    return provisioningNics[0]


def main():

    opt = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])

    unsupported = False
    # FLAG_OVERRIDE #
    # parse out flags
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        ksobj = initKickstart(BASE_KS_FILE)
        # exit if unable to retrieve password from ks.cfg
        try:
            ksobj.rootpw[1]
        except (KeyError, AttributeError):
            print "Unable to read root password from kick start file. "\
                  "Please verify kickstart configuration in the build plan"
            return 10

        if hasEncPasswd(ksobj) and not opt.acceptencrypted:
            print "Can not proceed with installation as the root password is encrypted"
            return 11
        else:
            # Save the root password for lather use
            keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
            keys.profile.username = "root"
            keys.profile.password = ksobj.rootpw[1]
            helpers.putDataStore(keys, targetServer)
        # Extra steps
        # Below comment is used to generate scripts with additional actions,
        # don't remove
        # EXTRA STEPS #

        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(
            StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
            activeMacAddress=targetServer.getMACAddress(),
            ipv6default=targetServer.isIPv6Managed()
        )
        netinfo = netconfigParser.info()
        if netinfo.oldSyntax and not opt.disableWarning:
            newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
            print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

        typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
        if typosList:
            print("The following keys were not recognized in the netconfig CA and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

        provisioningNIC = getProvisioningNIC(netinfo)

        if not (provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks or provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks):
            agwIpPort = targetServer.getRandomAgentGateway()
            mid = targetServer.getId()
            agentSrv = targetServer.readFile(
                os.path.join(targetServer.localServer.CRYPTO_DIR, "agent.srv"))
            opswareCaCrt = targetServer.readFile(
                os.path.join(targetServer.localServer.CRYPTO_DIR, "opsware-ca.crt"))
            injectPost(ksobj, unsupported, agwIpPort, mid, (agentSrv, opswareCaCrt))
        injectDevice(ksobj, targetServer)
        writeFinalKs(ksobj)
        print "Successfully injected required settings"
    except (IOError, OSError, ProfileError, ShowErrorMessage), why:
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to inject required settings.%s\n" % why)
        return 1

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
""" (c) Copyright 2009 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
   bundle together all the steps into a single install boot image step
"""

import os
import sys

from pytwist.com.opsware.common import NotFoundException
from pytwist.com.opsware.osprov import RunScriptPlanStep
from pytwist.com.opsware.osprov import InstallZIPPlanStep
from pytwist.com.opsware.script import ServerScriptRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.script import OGFSScriptRef

from librunplan import PlanRunner
from librunplan import PlanOutputHandler

from osprov import sa
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer
from osprov.osbp import logger
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage

Steps = (('Linux/Create Stub Partition', None), ('Linux/Copy Boot Media', None), ('Linux/GRuB Boot Loader x86', '/tmp'), ('Deploy Agent', '-d /tmp/opt/opsware/agent/ogfs-agent.zip -u'), ('Linux/Embed files initrd', ' -s /tmp/user.ks.cfg:/ -s /tmp/opt/opsware/agent:/opt/opsware/'), ('Linux/Install bootloader for RedHat Enterprise Linux Server', '--kernel_arguments="@kernel_arguments@"'))


def main(argv=sys.argv, stdin=sys.stdin, stdout=sys.stdout, stderr=sys.stderr):
    sys.stdin = stdin
    sys.stderr = stderr
    sys.stdout = stdout
    Twist = sa.getTwistServer()
    Target = ThisTargetServer(twistServer=Twist)
    runnerOH = PlanOutputHandler(stdout, stderr, logger.getIt("Composite step"))
    runnerOH.NO_APX_PROGRESS = True  # don't break the papx reporting
    runnerOH.ADV_STEP_MSG = None  # don't update the main message
    runnerOH.ADV_STEP_MSG_LONG = "\nSub Step: %(action)s '%(name)s'"
    runnerOH.ERR_HEADER = "\nErrors from sub step %(current)d '%(name)s':\n"
    Runner = PlanRunner(None, targetServer=Target, outputHandler=runnerOH)
    for scriptPath, parameters in Steps:
        scriptElems = [x for x in scriptPath.split("/") if x]
        try:
            stepRef = Twist.folder.FolderService.getFNode(
                ["Opsware", "Tools", "OS Provisioning", "OS Build Plan Steps"] +
                scriptElems)
            if isinstance(stepRef, ServerScriptRef) or isinstance(stepRef, OGFSScriptRef):
                step = RunScriptPlanStep()
                step.setScript(stepRef)
                step.setParameters(parameters)
            else:
                step = InstallZIPPlanStep()
                step.setZip(stepRef)
                step.setInstallPath(parameters)
            Runner.doStep(step, stepNo=int(os.environ["CURRENT_STEP_NO"]))
        except (NotFoundException), why:
            runnerOH.exception("Error : sub step '%s' not found! %s" %
                              (scriptPath, why), why)
            sys.exit(101)
        except ShowErrorMessage, why:
            runnerOH.exception("Sub Step '%s' failed: %s" % (scriptPath, why[0]), why)
            sys.exit(100)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

	  certificates won't work.  The inject required step reverses this behavior.
	  It will pass in the --noverifyssl in the kickstart file for a HTTPs URL.
	  To prevent this from happening and make the RHEL installer verify SSL 
	  certificates pass use this paramter.

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2009-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Inject required options and move the file onto the boot
    partition.
"""

import sys
from optparse import OptionParser

from osprov import helpers
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp.constants import CODE_HEADER, CODE_FOOTER, CODE_WARNING, MONITORING_STOP_FLAG
from osprov.platform_util import isRHELCompatible
from osprov.profile import Kickstart, ProfileError
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Directive, Script
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.osbp.helpers import getMediaURL

LOG = logger.getIt('inject_required')

BASE_KS_FILE = "tmp/user.ks.cfg"
EC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 101


class CustomParser(OptionParser):

    """ a custom parser """

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        OptionParser.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
        self.add_option("--verifyssl", action="store_true", default=False,
                        help="If this flag is set we will instruct the installer to "
                        "validate that the certificates are issued by a trusted CA. "
                        "Useful for HTTPS provisioning")


def initKickstart(baseFile, platform):
    """ Initialize a Kickstart object """
    fileobj = open(baseFile, "r")
    if isRHELCompatible(platform, 7):
        return Kickstart(fileobj, endtags=True)
    else:
        return Kickstart(fileobj, endtags=False)


def injectMediaLocation(ksobj, mediaUrl, verifyssl=False):
    """ inject settings required for OS provisioning to work
            currently it only injects the media share.
    """
    if mediaUrl.scheme == "nfs":
        nfs = Directive("nfs")
        nfs["server"] = mediaUrl.netloc
        nfs["dir"] = mediaUrl.path
        if mediaUrl.query:
            nfs["opts"] = mediaUrl.query
        ksobj.directives.append(nfs)
    elif mediaUrl.scheme in ["http", "https"]:
        url = Directive("url")
        url["url"] = mediaUrl.canonical()
        if mediaUrl.scheme == "https" and not verifyssl:
            url["noverifyssl"] = None
        ksobj.directives.append(url)
    else:
        raise ShowErrorMessage(
            "ERROR: %s is not supported at this time" % mediaUrl.scheme)


def removeConflictingOsprov(ksobj):
    """ Removes osprov conflicting options from the kickstart """
    # Remove reboot
    if hasattr(ksobj, "reboot"):
        ksobj.reboot.name = "# Reboot will be initiated by HPSA"  # QC 120104
    # Remove installation path
    for name in ["cdrom", "nfs", "url", "harddrive"]:
        if hasattr(ksobj, name):
            for instance in ksobj.getDirectiveList(name):
                print ("Removing '%s' from the profile" % instance)
                instance.name = "#%s" % instance.name
    # Disable SELinux
    if not hasattr(ksobj, "selinux"):
        selinux = Directive("selinux")
        selinux["disabled"] = None
        ksobj.directives.append(selinux)
        print "Disabling SELinux as it's not supported by the SA Agent."
    elif not "disabled" in ksobj.selinux:
        ksobj.selinux.clear()
        ksobj.selinux["disabled"] = None
        print "SELinux configuration setting was found. Disabling SELinux as it's not supported by the SA Agent."


def alreadyInjectedPre(ksobj):
    for script in ksobj.scripts:
        if script.type == "pre --erroronfail" and \
                CODE_HEADER.strip() in script.contents:
            return True
    return False


def injectPreScript(ksobj, script, options=""):
    code = CODE_HEADER + script + CODE_FOOTER
    pre = Script("pre %s" % options)
    pre.contents.extend(code.split("\n"))
    ksobj.scripts.append(pre)


def injectStartOgfsAgentPreScript(ksobj, targetServer):
    """ Inject code in the pre hook to start the OGFS agent """
    if alreadyInjectedPre(ksobj):
        return
    agwIpPort = targetServer.getRandomAgentGateway()
    flags = {"mount": False, "async": True, "quiet": True}
    startCode = """
netstat -nt | awk '{print $4}' | grep 1002 && reboot
%s
""" % targetServer.localServer.getOgfsAgentStartupScript(agwIpPort, flags=flags)
    injectPreScript(ksobj, startCode, "--erroronfail")


def injectWaitForNMPreScript(ksobj):
    injectPreScript(ksobj, """
           echo Waiting for NM connectivity to be available
           for i in 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th 9th 10th; do
               nmcli networking connectivity check | grep full && echo Done && exit 0
               echo "Waiting for NM for the ${i} time"
               sleep 5
           done
           echo Waiting for NM connectivity failed, continuing...
           """)


def injectPost(ksobj):
    """ Inject code to stall the installer"""
    for script in ksobj.scripts:
        if script.type == "post" and \
                CODE_HEADER.strip() in script.contents:
            return
    scriptCode = """
{header}
{warning}
echo "DONE" > {stopFlag}
{footer}
""".format(
        header=CODE_HEADER,
        warning=CODE_WARNING,
        footer=CODE_FOOTER,
        stopFlag=MONITORING_STOP_FLAG
    )
    post = Script("post")
    post.contents.extend(scriptCode.split("\n"))
    ksobj.scripts.append(post)


def writeFinalKs(ksobj):
    """ Write the kickstart file onto the boot disk """
    ksfile = open(BASE_KS_FILE, "w")
    ksfile.write(str(ksobj))
    ksfile.close()
    print "Kickstart file written to disk"


def main():
    """ Do the injection into the kickstart """
    try:
        args_parser = CustomParser()
        options, remaining_args = args_parser.parse_args()
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
        keys.platform.full_name = " ".join(remaining_args)
        helpers.putDataStore(keys, targetServer)
        ksobj = initKickstart(BASE_KS_FILE, keys.platform.full_name)
        removeConflictingOsprov(ksobj)
        mediaUrl = getMediaURL(keys)
        rhel7 = isRHELCompatible(keys.platform.full_name, version=7)
        if mediaUrl.scheme == "https":
            if rhel7:
                print ("Warning: Provisioning {platname} from HTTPS media is supported only " +
                       "when using trusted CA signed server certificates. Skipping the certificate " +
                       "validation is not supported by the installer.").format(platname=keys.platform.full_name)
            else:
                print "Warning: Provisioning from a HTTPS media source is only supported "\
                    "by Red Hat starting from Enterprise Linux 6. \n By default checking of "\
                    "Certificate Authorities is disabled. Use the --verifyssl option to this "\
                    "step to enable it. You will need to set this option and have a valid "\
                    "certificate for RHEL 6.0 with HTTPS. All subsequent releases, starting "\
                    "from RHEL 6.1 support self signed certificates."
        if mediaUrl.username and mediaUrl.scheme in ["http", "https"]:
            print "Red Hat Enterprise Linux does not support authentication for HTTP and HTTPS"
            return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED
        if not rhel7 and targetServer.isIPv6Managed():
            print "Provisioning {platname} is not supported over IPv6".format(platname=keys.platform.full_name)
            return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED
        injectMediaLocation(ksobj, mediaUrl, verifyssl=options.verifyssl)
        if not rhel7:
            injectStartOgfsAgentPreScript(ksobj, targetServer)
        else:
            injectWaitForNMPreScript(ksobj)
        injectPost(ksobj)
        writeFinalKs(ksobj)
        print "Successfully injected required settings"
    except (IOError, OSError, ShowErrorMessage, ProfileError), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to inject required settings.%s\n" % why)
        return 1

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

This script inject required settings into the kickstart file. It appends code to
the %pre section of the kickstart file, to start the agent before the
installation starts. It also injects code into the %post section to prevent the
installer from rebooting after the installation is complete. The lather gives us
a chance to integrate the HP SA agent. It also injects NFS settings if not
already there.

Usage:
	inject_required_ks.py [--verifyssl]

Parameters:
	verifyssl: If you are doing HTTPS provisioning, the RHEL version that support
	  HTTPS by default validate the issuer of the SSL certificates, and self-signed 
	  certificates won't work.  The inject required step reverses this behavior.
	  It will pass in the --noverifyssl in the kickstart file for a HTTPs URL.
	  To prevent this from happening and make the RHEL installer verify SSL 
	  certificates pass use this paramter.

Prerequisites:
- Target server runs a maintenance Linux OS.
- The user provided or default ks file must be in /tmp/user.ks.cfg.

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# lint_ignore=E501,I0011
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2011-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    OGFS script to integrate the server with V12N services.
"""
import sys

from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser, OptionValueError
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer
from osprov import helpers
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.errors import DiscoveryError, ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.osbp import logger
from osprov.util import NullLog
from osprov.util.twist import WaitForWLMJob
from osprov import constants

# pylint: disable=F0401,E0611
from pytwist.com.opsware.v12n.mgmtservice import V12nVIManagerRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.v12n import AddHostSpec, \
    V12nInventoryItemReference, \
    V12nDriverCodeConstant, \
    SSLCertVerificationException
from pytwist.com.opsware.v12n.vmware import VmwareAddHostSpec
from pytwist.com.opsware.custattr import NoSuchFieldException, CustomAttribute
# pylint: enable=F0401,E0611

LOG = logger.getIt("add_to_v12n_manager")

IP_REPORT_CA = CustomAttribute.OPSWARE_PRIVATE_KEY_PREFIX + constants.IP_REPORT_CA


class CustomParser(OptionParser):

    """ a custom parser """

    @staticmethod
    def driverOptionCallback(option, opt, value, parser):
        """ Callback to handle the driver options """
        if value.lower() == "vmware_vcenter":
            setattr(parser.values, option.dest, V12nDriverCodeConstant.VMWARE_VCENTER)
        elif value.lower() == "microsoft_scvmm":
            setattr(parser.values, option.dest, V12nDriverCodeConstant.MICROSOFT_SCVMM)
        else:
            raise OptionValueError("Invalid value for \"%s\" : %s" % (opt, value))

    @staticmethod
    def managerOptionCallback(option, opt, value, parser):
        """ Callback to handle converting the manager to Ref """
        del opt
        setattr(parser.values, option.dest, V12nVIManagerRef(value))

    @staticmethod
    def containerOptionCallback(option, opt, value, parser):
        """ callback to handle the container option """
        if ":" not in value:
            raise OptionValueError(
                "Invalid syntax for \"%s\" : %s ( should contain : )" % (opt, value))
        locType, locId = value.split(":", 1)
        try:
            locId = long(locId)
        except ValueError:
            raise OptionValueError("Invalid Id for \"%s\" :  %s, should be a number" % (opt, locId))
        if not locType.endswith("Ref"):
            locType += "Ref"
        locClass = "pytwist.com.opsware.v12n.%s" % locType
        locClass = locClass.split(".")
        modName = ".".join(locClass[:-1])
        className = locClass[-1]
        try:
            __import__(modName)
            mod = sys.modules[modName]
            locRef = getattr(mod, className)()
            locRef.id = locId
        except ImportError, why:
            raise OptionValueError("Invalid Type for \"%s\" : %s" % (opt, why))
        except AttributeError:
            raise OptionValueError("Invalid Type for \"%s\" : %s: no such class in %s" %
                                  (opt, className, modName))
        if not isinstance(locRef, V12nInventoryItemReference):
            raise OptionValueError(
                "Invalid Type for \"%s\" : %s  must implement V12nInventoryItemReference" % (opt, locType))
        setattr(parser.values, option.dest, locRef)

    def defineOptions(self):
        self.add_option("-m", "--manager", type="long",
                        help="The ID of the virtualization Manager where the server will be added. "
                        "If not present the script will decide on one, but you "
                        "need to pass it at least the manager type.", action="callback",
                        callback=self.managerOptionCallback)

        self.add_option("-p", "--pass", dest="passit", action="store_true", default=False,
                        help="If this flag is present together with the \"driver\" option "
                        "the  build plan will only print a warning that there is no"
                        "Virtualization manager present in SA, but it will not fail.")

        self.add_option("-d", "--driver", type="string",
                        help="Specifies that the target server should be added to "
                        "service backed by a VMware vCenter. This is only required if no \"manager\""
                        "is present. If \"manager\" is passed in, this will be ignored and automatically determined."
                        "Valid options are: vmware_vcenter and microsoft_scvmm.", action="callback",
                        callback=self.driverOptionCallback)

        self.add_option("-c", "--container", type="string",
                        help="Specifies the type and Id of the container. This needs to be a valid container for "
                        "the V12n driver being used."
                        "The argument needs to be given in Type:ID format where Type is the pytwist class of the "
                        "object without the "
                        " \"com.opsware.v12n\" prefix, so for example to add an ESXi to a specific datacenter you "
                        "would use: vmware.V12nDatacenter:1940001 ( where 1940001 is a valid ID)",
                        action="callback", callback=self.containerOptionCallback)
        self.add_option("--username", type="string", default=None,
                        help="Specifies the username to use. Optional.")
        self.add_option("--password", type="string", default=None,
                        help="Specifies the password to use. Optional.")

    def validateArgs(self, opt, args):
        """ Validate arguments """
        if not opt.manager and not opt.driver:
            raise OptionValueError("One of \"manager\" or \"driver\" is mandatory.")
        if opt.manager:
            # passit is only effective with a driver
            opt.passit = False
            # driver is ignored if manager is present
            opt.driver = None


class AddToManager(object):

    """ Add the host to a VI manager """

    def __init__(self, targetServer, log=NullLog(), driverType=None):
        self.targetServer = targetServer
        self.twistServer = targetServer.twistServer
        self.log = log
        self.driverType = driverType

    def getIpAddress(self):
        """ Get the IP address to be passed  """
        outOfBandIP = self._getOutOfBandIpAddress()
        if outOfBandIP:
            return outOfBandIP
        return self.targetServer.getServerVO().managementIP

    def _getOutOfBandIpAddress(self):
        """ Get the IP address to be passed  """
        self.log.info("Looking for reported IP address.")
        try:
            esxiReported = self.targetServer.twistServer.server.ServerService.getCustAttr(
                self.targetServer.serverRef, IP_REPORT_CA, True)
            return esxiReported.split(",")[0].strip()
        except NoSuchFieldException:
            LOG.info("'%s'  CA not reported.", IP_REPORT_CA)
        return None

    def startAddHost(self, managerRef, username, password, container, sslThumbprint=None):
        """ Call the start add host call from the V12n API """
        if sslThumbprint:
            hostSpec = VmwareAddHostSpec()
            hostSpec.setSSLThumbPrint(sslThumbprint)
        else:
            hostSpec = AddHostSpec()
        hostSpec.serverRef = self.targetServer.getServerRef()
        # network address
        if self.driverType == V12nDriverCodeConstant.MICROSOFT_SCVMM:
            # SCVMM doesn't support adding by IP (QC #147852) if IPs can't be resolved
            # back to domains. Since it's required to have the target in the domain
            # anyway, we know that hostname will bre resolvable, so in stead of adding a configuration
            # requirement for this step ( configuring reverse DSN ) we just use hostname here
            hostSpec.hostname = self.targetServer.serverVO.hostName
        else:
            # for all others we use IPs, this is important for ESXi where the IP address is not always
            # available or accurate on the server record.
            hostSpec.hostname = self.getIpAddress()
        hostSpec.username = username
        hostSpec.password = password
        hostSpec.container = container
        self.log.debug("About to register host to manager (%s) with :" % managerRef)
        self.log.debug("  hostname: %s" % hostSpec.hostname)
        self.log.debug("  username: %s" % hostSpec.username)
        self.log.debug("  password: %s...%s" % (hostSpec.password[0], hostSpec.password[1]))
        self.log.debug("  container: %s" % hostSpec.container)
        if hasattr(hostSpec, "getSSLThumbPrint"):
            self.log.debug("  sslThumbprint: %s" % (hostSpec.getSSLThumbPrint()))
        return self.twistServer.v12n.V12nVIManagerService.startAddHost(
            managerRef,
            hostSpec,
            300,  # timeout in seconds, should be enough for a blank server
            "Initiated by OSBP",
            None,
            None  # no notification and schedule
        )

    def discoverVIManager(self):
        """ Discover a manager ref, that we can use to add  """
        viType = self.driverType
        driverRef = self.twistServer.v12n.V12nDriverService.findV12nDriverByCode(viType)
        filterObj = self.twistServer.v12n.V12nDriverService.getRegistrableServers(driverRef)
        hosts = self.twistServer.server.ServerService.findServerRefs(filterObj)
        self.log.debug("Found following hosts: %s" % (hosts, ))
        for serverRef in hosts:
            managers = self.twistServer.server.ServerService.getHostedManagers(serverRef)
            self.log.debug("Following managers for %s:%s" % (serverRef, managers))
            for managerRef in managers:
                if isinstance(managerRef, V12nVIManagerRef):
                    # return the first once by convention
                    return managerRef
        raise DiscoveryError("No suitable managers found")

    def getDriver(self, managerRef):
        """ Return the driver for a manager """
        managerVO = self.twistServer.v12n.V12nVIManagerService.getV12nVIManagerVO(managerRef)
        driverVO = self.twistServer.v12n.V12nDriverService.getV12nDriverVO(managerVO.driver)
        self.driverType = driverVO.code


def getUsernameAndPassword(targetServer, options):
    """ Return the username and password """
    if options.username and options.password:
        username = options.username
        password = options.password
    else:
        dstore = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
        if hasattr(dstore.profile, "username") and hasattr(dstore.profile, "password"):
            username = dstore.profile.username
            password = dstore.profile.password
        else:
            raise ShowErrorMessage("The username and password were not specified.")
    return username, password


@HandleShowErrorMessage("add host", LOG)
def main():
    """ Entry point """
    # Parse the arguments
    args_parser = CustomParser()
    opt, remaining_args = args_parser.parse_args()
    if remaining_args:
        print "Unneeded arguments (will be ignored): %s" % ",".join(remaining_args)
    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    atm = AddToManager(targetServer, log=LOG, driverType=opt.driver)
    # Determine the manager
    if opt.manager:
        managerRef = opt.manager
        atm.getDriver(managerRef)
    else:
        try:
            managerRef = atm.discoverVIManager()
        except DiscoveryError, why:
            print "Warning: No virtualization services registered. Hypervisor will not be managed."
            if opt.passit:
                print "Since --pass or -p was passed, will report success."
                return 0
            else:
                raise why
    print "Going to add server to   %s" % managerRef

    username, password = getUsernameAndPassword(targetServer, opt)
    LOG.debug("Username=%s, password=%s", username, password)

    jobRef = atm.startAddHost(managerRef, username, password, opt.container)
    print "Started job to add host: %s" % jobRef
    waitForIt = WaitForWLMJob(jobRef=jobRef, log=LOG, twistServer=targetServer.twistServer)
    try:
        waitForIt()
    except SSLCertVerificationException:
        # This happens fro ESXi, when we first try to add it we get the thumbprint
        # WLM doesn't persist the sslThumbprint on the Exception, so we need to
        # get it from the job result
        print "Retrieved SSL Thumbprint. Trying again"
        sslThumbprint = waitForIt.jobResult.sslThumbprint
        jobRef = atm.startAddHost(managerRef, username, password, opt.container, sslThumbprint)
        print "Started job to add host: %s" % jobRef
        waitForIt = WaitForWLMJob(
            jobRef=jobRef, log=LOG, twistServer=targetServer.twistServer)
        waitForIt()

    print "Successfully added virtualization host"


if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# lint_ignore=E501,I0011,C0301
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2010-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    This program will inject personalized settings into the kickstart
    file.
"""

import os
import sys
from cStringIO import StringIO

from osprov import helpers
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser, OptionValueError
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.osbp.constants import CODE_HEADER, CODE_WARNING, CODE_FOOTER
from osprov.osbp.helpers import getMediaURL
from osprov.platform_util import isRHELCompatible, isRHEL7CompatibleMedia
from osprov.profile import Kickstart
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Directive
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Script
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.networking import validation

EC_NO_ERR = 0
EC_NO_CA = 20
EC_EXCEPTION = 100
EC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 101

KS_PATH = "tmp/user.ks.cfg"

LOG = logger.getIt('inject_ks_pers')

# replaced at build time
TARGET_OS = "esxi5"


def removeNetworkDirective(ks):
    if hasattr(ks, "network"):
        print "Removing existing network personalization from the kickstart"
        ks.directives.remove(ks.network)

def injectSysctlSettings(isIPv6Managed):
    sysctl = open("tmp/sysctl.conf", "w")
    if not isIPv6Managed:
        sysctl.write("net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=1")
    sysctl.close()


def injectPersonalization(ks, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute, isIPv6Managed, isRHEL7=False):
    """ Inject static networking configuration into the kickstart profile. """
    removeNetworkDirective(ks)

    static_dir = Directive("network")
    static_dir["device"] = provisioningNIC.macAddress
    print "Going to provision using interface with MAC address %s" % provisioningNIC.macAddress

    # ESXi doesn't support ipv6, noipv6 and noipv4 boot parameters
    isESXi = "esxi" in TARGET_OS

    if isIPv6Managed:
        if isESXi:
            if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
                static_dir["bootproto"] = "static"
            elif provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
                # esxi does not know of auto as a bootproto option
                # if bootproto is not set the ESXi installer defaults to DHCP and also will print a warning
                # Setting it dhcp from the start it's convenient
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: dhcp"
                static_dir["bootproto"] = "dhcp"
            else:
                print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                      "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"
                sys.exit(36)
        else:
            if provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
                print "Configuring IPv6 to: auto"
                static_dir["ipv6"] = "auto"
            elif provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
                if isRHEL7:
                    return
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
                static_dir["bootproto"] = "static"
            else:
                print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                      "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"
                sys.exit(37)
            print "Disabling IPv4"
            static_dir["noipv4"] = None

        for ipv6Network in provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
            print "Configuring IPv6 network: %s" % ipv6Network
            static_dir["ip" if isESXi else "ipv6"] = ipv6Network.ip
            static_dir["netmask"] = ipv6Network.prefixlen
            break  # we only set the first IP if any
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Found IPv6-based service OS, ignoring IPv4 network personalization"
    else:
        # IPv4
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
            static_dir["bootproto"] = "static"
        elif provisioningNIC.dhcpv4:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: dhcp"
            static_dir["bootproto"] = "dhcp"
        else:
            print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                  "DHCP is turned off for IPv4 and there is no static address defined"
            sys.exit(38)
        if not isESXi:
            print "Disabling IPv6"
            static_dir["noipv6"] = None

        for ipv4Network in provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Configuring IPv4 network: %s" % ipv4Network
            static_dir["ip"] = ipv4Network.ip
            static_dir["netmask"] = ipv4Network.netmask
            break  # we only set the first IP if any
        if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
            print "Found IPv4-based service OS, ignoring IPv6 network personalization"

    if provisioningRoute:
        gw = str(provisioningRoute.gateway)
        print "Will use default gateway: %s" % gw
        #if isinstance(provisioningRoute.gateway, ipaddr.IPv6Address) and isRHEL7:
        #    gw = "[%s]" % provisioningRoute.gateway
        static_dir["gateway"] = gw

    # use the stack-aware DNS server, if any
    for dnsServer in provisioningNIC.ipv6DnsServers if isIPv6Managed else provisioningNIC.ipv4DnsServers:
        print "Will use name server: %s" % dnsServer
        static_dir["nameserver"] = dnsServer
        break

    if netinfo.fqdn:
        print "Setting FQDN to: %s" % netinfo.fqdn
        static_dir["hostname"] = netinfo.fqdn
    ks.directives.append(static_dir)


def injectVlanID(provisioningNIC, ksObj):
    """ Inject the VLAN ID in the installation profile """
    if provisioningNIC.vlan_id is None:
        return
    if "esxi5" in TARGET_OS.lower():
        print "Configuring VLAN ID %s" % provisioningNIC.vlan_id
        ksObj.network["vlanid"] = provisioningNIC.vlan_id
    elif "esxi" in TARGET_OS.lower():
        print "Warning: Not injecting vlan id. This version of ESXi does not support it."


def injectVmwareESXi41Workaround(ks, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute):
    """ VMware insists on having a DHCP server in all cases.
            We must work around that.

            This workaround only applies the static IP during installation, so the
            installer can access the NFS share. The network settings are also needed
            in the network directive. Should be called after injectStatic!
    """
    # collect the info on a dictionary format expected by weasel
    nic = {
        "bootProto": "static",
        "ip": str(provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks[0].ip),
        "netmask": str(provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks[0].netmask),
        "vlanID": 0,
        "hostname": "localhost",
        "nameserver1": "",
        "nameserver2": "",
        "device": None
    }
    if provisioningNIC.dnsServers:
        nic["nameserver1"] = str(provisioningNIC.dnsServers[0])
    if netinfo.fqdn:
        nic["hostname"] = netinfo.fqdn
    if provisioningRoute:
        nic["gateway"] = str(provisioningRoute.gateway)
    # create a pre script to apply the static networking
    pre = Script("pre")
    pre["interpreter"] = "python"
    pre["unsupported"] = None
    pre.contents.append(CODE_HEADER)
    pre.contents.append(CODE_WARNING)
    # use the public API of the vmware installer (weasel) library
    pre.contents.append("from weasel import networking")
    pre.contents.append("nic = %s" % nic)
    pre.contents.append(
        "nic[\"device\"] = networking.findPhysicalNicByMacAddress('%s')"
        % provisioningNIC.macAddress)
    pre.contents.append("networking.connect(nicChoices = nic)")
    pre.contents.append("networking.enactHostWideUserchoices(nic)")
    pre.contents.append(CODE_FOOTER)
    # inject this pre script
    ks.scripts.append(pre)
    # qc 122451 , prevent hostname warning
    # in order for this to work, it must be called after inject static
    if "hostname" not in ks.network:
        ks.network["hostname"] = "localhost"


def injectRhelWorkaround(ks, provisioningNIC):
    """ Rhel <7 does not allow --device=MAC, work around that"""
    script = Script("pre")
    script.contents.append(CODE_HEADER)
    script.contents.append(CODE_WARNING)
    # figure out who has  this mac belongs
    script.contents.append("DEV=`ifconfig -a | grep -i 'HWaddr %s' | cut -d' ' -f1`"
                           % provisioningNIC.macAddress)
    script.contents.append("if [ -z \"$DEV\" ] ; then DEV='%s' ; fi" % provisioningNIC.macAddress)

                           % provisioningNIC.macAddress)

def writeKsFile(ksFile, ks):

    ksf.close()


def getOptions():

    optparser = OptionParser()
    optparser.add_option("--require-netconfig", default="false")
    optparser.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                         default=False,
                         help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")
    (options, args) = optparser.parse_args()
    del args
    if not options.require_netconfig.lower() in ("true", "false"):

            "Invalid value for --require-netconfig: %s.\nShould be 'true' or 'false'.")
    options.require_netconfig = options.require_netconfig.lower() == "true"
    return options


def validateNetconfig(provisioningNIC, provisioningRoutes):
    """ Perform some additional validation on the netconfig """
    if ("esxi5" in TARGET_OS.lower() and
            (provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks or provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks) and
            not provisioningRoutes):
        raise ShowErrorMessage("Default gateway is missing from the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute. It is mandatory for this version of ESXi.")


def main():
    """ Configure the Kickstart profile according to the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute"""
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
        options = getOptions()

        if not HPSA_NETCONFIG and options.require_netconfig:
            print "Network configuration (hpsa_netconfig) for this server was not found, even though "
            print "it is required by the value true of the custom attribute require_netconfig. "
            print "Check the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and verify the target server "
            print "has been configured for static networking."
            return 1

        isIPv6Managed = targetServer.isIPv6Managed()

        if "esxi4" in TARGET_OS.lower() and isIPv6Managed:
            print("Provisioning on IPv6 not supported for ESXi 4.1.")
            return 1

        if keys.platform.full_name:
            isRhel7 = isRHELCompatible(keys.platform.full_name, 7)
        else:
            # platform key not set for ESXi
            isRhel7 = False

        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(
            StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
            activeMacAddress=targetServer.getMACAddress(),
            ipv6default=isIPv6Managed,
            log=LOG
        )

        netinfo = netconfigParser.info()
        if netinfo.oldSyntax and not options.disableWarning:
            newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
            print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

        typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
        if typosList:
            print("The following keys were not recognized in the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

        provisioningNIC = netinfo.getProvisioningNIC()

        mediaUrl = getMediaURL(keys)
        if (isRhel7 and mediaUrl.scheme == "nfs" and
                isIPv6Managed and provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks and not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig and
                isRHEL7CompatibleMedia("0", targetServer, mediaUrl.scheme, "/" + mediaUrl.fragment if mediaUrl.fragment else "/mnt/media")):
            print "Provisioning {platname} over IPv6 on NFS ".format(platname=keys.platform.full_name.replace(" 7 ", " 7.0 ")) + \
                  "with only a static network configuration is not supported.\n" + \
                  "Enable IPv6 autoconfig or use HTTP/HTTPS for the media."
            return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED

        validation.validateProvisioningNIC(provisioningNIC, targetServer)

        provisioningRoutes = [iproute for iproute in (netinfo.ipv6Routes if isIPv6Managed else netinfo.ipv4Routes)
                              if iproute.nic == provisioningNIC]
        provisioningRoute = provisioningRoutes[0] if provisioningRoutes else None

        validateNetconfig(provisioningNIC, provisioningRoutes)

        ksObj = Kickstart(open(KS_PATH), endtags=isRhel7)
        injectPersonalization(ksObj, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute, isIPv6Managed, isRhel7)

        injectVlanID(provisioningNIC, ksObj)

        if not isRhel7 and "rhel" in TARGET_OS.lower():
            injectRhelWorkaround(ksObj, provisioningNIC)
        elif "esxi4" in TARGET_OS.lower() and provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            injectVmwareESXi41Workaround(ksObj, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute)
        writeKsFile(KS_PATH, ksObj)
        if isRhel7:
            injectSysctlSettings(isIPv6Managed)
    except (OSError, IOError, ShowErrorMessage, OptionValueError), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        print "Failed to inject personalization settings:\n%s" % why
        return EC_EXCEPTION


HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

#!/usr/bin/python
"""
    (C) Copyright 2012-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
"""

import sys
from optparse import OptionValueError
from time import sleep

sys.path.append("/opsw/apx/runtime/script/osprov.run_os_build_plan_papx/")
sys.path.append("/opt/opsware/pylibs2/")

from osprov.errors import ProcessExecutionError, ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser
from osprov.osbp import logger, ThisTargetServer
from osprov.profile.ribcl import RibclProfile
from osprov.wrappers.hponcfg import HpOnCfg
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage

log = logger.getIt("Delete iLO User")

USER_NOT_FOUND_STATUS_CODES = ("0x000A", "0xA")

RETRIES_ON_FAILURE = 5
SECONDS_BETWEEN_RETRIES = 5


class DeleteIloUserOptionParser(OptionParser):

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        OptionParser.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
        self.usage = "Deletes an iLO user using the hponcfg utility."

    def defineOptions(self):
        self.add_option("--username",
                        help="Username of iLO user to delete")
        self.add_option("--fail-nouser", default=False, action="store_true",
                        help="Fail if the specified user does not exist")

    def validateArgs(self, opt, args):
        if not opt.username:
            raise OptionValueError("Missing required argument: username")


@HandleShowErrorMessage("Delete iLO User", log)
def main():
    parser = DeleteIloUserOptionParser()
    options, remaining_args = parser.parse_args()

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
    hpOnCfg = HpOnCfg(targetServer, log=log)

    ribcl = hpOnCfg.getCurrentConfig()

    if ribcl.iLOUserExists(options.username):
        ribclProfile = RibclProfile()
        user = RibclProfile.User(options.username)
        ribclProfile.addCommand(RibclProfile.DeleteUserCommand(user))
        try:
            hpOnCfg.set(ribclProfile)
            # Check to see if the user was really deleted, wait and retry if not
            for i in xrange(RETRIES_ON_FAILURE):
                ribcl = hpOnCfg.getCurrentConfig()
                if not ribcl.iLOUserExists(options.username):
                    break
                print "Warning: iLO User was not deleted, retry %d of 5" % (i + 1)
                try:
                    hpOnCfg.set(ribclProfile)
                except ProcessExecutionError, why:
                    # Check if hponcfg failed because user was not found, in this case it's
                    # what we want
                    log.exception(why)
                    if reduce(lambda x, y: x or y, [code in why.stderr for code in USER_NOT_FOUND_STATUS_CODES]):
                        break
                sleep(SECONDS_BETWEEN_RETRIES)
            else:
                raise ShowErrorMessage(
                    "Error: iLO User '%s' could not be deleted, there may be a problem with the iLO" % options.username)
        except ProcessExecutionError, why:
            log.exception(why)
            print "Failed to delete the iLO user using hponcfg"
            print "Standard output of hponcfg command:"
            print why.stdout
            print "Standard error of hponcfg command:"
            print why.stderr
            return why.exitCode
    else:
        if not options.fail_nouser:
            print "Warning: iLO User '%s' does not exist" % options.username
        else:
            raise ShowErrorMessage(
                "Error: iLO User '%s' does not exist and --fail-nouser is set" % options.username)

    return 0

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

    """ Inject static networking configuration into the kickstart profile. """
    removeNetworkDirective(ks)

    isESXi = "esxi" in TARGET_OS

            if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"

                # if bootproto is not set the ESXi installer defaults to DHCP and also will print a warning

                print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                      "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"

        else:

                      "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"

        #    gw = "[%s]" % provisioningRoute.gateway
