#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# lint_ignore=E501,I0011,C0301
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
"""
    (C) Copyright 2010-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    This program will inject personalized settings into the kickstart
    file.
"""

import os
import sys
from cStringIO import StringIO

from osprov import helpers
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov.optparse_ext import OptionParser, OptionValueError
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.osbp.constants import CODE_HEADER, CODE_WARNING, CODE_FOOTER
from osprov.osbp.helpers import getMediaURL
from osprov.platform_util import isRHELCompatible, isRHEL7CompatibleMedia
from osprov.profile import Kickstart
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Directive
from osprov.profile.kickstart import Script
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig, OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING
from osprov.networking import validation

EC_NO_ERR = 0
EC_NO_CA = 20
EC_EXCEPTION = 100
EC_NOT_SUPPORTED = 101

KS_PATH = "tmp/user.ks.cfg"

LOG = logger.getIt('inject_ks_pers')

# replaced at build time
TARGET_OS = "rhel"


def removeNetworkDirective(ks):
    if hasattr(ks, "network"):
        print "Removing existing network personalization from the kickstart"
        ks.directives.remove(ks.network)

def injectSysctlSettings(isIPv6Managed):
    sysctl = open("tmp/sysctl.conf", "w")
    if not isIPv6Managed:
        sysctl.write("net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=1")
    sysctl.close()


def injectPersonalization(ks, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute, isIPv6Managed, isRHEL7=False):
    """ Inject static networking configuration into the kickstart profile. """
    removeNetworkDirective(ks)

    static_dir = Directive("network")
    static_dir["device"] = provisioningNIC.macAddress
    print "Going to provision using interface with MAC address %s" % provisioningNIC.macAddress

    # ESXi doesn't support ipv6, noipv6 and noipv4 boot parameters
    isESXi = "esxi" in TARGET_OS

    if isIPv6Managed:
        if isESXi:
            if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
                static_dir["bootproto"] = "static"
            elif provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
                # esxi does not know of auto as a bootproto option
                # if bootproto is not set the ESXi installer defaults to DHCP and also will print a warning
                # Setting it dhcp from the start it's convenient
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: dhcp"
                static_dir["bootproto"] = "dhcp"
            else:
                print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                      "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"
                sys.exit(36)
        else:
            if provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig:
                print "Configuring IPv6 to: auto"
                static_dir["ipv6"] = "auto"
            elif provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
                if isRHEL7:
                    return
                print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
                static_dir["bootproto"] = "static"
            else:
                print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                      "Auto configuration is turned off for IPv6 and there is no static address defined"
                sys.exit(37)
            print "Disabling IPv4"
            static_dir["noipv4"] = None

        for ipv6Network in provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
            print "Configuring IPv6 network: %s" % ipv6Network
            static_dir["ip" if isESXi else "ipv6"] = ipv6Network.ip
            static_dir["netmask"] = ipv6Network.prefixlen
            break  # we only set the first IP if any
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Found IPv6-based service OS, ignoring IPv4 network personalization"
    else:
        # IPv4
        if provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: static"
            static_dir["bootproto"] = "static"
        elif provisioningNIC.dhcpv4:
            print "Configuring boot protocol to: dhcp"
            static_dir["bootproto"] = "dhcp"
        else:
            print "Can not complete network personalization. " \
                  "DHCP is turned off for IPv4 and there is no static address defined"
            sys.exit(38)
        if not isESXi:
            print "Disabling IPv6"
            static_dir["noipv6"] = None

        for ipv4Network in provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            print "Configuring IPv4 network: %s" % ipv4Network
            static_dir["ip"] = ipv4Network.ip
            static_dir["netmask"] = ipv4Network.netmask
            break  # we only set the first IP if any
        if provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks:
            print "Found IPv4-based service OS, ignoring IPv6 network personalization"

    if provisioningRoute:
        gw = str(provisioningRoute.gateway)
        print "Will use default gateway: %s" % gw
        #if isinstance(provisioningRoute.gateway, ipaddr.IPv6Address) and isRHEL7:
        #    gw = "[%s]" % provisioningRoute.gateway
        static_dir["gateway"] = gw

    # use the stack-aware DNS server, if any
    for dnsServer in provisioningNIC.ipv6DnsServers if isIPv6Managed else provisioningNIC.ipv4DnsServers:
        print "Will use name server: %s" % dnsServer
        static_dir["nameserver"] = dnsServer
        break

    if netinfo.fqdn:
        print "Setting FQDN to: %s" % netinfo.fqdn
        static_dir["hostname"] = netinfo.fqdn
    ks.directives.append(static_dir)


def injectVlanID(provisioningNIC, ksObj):
    """ Inject the VLAN ID in the installation profile """
    if provisioningNIC.vlan_id is None:
        return
    if "esxi5" in TARGET_OS.lower():
        print "Configuring VLAN ID %s" % provisioningNIC.vlan_id
        ksObj.network["vlanid"] = provisioningNIC.vlan_id
    elif "esxi" in TARGET_OS.lower():
        print "Warning: Not injecting vlan id. This version of ESXi does not support it."


def injectVmwareESXi41Workaround(ks, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute):
    """ VMware insists on having a DHCP server in all cases.
            We must work around that.

            This workaround only applies the static IP during installation, so the
            installer can access the NFS share. The network settings are also needed
            in the network directive. Should be called after injectStatic!
    """
    # collect the info on a dictionary format expected by weasel
    nic = {
        "bootProto": "static",
        "ip": str(provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks[0].ip),
        "netmask": str(provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks[0].netmask),
        "vlanID": 0,
        "hostname": "localhost",
        "nameserver1": "",
        "nameserver2": "",
        "device": None
    }
    if provisioningNIC.dnsServers:
        nic["nameserver1"] = str(provisioningNIC.dnsServers[0])
    if netinfo.fqdn:
        nic["hostname"] = netinfo.fqdn
    if provisioningRoute:
        nic["gateway"] = str(provisioningRoute.gateway)
    # create a pre script to apply the static networking
    pre = Script("pre")
    pre["interpreter"] = "python"
    pre["unsupported"] = None
    pre.contents.append(CODE_HEADER)
    pre.contents.append(CODE_WARNING)
    # use the public API of the vmware installer (weasel) library
    pre.contents.append("from weasel import networking")
    pre.contents.append("nic = %s" % nic)
    pre.contents.append(
        "nic[\"device\"] = networking.findPhysicalNicByMacAddress('%s')"
        % provisioningNIC.macAddress)
    pre.contents.append("networking.connect(nicChoices = nic)")
    pre.contents.append("networking.enactHostWideUserchoices(nic)")
    pre.contents.append(CODE_FOOTER)
    # inject this pre script
    ks.scripts.append(pre)
    # qc 122451 , prevent hostname warning
    # in order for this to work, it must be called after inject static
    if "hostname" not in ks.network:
        ks.network["hostname"] = "localhost"


def injectRhelWorkaround(ks, provisioningNIC):
    """ Rhel <7 does not allow --device=MAC, work around that"""
    script = Script("pre")
    script.contents.append(CODE_HEADER)
    script.contents.append(CODE_WARNING)
    # figure out who has  this mac belongs
    script.contents.append("DEV=`ifconfig -a | grep -i 'HWaddr %s' | cut -d' ' -f1`"
                           % provisioningNIC.macAddress)
    script.contents.append("if [ -z \"$DEV\" ] ; then DEV='%s' ; fi" % provisioningNIC.macAddress)
    # path the kickstart file
    script.contents.append("sed -i /user.ks.cfg -e \"s/--device=%s/--device=$DEV/\""
                           % provisioningNIC.macAddress)
    script.contents.append(CODE_FOOTER)
    ks.scripts.append(script)


def writeKsFile(ksFile, ks):
    """ Write the ks file to disk  """
    ksf = open(ksFile, "w+")
    ksf.write(str(ks))
    ksf.close()


def getOptions():
    """Returns the command-line options."""
    optparser = OptionParser()
    optparser.add_option("--require-netconfig", default="false")
    optparser.add_option("--disableWarning", dest="disableWarning", action="store_true",
                         default=False,
                         help="Do not show warnings of old hpsa_netconfig format")
    (options, args) = optparser.parse_args()
    del args
    if not options.require_netconfig.lower() in ("true", "false"):
        raise OptionValueError(
            "Invalid value for --require-netconfig: %s.\nShould be 'true' or 'false'.")
    options.require_netconfig = options.require_netconfig.lower() == "true"
    return options


def validateNetconfig(provisioningNIC, provisioningRoutes):
    """ Perform some additional validation on the netconfig """
    if ("esxi5" in TARGET_OS.lower() and
            (provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks or provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks) and
            not provisioningRoutes):
        raise ShowErrorMessage("Default gateway is missing from the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute. It is mandatory for this version of ESXi.")


def main():
    """ Configure the Kickstart profile according to the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute"""
    try:
        targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
        targetServer.setWorkDir(targetServer.getRemoteRoot())
        keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
        options = getOptions()

        if not HPSA_NETCONFIG and options.require_netconfig:
            print "Network configuration (hpsa_netconfig) for this server was not found, even though "
            print "it is required by the value true of the custom attribute require_netconfig. "
            print "Check the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and verify the target server "
            print "has been configured for static networking."
            return 1

        isIPv6Managed = targetServer.isIPv6Managed()

        if "esxi4" in TARGET_OS.lower() and isIPv6Managed:
            print("Provisioning on IPv6 not supported for ESXi 4.1.")
            return 1

        if keys.platform.full_name:
            isRhel7 = isRHELCompatible(keys.platform.full_name, 7)
        else:
            # platform key not set for ESXi
            isRhel7 = False

        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readwrite(
            StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
            activeMacAddress=targetServer.getMACAddress(),
            ipv6default=isIPv6Managed,
            log=LOG
        )

        netinfo = netconfigParser.info()
        if netinfo.oldSyntax and not options.disableWarning:
            newFormat = netconfigParser.format()
            print OLD_SYNTAX_WARNING + "\n%s" % str(newFormat)

        typosList = netconfigParser.getTyposList()
        if typosList:
            print("The following keys were not recognized in the hpsa_netconfig custom attribute and could be typos: %s" % typosList)

        provisioningNIC = netinfo.getProvisioningNIC()

        mediaUrl = getMediaURL(keys)
        if (isRhel7 and mediaUrl.scheme == "nfs" and
                isIPv6Managed and provisioningNIC.ipv6Networks and not provisioningNIC.ipv6Autoconfig and
                isRHEL7CompatibleMedia("0", targetServer, mediaUrl.scheme, "/" + mediaUrl.fragment if mediaUrl.fragment else "/mnt/media")):
            print "Provisioning {platname} over IPv6 on NFS ".format(platname=keys.platform.full_name.replace(" 7 ", " 7.0 ")) + \
                  "with only a static network configuration is not supported.\n" + \
                  "Enable IPv6 autoconfig or use HTTP/HTTPS for the media."
            return EC_NOT_SUPPORTED

        validation.validateProvisioningNIC(provisioningNIC, targetServer)

        provisioningRoutes = [iproute for iproute in (netinfo.ipv6Routes if isIPv6Managed else netinfo.ipv4Routes)
                              if iproute.nic == provisioningNIC]
        provisioningRoute = provisioningRoutes[0] if provisioningRoutes else None

        validateNetconfig(provisioningNIC, provisioningRoutes)

        ksObj = Kickstart(open(KS_PATH), endtags=isRhel7)
        injectPersonalization(ksObj, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute, isIPv6Managed, isRhel7)

        injectVlanID(provisioningNIC, ksObj)

        if not isRhel7 and "rhel" in TARGET_OS.lower():
            injectRhelWorkaround(ksObj, provisioningNIC)
        elif "esxi4" in TARGET_OS.lower() and provisioningNIC.ipv4Networks:
            injectVmwareESXi41Workaround(ksObj, netinfo, provisioningNIC, provisioningRoute)
        writeKsFile(KS_PATH, ksObj)
        if isRhel7:
            injectSysctlSettings(isIPv6Managed)
    except (OSError, IOError, ShowErrorMessage, OptionValueError), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        print "Failed to inject personalization settings:\n%s" % why
        return EC_EXCEPTION


HPSA_NETCONFIG = """@hpsa_netconfig@"""

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

"""
    (C) Copyright 2012-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Copies a Guest Customization script onto the VM, which will run once, after the next reboot.
"""

import os
import sys
import glob

from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov import constants

LOG = logger.getIt("cleanup_old_macs")


def main():
    TARGET = ThisTargetServer()
    MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR = TARGET.pathToOGFS(constants.OGFS_SYSTEM_ROOT)

    # clean up files with old MAC addresses while still in maintenance mode
    net_rules_paths = ['/etc/udev/rules.d/30-net_persistent_names.rules',
                       '/etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules']
    for net_rules_path in net_rules_paths:
        net_rules_path = MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR + net_rules_path
        if os.path.exists(net_rules_path):
            os.unlink(net_rules_path)
            LOG.debug("Cleaning up file with old MAC address: " + net_rules_path)

    #Remove any legacy versions of ifcfg files
    old_file_names_path = MOUNTED_ROOT_DIR + '/etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-eth-id*'
    filenames = glob.glob(old_file_names_path);
    for filename in filenames:
        LOG.debug("Removing legacy ifcfg files with mac address:" + filename)
        os.unlink(filename)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-

"""
    (C) Copyright 2009-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Initiate a reboot
"""

import sys
import os
import time

from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage, NotFoundError
from osprov import boot
from osprov import helpers
from osprov.scripts import bootmode

# pylint: disable=F0401,E0611
from pytwist import twistserver
from pytwist.com.opsware.search import Filter
# pylint: enable=F0401,E0611

LOG = logger.getIt("reboot_agent")


def main(argv=sys.argv, stdin=sys.stdin,
         stdout=sys.stdout, stderr=sys.stderr):
    """ Reboot the target server"""
    sys.stdin = stdin
    sys.stdout = stdout
    sys.stderr = stderr

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()

    keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)
    if keys.boot.controller:
        bootController = keys.boot.controller(targetServer, LOG)
    else:
        bootController = boot.NetworkBootController(targetServer, LOG)

    try:
        bootController.clearBoot()
    except NotFoundError, why:
        sys.stderr.write("Could not clear the boot configuration.\n\
                          This is safe for deployments that do not have\
                          OS Provisioning components installed.\n\
                          Reason: %s\n" % str(why))

    if (bootmode.getCurrentBootMode(targetServer) == "LEGACY"):
       try:
           bootController.setOneTimeBootOption(boot.OTB.HDD)
       except boot.OTBNotSupportedError as why:
           pass
    else:
        print('Server in UEFI boot mode. One Time Boot option was not set to "Local Disk"')

    try:
        print "Initiating reboot now..."
        targetServer.reboot()
    except (IOError, OSError, ShowErrorMessage), why:
        LOG.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write("Failure while initiating reboot: %s\n" % why)
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

This script will perform token replacement using ScriptWeaver @AttrName@ style syntax in the target file. Values are obtained from SA custom attribute data on the target server. The placeholder tokens must be surrounded with @ signs.

Usage:

parameterize_text_file.py PATH_TO_FILE [PATH_TO_FILE_2...]

where PATH_TO_FILE is the OGFS path or absolute path on the target server to any writable file you would like to perform replacement on.

NOTE that this script is NOT required for ServerScripts and OGFSScripts that are used in OS Build Plans.  The text of any script in an OS Build Plan will automatically be parameterized. Also, the parameters passed to any script used in an OS Build Plan are automatically paramaterized.  This script is only needed when processing other arbitrary files.

Also note that as of SA 9.0, default values may be provided in the parameterization tokens use @AttrName:Default Value@ syntax separating the custom attribute name from the default value with a colon.

For example:

@BackupDay:Sunday@ will be replaced with the value of the BackupDay custom attribute. If there is no BackupDay custom attribute, Sunday will be used.

Prerequisites:
 - Target file must be writable.

"""
    (C) Copyright 2011-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

    Replaces ScriptWeaver @tokens@ with data from the HP SA model in text files
"""
import sys

from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, scriptweaver
from osprov.osbp import logger
from osprov import helpers
from pytwist.com.opsware.osprov import OSBuildPlanRef

LOG = logger.getIt("Parametrize")

targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer, LOG)

for filePath in sys.argv[1:]:
    print "Parameterizing", filePath
    filePath = targetServer.pathToOGFS(filePath)
    inFile = open(filePath)
    fileData = inFile.read()
    inFile.close()
    scriptData = scriptweaver.Translator(
        serverVO=targetServer.getServerVO(),
        planRef=OSBuildPlanRef(keys.papx.buildplan_id),
        twistServer=targetServer.twistServer
    ).sub(fileData)
    outFile = open(filePath, "w")
    outFile.write(scriptData)
    outFile.close()

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
# (C) Copyright 2013-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
#
"""
Validates the custom attributes and fails the build plan if any of the custom attributes
doesn't have a value associated with it.
"""
import optparse
import sys

from osprov.osbp.scriptweaver import Translator
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer
from osprov.errors import ShowErrorMessage
from osprov       import helpers
from pytwist.com.opsware.osprov import OSBuildPlanRef

#pylint: disable=F0401,E0611
from pytwist.com.opsware.custattr import NoSuchFieldException
#pylint: enable=F0401,E0611

EC_USAGE = 1
EC_EXCEPTION = 2
EC_TARGET_SERVER = 5
EC_CUST_ATTR = 6

HELP_MESSAGE = """\nSee the online help for more information about defining and using custom attributes and for\ninformation about commonly used custom attributes."""

# This class is used to validate that the custom attributes, whose names were passed in using the "--custAttrNames" parameter,
# contain a value (e.g. are not empty).
class CustomAttributeValidator(object):

	CA_Failed = False

	def __init__(self, twistServer, targetServer, buildPlanRef):
		self.twistServer = twistServer
		self.targetServer = targetServer
		self.serverRef = targetServer.serverRef
		self.buildPlanRef = buildPlanRef

	# Validate the custom attribute specified by "caName".
	def validateCA(self, caName):
		# Get the value of the custom attribute whose name is contained in the variable "caName".
		caValue = Translator(self.targetServer.getServerVO(), self.buildPlanRef).sub("@" + caName + "@")

		# If the custom attribute "--custAttrNames "WimFileName""  and the value is not set, then it's an error.
		if caName.strip() == "WimFileName" and (not caValue or len(caValue.strip()) == 0):
			ErrorMessage="""\nThe 'WimFileName' custom attribute is not set. This custom attribute is required for this \nbuild plan and specifies the file name for the WIM image you are creating or installing. \nThe captured Windows image (WIM image) will always be located in the Images folder on your \nMedia Server unless you modify the parameters to the Windows Image Capture and Windows \nImage Install OS Build Plan steps to use another folder."""
			sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % ErrorMessage)
			self.CA_Failed = True
		# If the custom attribute "--custAttrNames "HBA_Config""  and the value is not set, then it's an error.
		elif caName.strip() == "HBA_Config" and (not caValue or len(caValue.strip()) == 0):
			ErrorMessage="""\nThe 'HBA_Config' custom attribute is not set. This custom attribute is required for this build \nplan and contains the configuration information for the HBA being configured. See "Configure \nthe boot device on a Fibre Channel HBA" in the online help for more details."""
			sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % ErrorMessage)
			self.CA_Failed = True
		# If the custom attribute "--custAttrNames "ProductKey_*""  and the value is not set, then it's an error.
		elif ("ProductKey" in caName.strip()) and (not caValue or len(caValue.strip()) == 0):
			ErrorMessage="""\nThe '""" + caName + """' custom attribute is not set. This custom attribute is \nrequired for this build plan and represents the product key required to install Windows, \nset by entering product keys from the Settings page of your appliance. If you intend to \ninstall Windows without a product key, you can remove this step from your build plan."""
			sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % ErrorMessage)
			self.CA_Failed = True
		# If the  custom attribute is not set, then it's an error. 
		elif (not caValue or len(caValue.strip()) == 0):
			ErrorMessage="""\nThe '""" + caName + """' custom attribute is required for this build plan and is not set. \nThis step validates the custom attributes defined in the parameter field and fails the \nOS Build Plan if any custom attribute does not have a value associated with it. \n\nSee the author of this build plan for information about this custom attribute."""
			sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % ErrorMessage)
			self.CA_Failed = True


	# Validate the custom attributes whose names appear in the string "caNames".
	def validateCAs(self, caNames):
		# If the  custom attribute Invalid, then it's an error.
		if not caNames or len(caNames.strip()) == 0:
			ErrorMessage="""\nNo parameters specified. Specify a list of space separated custom attribute names using the\n--custAttrNames parameter."""
			raise ShowErrorMessage(ErrorMessage, EC_CUST_ATTR)

		# Parse the space-separated list of custom attribute names and put them into an array.
		nameArray = caNames.split()

		# Validate each custom attribute contained in the array.
		for caName in nameArray:
			self.validateCA(caName)
			
		if self.CA_Failed == True:
			sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % HELP_MESSAGE)
			sys.exit(EC_CUST_ATTR)
			

# This method parses the parameters to this script.
def parseArgs(args):

	# If the  custom attribute Invalid, then it's an error.
	if len(args) >= 1 and ("--custAttrNames" not in args):
        ErrorMessage="""\nInvalid parameters specified. Specify a list of space separated custom attribute names using \nthe --custAttrNames parameter for this step."""
		sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % ErrorMessage)
		sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % HELP_MESSAGE)
		sys.exit(EC_USAGE)
	# If no custom attribute specified, then it's an error.
	elif len(args) < 2 and ("--custAttrNames" in args):
		ErrorMessage="""\nNo custom attribute specified. Specify a list of space separated custom attribute names \nusing the --custAttrNames parameter for this step."""
		sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % ErrorMessage)
		sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % HELP_MESSAGE)
		sys.exit(EC_USAGE)

	# setup and return parsed arguments
	parser = optparse.OptionParser(
		description=__doc__,
		version="1.1.0",
		usage="%prog [--custAttrNames \"<space separated list of custom attribute names>\"]"
	)

	parser.add_option("-c", "--custAttrNames", dest="custAttrNames", metavar="",
		help="This flag controls whether a custom attribute is valid.")
   
	return parser.parse_args(args)

def main():

	opt, args = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])
	
	targetServer = ThisTargetServer()

	keys = helpers.getDataStore(targetServer)

	validator = CustomAttributeValidator(targetServer.twistServer, targetServer, OSBuildPlanRef(keys.papx.buildplan_id))
	
	try:
		# Validate the custom attributes.
		validator.validateCAs(opt.custAttrNames)
	except ShowErrorMessage, why:
		sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % why)
		sys.stderr.write("%s\n" % HELP_MESSAGE)
		return why.exitCode

if __name__ == "__main__":
	sys.exit(main())

allVersions.usage:
On servers configured in UEFI boot mode, this script will force the server into the Intelligent Provisioning Linux Service OS after the ESXi installation has completed, where it will add an ESXi boot option to the UEFI boot menu.  The disk partition with the "ESXi" label is assumed to be the EFI System Partition and will be used when creating the ESXi boot option.

This step is skipped if the server is not configured in UEFI boot mode.

Options:
  --atLeast=MINUTES  The number of minutes to wait before setting a one-time boot to Intelligent Provisioning.  Since a one-time boot cannot be set while a server is going through POST (Power On Self Test), this option can be used to give the server time to complete POST after it has rebooted. Default is 1 minutes.After the wait time,script will retry to set one-time boot after every 30 seconds till it succeeds.Script will throw an error if one-time boot is not set after 20 retrials.
  --atMost=MINUTES  The number of minutes to wait for this script to complete after it has configured the server to one-time boot into Intelligent Provisioning. Default is 45 minutes.
  --bootOptionName=NAME  The name of the boot option that you want added to the UEFI boot menu. Default is "ESXi".
  --efiSystemPartitionLabel=PARTITION_LABEL  The label assigned by the ESXi installer to the EFI System Partition. This option should only be used if the ESXi installer assigns a different label to the EFI System Partition. Default is "ESXi".

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
(C) Copyright 2014-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
"""

import sys
import re
import datetime
import time
from optparse import OptionParser
from osprov import boot
from osprov import ilo
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.util.twist import toByteList, toPyString
from pytwist.com.opsware.common import OpswareException, OpswareSystemException

DEBUG=@Debug:0@

ILO_PERMANENT_NAMESPACE = "PERM"
ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE = "TMP"
SMARTSTART_SSSTK = "SMARTSTART_SSSTK"
ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_PARAMS = "ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_PARAMS"
ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_OUTPUT = "ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_OUTPUT"
ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS = "ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS"

WAIT_AT_LEAST = 1
WAIT_AT_MOST = 45

EC_SUCCESS = 0
EC_FAILED = 1

log = logger.getIt("Add ESXi Boot Option To UEFI Boot Order On Next Reboot")

###############################################################################
###############################################################################
##
## Begin SMARTSTART_SSSTK Intelligent Provisioning startup script
##
###############################################################################
###############################################################################

# This is a Python here document containing the script that we are going to
# place in the SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob.  The SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob is a special
# blob which Intelligent Provisioning reads when it starts up and executes the
# script contained inside the blob.
smartstartSsstkScript = """\
#!/bin/bash

# This is a BASH here document containing the Python script that runs inside IP.
PYTHON_SCRIPT=$(cat <<EOF
#!/usr/bin/python
import sys
import re
import subprocess
import os.path
from subprocess import Popen, PIPE, STDOUT
from optparse import OptionParser

# Parses the command line arguments.
def parseArgs(args):
    parser = OptionParser()
    parser.add_option("--bootOptionName",
            default = "ESXi",
            dest = "bootOptionName",
            help = "The name of the ESXi boot option to add to the UEFI boot menu.")
    parser.add_option("--efiSystemPartitionLabel",
            default = "ESXi",
            dest = "efiSystemPartitionLabel",
            help = "The label assigned to the EFI System Partition by the ESXi installer.")
    options, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    if args:
        parser.error("Additional positional arguments are not supported")
    return options, args

# Converts the specified list to a string that is delimited by the specified
# delimiter character (default = ' ').
def listToString(list, delimeter=' '):

    str = delimeter.join(list)

    return str

# Executes the specified command, which must be a list contaning the 
# executable name and its arguments.
def executeCommand(cmdArgs):

    cmdAsString = listToString(cmdArgs)

    print "Executing => ", cmdAsString

    p = subprocess.Popen(cmdArgs, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=STDOUT)

    output = p.communicate()[0].strip()

    retCode = p.poll()

    p.stdout.close()

    return retCode, output

# Returns the device name of the disk partition that has the specified
# disk label assigned to it.
def getDeviceWithESXiLabel(efiSystemPartitionLabel):

    byLabelPath = "/dev/disk/by-label/" + efiSystemPartitionLabel

    # Check if there's a disk with the "ESXi" label.
    if (os.path.exists(byLabelPath)):
        print "'%s' exists" % byLabelPath

        if (os.path.islink(byLabelPath)):
            print "'%s' is a symlink" % byLabelPath
        else:
            print "'%s' is not a symlink" % byLabelPath
            raise Exception("'%s' is not a symlink" % byLabelPath)
    else:
        print "'%s' not found" % byLabelPath
        raise Exception("'%s' not found" % byLabelPath)

    deviceName = os.path.realpath(byLabelPath)

    print "'%s' label maps to device '%s'" % (byLabelPath,deviceName)

    devicePattern = re.compile(r"^([\S]+)([\d]+)\s*$")

    disk = None
    partition = None

    result = devicePattern.search(deviceName)

    if result:
        disk = result.group(1)
        partition = result.group(2)

    print "The ESXi EFI System Partition is on disk '%s' partition '%s'" % (disk,partition)

    return disk, partition

# Shows the disk labels on the target.(for troubleshooting)
def showDiskLabels():

    cmdArgs = ["ls", "-l", "/dev/disk/by-label"]

    if (retCode == 0):
        print "Found the following disk labels:"
        print output
    else:
        print "Failed to get the disk labels"

# Shows the disk partitions on the target.(for troubleshooting)
def showDiskPartitions():

    cmdArgs = ["cat", "/proc/partitions"]

    retCode, output = executeCommand(cmdArgs)

    if (retCode == 0):
        print "Found the following disk partitions:"
        print output
    else:

# Adds the specified boot option name to the UEFI boot menu, which points
# to the ESXi boot loader on the disk partition that has the specified
# partition label assigned to it.
def addUefiBootOptionForESXi( efiSystemPartitionLabel, bootOptionName):

    disk, partition = getDeviceWithESXiLabel(efiSystemPartitionLabel)

    cmdArgs = ["efibootmgr", "--create", "--disk", disk, "--part", partition, "--label", bootOptionName, "--loader", "\\EFI\\BOOT\\BOOTx64.EFI"]

    retCode, output = executeCommand(cmdArgs)

    if (retCode == 0):
        print "Successfully added boot option '%s'" % bootOptionName
    else:
        print "Failed to add boot option '%s'" % bootOptionName
        raise Exception("An error occurred while executing '%s' : %s" % (listToString(cmdArgs), output))

# Main Routine
def main():

    options, remaining_args = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])

    retCode = 0

    try:
        # Show the available disk partitions.
        showDiskPartitions()

        # Show the available disk partition labels.
        showDiskLabels()

        # Add the ESXi boot option in the UEFI boot menu.
        addUefiBootOptionForESXi( options.efiSystemPartitionLabel, options.bootOptionName)
    except (Exception), why:
        retCode = 1
        sys.stderr.write("An error executing SMARTSTART_SSSTK script:\\n%s\\n" % str(why))

    return retCode

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

# Returns 0 if the specified blob exists in the specified namespace
blobExists() {

    local NAMESPACE=$1
    local BLOB_NAME=$2

    local RET_CODE=0

    local MAX_TRIES=5

    local COUNT=0

    echo "Checking if blob ${BLOB_NAME} exists in namespace ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2

    while [ ${COUNT} -lt ${MAX_TRIES} ]
    do
        # List the blobs in the specified namespace and check if the specified
        # blob is present.
        hpblob -l ${NAMESPACE} | grep "^${BLOB_NAME}\$" > /dev/null

        local CMD_RET_CODE=(${PIPESTATUS[*]})

        # Did the "hpblob" command succeed?
        if [ ${CMD_RET_CODE[0]} -eq 0 ]
        then
            # Did the "grep" find the blob name in the output of "hpblob"?
            if [ ${CMD_RET_CODE[1]} -eq 0 ]
            then
                echo "Blob ${BLOB_NAME} exists in namespace ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2
            else
                echo "Blob ${BLOB_NAME} does not exist in namespace ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2
                RET_CODE=1
            fi

            break
        else
            COUNT=$((COUNT+1))

            sleep 5
        fi
    done

    if [ ${COUNT} -eq ${MAX_TRIES} ]
    then
        echo "Failed to list blobs in ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2
        RET_CODE=1
    fi

    return ${RET_CODE}
}

# Deletes the specified blob from the specified namespace.
deleteBlob() {

    local NAMESPACE=$1
    local BLOB_NAME=$2

    local RET_CODE=0
    local MAX_TRIES=5
    local COUNT=0

    echo "Deleting blob ${BLOB_NAME} from namespace ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2

    while [ ${COUNT} -lt ${MAX_TRIES} ]
    do
        hpblob -d ${NAMESPACE} -k ${BLOB_NAME}

        if [ $? -eq 0 ]
        then
            echo "Successfully deleted blob ${BLOB_NAME}" 1>&2
            break
        else
            COUNT=$((COUNT+1))

            sleep 5
        fi
    done

    if [ ${COUNT} -eq ${MAX_TRIES} ]
    then
        echo "Failed to delete blob ${BLOB_NAME}" 1>&2
        RET_CODE=1
    fi

    return ${RET_CODE}
}

# Reads the specified blob from the specified namespace.
readBlob() {

    local NAMESPACE=$1
    local BLOB_NAME=$2

    local RET_CODE=0

    local MAX_TRIES=5

    local COUNT=0

    if blobExists ${NAMESPACE} ${BLOB_NAME}
    then
        DATA_FILE=$(mktemp /tmp/ssstk_params_XXXXXX)

        if [ $? -eq 0 ]
        then
            echo "Reading blob ${BLOB_NAME} from namespace ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2

            while [ ${COUNT} -lt ${MAX_TRIES} ]
            do
                BLOB_DATA=$(hpblob -r ${NAMESPACE} -k ${BLOB_NAME} -f ${DATA_FILE})

                if [ $? -eq 0 ]
                then
                    echo "Successfully read blob ${BLOB_NAME}" 1>&2
                    break
                else
                    COUNT=$((COUNT+1))

                    sleep 5
                fi
            done

            if [ ${COUNT} -eq ${MAX_TRIES} ]
            then
                echo "Failed to read blob ${BLOB_NAME}" 1>&2
                RET_CODE=1
            fi

            cat "${DATA_FILE}"

            rm -f ${DATA_FILE}
        else
            echo "readBlob() could not create temporary file" 1>&2
            RET_CODE=1
        fi
    else
        echo "Not attempting to read blob ${BLOB_NAME} from ${NAMESPACE}, since it does not exist" 1>&2
    fi

    return ${RET_CODE}
}

# Writes the data contained in the specified data file to the specified blob
# in the specified namespace.
writeBlob() {

    local NAMESPACE=$1
    local BLOB_NAME=$2
    local DATA_FILE=$3

    local RET_CODE=0

    local MAX_TRIES=5

    local COUNT=0

    echo "Writing blob ${BLOB_NAME} to namespace ${NAMESPACE}" 1>&2

    while [ ${COUNT} -lt ${MAX_TRIES} ]
    do
        hpblob -w ${NAMESPACE} -k ${BLOB_NAME} -f ${DATA_FILE}

        if [ $? -eq 0 ]
        then
            echo "Successfully wrote blob ${BLOB_NAME}" 1>&2
            break
        else
            COUNT=$((COUNT+1))

            sleep 5
        fi
    done

    if [ ${COUNT} -eq ${MAX_TRIES} ]
    then
        echo "Failed to write blob ${BLOB_NAME}" 1>&2
        RET_CODE=1
    fi

    return ${RET_CODE}
}

# output to a log file.

# If we successfully created the ESXi boot option in the UEFI Boot Menu, then

then

        ln -s /bin/reboot /sbin/reboot

"""

###############################################################################
###############################################################################
##
## End SMARTSTART_SSSTK Intelligent Provisioning startup script
##
###############################################################################
###############################################################################

# Parses the command line arguments
def parseArgs(args):
    parser = OptionParser()
    parser.add_option("--atLeast",
            type="int", metavar="MINUTES", default=WAIT_AT_LEAST,
            dest = "atLeast",
            help="the number of minutes to wait before configuring the server \
            to do a one-time boot to Intelligent Provisioning: %default minute(s)")
    parser.add_option("--atMost",
            type="int", metavar="MINUTES", default=WAIT_AT_MOST,
            dest = "atMost",
            help="the maximum number of minutes to wait for the script that \
            sets the ESXi boot option from within Intelligent Provisioning \
            to complete; default value: %default minute(s)")
    parser.add_option("--bootOptionName",
            default = "ESXi",
            dest = "bootOptionName",
            help = "The name of the ESXi boot option to add to the UEFI boot menu.")
    parser.add_option("--efiSystemPartitionLabel",
            default = "ESXi",
            dest = "efiSystemPartitionLabel",
            help = "The label assigned to the EFI System Partition by the ESXi installer.")
    options, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    if args:
        parser.error("Additional positional arguments are not supported")

    return options, args

# Writes an debug message to stdout.
def writeDebugMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stdout so that it shows up in the job output.
    if (DEBUG):
        print msg

# Writes an info message to stdout.
def writeInfoMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stdout so that it shows up in the job output.
    print msg

# Writes an error message to stderr.
def writeErrorMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stderr so that it shows up in the job output.
    sys.stderr.write(msg)

# Returns "True" if the server is in UEFI mode; "False" otherwise.
def isServerInUefiMode(iloMgmtProc):

    currentBootMode = iloMgmtProc.getCurrentBootMode()

    uefiPattern = re.compile(r".*UEFI.*")

    result = uefiPattern.search(currentBootMode)

    if result:
        uefiMode = True
    else:
        uefiMode = False

    return uefiMode

# Writes a blob to the specified namespace.
def writeBlob( iloMgmtProc, iloNameSpace, blobName, blobData):

    writeDebugMessage("Writing blob %s to namespace %s" % (blobName, iloNameSpace))

    iloMgmtProc.ims.writeBlobStore( iloMgmtProc.iloManagerRef, iloNameSpace, blobName, toByteList(blobData))

# Reads a blob from the specified namespace.
def readBlob( iloMgmtProc, iloNameSpace, blobName):

    writeDebugMessage("Reading blob %s from namespace %s" % (blobName, iloNameSpace))

    blobData = toPyString(iloMgmtProc.ims.readBlobStore( iloMgmtProc.iloManagerRef, iloNameSpace, blobName))

    return blobData

# Deletes a blob from the specified namespace.
def deleteBlob( iloMgmtProc, iloNameSpace, blobName):

    writeDebugMessage("Deleting blob %s from namespace %s" % (blobName, iloNameSpace))

    try:
        iloMgmtProc.ims.deleteBlobStore( iloMgmtProc.iloManagerRef, iloNameSpace, blobName)
    except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException):
        writeDebugMessage("Failed to delete blob %s.  Blob may not exist." % blobName)

# Sets a one-time boot to the specified boot device.
def setOneTimeBoot( iloMgmtProc, bootDevice):

    writeInfoMessage("Setting one-time boot to %s" % bootDevice)
    retrial=1
    MaxRetrials = 20
    while True:
                try:
                     writeDebugMessage("Trying to set OTB, Retry Index = %s." % retrial)
                     iloMgmtProc.setOneTimeBootOption(bootDevice)
                except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException, Exception), why:
                     time.sleep(30)
                     retrial = retrial + 1
                     if(retrial < MaxRetrials):
                        continue
                     else:
                        writeInfoMessage("Faild to set One Time Boot Flag.(Retry Count = %d)" % retrial)
                        writeInfoMessage(why.message)
                        raise
                break
    writeInfoMessage("Successfully set One Time Boot")
 
# Configures the server to do a one-time boot to Intelligent Provisioning.
def setOneTimeBootToIntelligentProvisioning(iloMgmtProc):

    writeDebugMessage("Setting one-time boot to Intelligent Provisioning")

    setOneTimeBoot( iloMgmtProc, "EMB-TOOLKIT-LX")

# Waits for the script contained inside the SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob to finish
# executing.  The script will return its exit code inside the
# ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS blob and its output inside the
# ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_OUTPUT blob.
def waitForScriptToComplete( iloMgmtProc, timeout):

    writeDebugMessage("Waiting for Intelligent Provisioning to launch and startup script to complete")

    lastIloError = None

    currentTime = time.time()
    expirationTime = currentTime + timeout

    # Wait until our SMARTSTART_SSSTK script that's running on Intelligent Provisioning
    # completes and writes its exit status to the ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS blob, or
    # until we reach our timeout.  Any exceptions from "readBlob()" are propagated up
    # the call stack.
    while (time.time() < expirationTime):
        blobData = readBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS)

        # The readBlob() function returns "None" (e.g. null) when there is no such blob.
        # Our ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS blob won't exist until our SMARTSTART_SSSTK
        # script that's running on Intelligent Provisioning completes.
        if (blobData is None):
            time.sleep(30)
            continue

        return blobData

    raise Exception("Timed out after %s seconds waiting for Intelligent Provisioning script to complete" % timeout)

# Writes our startup script to the SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob so that it is executed
# by Intelligent Provisioning when it boots.
def writeSsstkScriptAndParamsToBlobStore( iloMgmtProc, options):

    params = ""

    # Propagate the "--bootOptionName" option, if specified, to our startup script.
    if (options.bootOptionName is not None):
        params += " \"--bootOptionName=" + options.bootOptionName + "\""

    # Propagate the "--efiSystemPartitionLabel" option, if specified, to our startup script.
    if (options.efiSystemPartitionLabel is not None):
        params += " \"--efiSystemPartitionLabel=" + options.efiSystemPartitionLabel + "\""

    # Write the parameters that we're going to pass to our startup script to the
    # ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_PARAMS blob.
    writeBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_PARAMS, params)

    # Write our startup script to the SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob so that it is executed by
    # Intelligent Provisioning when it boots.
    writeBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_PERMANENT_NAMESPACE, SMARTSTART_SSSTK, smartstartSsstkScript)

# Main Routine
def main():

    options, remaining_args = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()

    iloMgmtProc = ilo.getIlo(targetServer, log=log)

    uefiBootMode = False

    try:
        uefiBootMode = isServerInUefiMode(iloMgmtProc)
    except (Exception), why:
        writeErrorMessage("Error determining boot mode:\n%s\n" % str(why))
        return EC_FAILED

    if (uefiBootMode):
        writeDebugMessage("Boot Mode is UEFI")

        writeDebugMessage("Waiting %d minutes before configuring server to one-time boot to Intelligent Provisioning" % options.atLeast)

        # The assumption is that the target server has been rebooted in the previous
        # build plan step, so we'll wait for a little while to allow the server to
        # complete POST and boot the ESXi installer from the stub partition.  Once
        # the server is past POST, it is safe to set the one-time boot to Intelligent
        # Provisioning.
        time.sleep(options.atLeast * 60)

        try:
            # Clean up old blobs from prior runs.
            deleteBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_OUTPUT);
            deleteBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_STATUS);
            deleteBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_PARAMS);

            writeSsstkScriptAndParamsToBlobStore( iloMgmtProc, options)

            setOneTimeBootToIntelligentProvisioning(iloMgmtProc)

            retCode = waitForScriptToComplete( iloMgmtProc, options.atMost * 60)

            writeDebugMessage("Script Exit Code: %s" % retCode)

            scriptOutput = readBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_OUTPUT)

            writeDebugMessage("Script Output:\n\n%s" % scriptOutput)
 
            if (int(retCode) == 0):
                writeInfoMessage("Successfully set ESXi Boot Option")
            else:
                raise Exception("Intelligent Provisioning script failed")

        except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException, Exception), why:
            writeErrorMessage("Could not set ESXi Boot Option:\n%s\n" % str(why))
            return EC_FAILED
        finally:
            # The SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob is typically deleted from the script contained
            # inside it, which Intelligent Provisioning will run when it boots.  However,
            # if there was an error anywhere along the way, the SMARTSTART_SSSTK blob
            # may not have been deleted, which may be problematic for the next build plan
            # that is run.  So, let's try to delete it here, whether it exists or not.
            deleteBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_PERMANENT_NAMESPACE, SMARTSTART_SSSTK);
            deleteBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_SMARTSTART_SSSTK_PARAMS);
    else:
        writeInfoMessage("Boot Mode is not UEFI.  Skipping this step.")

    return EC_SUCCESS

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

On servers configured in UEFI boot mode, this script will force the server into the Intelligent Provisioning Linux Service OS after the ESXi installation has completed, where it will add an ESXi boot option to the UEFI boot menu.  The disk partition with the "ESXi" label is assumed to be the EFI System Partition and will be used when creating the ESXi boot option.

This step is skipped if the server is not configured in UEFI boot mode.

Options:
  --atLeast=MINUTES  The number of minutes to wait before setting a one-time boot to Intelligent Provisioning.  Since a one-time boot cannot be set while a server is going through POST (Power On Self Test), this option can be used to give the server time to complete POST after it has rebooted. Default is 1 minutes.After the wait time,script will retry to set one-time boot after every 30 seconds till it succeeds.Script will throw an error if one-time boot is not set after 20 retrials.
  --atMost=MINUTES  The number of minutes to wait for this script to complete after it has configured the server to one-time boot into Intelligent Provisioning. Default is 45 minutes.
  --bootOptionName=NAME  The name of the boot option that you want added to the UEFI boot menu. Default is "ESXi".
  --efiSystemPartitionLabel=PARTITION_LABEL  The label assigned by the ESXi installer to the EFI System Partition. This option should only be used if the ESXi installer assigns a different label to the EFI System Partition. Default is "ESXi".

"""
(C) Copyright 2014-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
Validates Build plan is running on supported server model.
The script takes --prodname as argument 
Eg. -prodname="PROLIANT WS460C GEN9 WS BLADE"
"""

import sys

from optparse import OptionParser, OptionError
from pytwist.com.opsware.server import ServerRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.server import ServerHardwareVO
from osprov import sa
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer

class validateServerplatform(OptionParser):
#parse the arguments provided
#prodname:- Takes the Product name of the server 
	def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
		OptionParser.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
		self.add_option("--prodname", help="validates support of the selected server")
		self.add_option("--exact", help="matches exact sequence to product name", dest='exactmatch', default =False, action = 'store_true')
		self.usage = "Pass --prodname as argument with valid comma separated server productname list."

twistServer = sa.getTwistServer()

def main():
	options, remainingArgs = validateServerplatform().parse_args()
	# save the server models 
	listprodname= options.prodname
	if not listprodname:
		raise OptionError ("Missing required argument", "--prodname")
	#Check if the paramter passed has more then one server model passed.
	arrlist = listprodname.split(",")
	
	try:
	# Get the server SA ID and then get its Product name as listed in Appliance
        mid = ThisTargetServer().id
		objServerHardwareVO = twistServer.server.ServerService.getServerHardwareVO(ServerRef(mid))
		strServerModel = objServerHardwareVO.getModel()
		#Traverse throught the list of supported server passed as arugment and check if the target selected matches in the list.
		for (strlist) in  arrlist:
			strlist.strip()
			if options.exactmatch:
				if strlist.lower() in strServerModel.lower():
					print "The target %s is supported\n" % strServerModel
					sys.exit(0)
			else:
				#Check for each key word is present in Product name
				arrname= strlist.split(" ")
				counter=0
				for (servermodel) in arrname :
					if servermodel.lower() in strServerModel.lower():
						counter = counter + 1
				if (counter == len(arrname)):
						print "The target %s is supported\n" % strServerModel
						sys.exit(0)

		print "The build plan can not run on the current server model %s." % strServerModel
		print "The build plan requires one of the following server model(s):"
		for (strlist) in  arrlist:
			print "\t%s" %strlist
		print "Please run the build plan on an appropriate platform or update the build plan."
		sys.exit(2)
				
				
	except (IOError, OSError), ose:
        sys.stderr.write("Unable to read the target server's MID in the OGFS. %s\n" % ose.args[0])
        return EC_TARGET_SERVER
	   
if __name__ == "__main__":

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
'''
(C) Copyright 2012-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

This script verifies that the target server is running the correct version of the OS for this build plan.
So that, this script can be used a step in any OSBP that would like to prevent the accidental work on a
different OS version.

The script at present supports the following Windows flavours :
	--------------------------------------------------------------
	 FCQN of OS			Short name to be used as argument
	--------------------------------------------------------------
	 Windows 2008 			Win2008
	 Windows 2008 R2 		Win2008R2
	 Windows 2012			Win2012
	 Windows 2012 R2		Win2012R2
	 Windows 7			Win7
	 Windows 8.1			Win81
	---------------------------------------------------------------
	
New flavours of Windows can be easily added to extend the support by placing the short name and FCQN in
OsNameTuple tuple list.  The script uses the longest match pattern to accurately identify the OS version that
is running on the target machine.  This pattern is much desired to identify same family of OS versions that
simply differs by release version (e.g. R2).

The typical usage displays the following help text.

	Check Windows OS Version
        Usage: --version=<OS Short-name1>,<OS Short-name2> ...
            Version keyword :  ['--version']
            OS short names  :  ['Win2008', 'Win2008R2', 'Win2012', 'Win2012R2', 'Win7', 'Win81']

        Example: Check Windows OS Version --version=Win2012,Win2012R2 

In future if the same functionality has to be extended for Linux flavours, simply add the FCQN and their
corresponding short names to OsNameTuple.  It will simply work! The entire step is platform agnostic.		

'''

import re
import subprocess
import sys
from pytwist 						import *
from pytwist.com.opsware.server 		import ServerRef, ServerDetails
from osprov.osbp 					import logger, thisServerID, ThisTargetServer
from pytwist.com.opsware.server 		import ServerRef
from osprov.osbp import logger

sys.path.append("/opt/opsware/pylibs")

# Variable holding the reference to the Twist Server
TwistServerInstance = twistserver.TwistServer()

# Variable holding the value of server id aka SA Object Id 
ThisServerIdentity = thisServerID()

# Variable holding reference to target servers reference structure
ThisServerReference = ServerRef( ThisServerIdentity )

# Variable holding reference to server service of the twist server
ThisServerService = TwistServerInstance.server.ServerService

# Variable holding reference to target servers inventory
ThisServerVO = ThisServerService.getServerVO( ThisServerReference )
  
LOG = logger.getIt("Check Windows OS Version")

# Tuple list enlisting the OS flavours that are going to be supported by this script.  To extend the script 
# further to support any other OS, simply have to add the short-name and the full name into this list as tuple
OsNameTuple = [	
		('Win2008', 		'Windows 2008'), 
		('Win2008R2',	'Windows 2008 R2'), 
		('Win2012', 		'Windows 2012'), 
		('Win2012R2', 	'Windows 2012 R2'), 
		('Win7',		'Windows 7'),
        	('Win81',        'Windows 8.1')		
	       ]
# Name of this function; helpful in uncluttering the code
FunctionNameString = 'Check Windows OS Version'
# Verifies the version parameter passed in script with the following valid version parameter 
VersionParameter  = ['--version']
# OS short name parameters; will be populated with only the OS short names from the parameter list
OsShortNameParameterList = []
# Will be populated from the OsNameTuple during parameter verification.  Though this is not needed still
# helps in repeating the code to extract the short names from the tuple list (OsNameTuple)
OsShortNamesList = []

# Get the full OS name from appliance.
def getOSName():
	return ThisServerVO.getOsFlavor()

# The usage display function that emits the help text on the right usage of the script.
def showUsageHelp() :
	print '{0:s}\n\tUsage: --version=<OS Shortname1>,<OS Shortname2> ...'.format(FunctionNameString)
	print '\t\tVersion keyword : ', VersionParameter
	print '\t\tOS short names   : ', [ sn for (sn, ln) in OsNameTuple ]
	print '\n\tExample: {0:s} --version=Win2012,Win2012R2'.format(FunctionNameString)
	print '\n\tNote: Short names are comma separated and no spaces are allowed'
	
# When called evaluates all the arguments to the script and populates the necessary data structure for
# consumption later.
def validateArguments(argv) :
	# Too few argument check!
	if ( len(argv) != 2 ) :
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
		
	global OsShortNameParameterList
	global OsShortNamesList
		
	# Pick the version argument for checking it later
	version_arg   = argv[1]
	#Populates the list of os_sn values passed in script into the os_snParameterList 
	os_snParameterList = []
	
	if(version_arg.find("=") == -1) :
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)

	#Split the version parameter and os_sn values into separate strings for validation
	versionParam , os_snParameterList = version_arg.split("=")

	if((len(versionParam) == 0) or (len(os_snParameterList) == 0)) :
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)

	# Assign the OS version parameters to OsShortNameParameterList
	OsShortNameParameterList = os_snParameterList.split(",")		

	# Extract and assign all the defined OS short names. Done in order to prevent repeated extraction later
	OsShortNamesList = [ sn for (sn, ln) in OsNameTuple ] 
	# List comprehension! For every valid short names declared evaluate whether or not the same is passed
	# as argument by the user calling the script
	os_found = [ sn for sn in OsShortNamesList if sn in OsShortNameParameterList ]

	# Finally validate the version string itself against valid set of version strings
	
	if ( versionParam not in VersionParameter ) :
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
		
	# Verify whether all the supplied OS versions are valid.  When the lengths of both the lists differ
	# it simply means that some argument passed is invalid
	if len(os_found) != len(OsShortNameParameterList) :
		# Found an entry that is not supported by this OSBP step Inform the user about this and show 
		# all the supported OS and their short names
		missing = [ os_sn for os_sn in OsShortNameParameterList if os_sn not in OsShortNamesList ]

		print 'ERROR: Invalid OS short name(s) -> ', missing
		print 'INFO : Valid list of OS short names are given below'
		print '\t', OsShortNamesList		
		sys.exit(1)
		
	return True
	
# Then entry point function for the script.	
def main(argv) :
	if ( validateArguments(argv) ) :
		current_os_tuple = ()
		os_matched 	 = False
		os_name		 = getOSName() 
		
		if not os_name or os_name == "" :
			print 'ERROR: Unknown OS detected'
			print 'INFO : Non-Windows OS detected. This build plan can only be run on Microsoft Windows.'			
			sys.exit(-2)
			
		if not os_name :
			print 'ERROR: Unknown OS detected'
			print 'INFO : Non-Windows OS detected. This build plan can only be run on Microsoft Windows.'
			sys.exit(-2)
			
		# Very important step, never remove this or modify.  Change to this line would impact
		# the entire evaluation logic using regular expression.  The following line sets the 
		# right order for longest length match
		OsNameTuple.sort(reverse=True)
		
		# Debug statement comment it out for the production code.
		# print OsNameTuple
		# print os_name, os_name
		
		
		for (os_sn, os_ln) in OsNameTuple :
			# Generate the pattern string against each of the OS long name. To this add the 
			# regular expression pattern to be used for RE evaluation
			sn_list    = os_ln.split(' ')
			sn_pat_str = '(.*)'.join(sn_list)
			matched_os = re.search(sn_pat_str, os_name)
			
			# If a match is found the assign the short and long OS name to tuple set.  Also 
			# if the short name is part of the requested OS short name list turn the matched
			# flag and break off.  
			if matched_os :
				current_os_tuple = (os_sn, os_ln)

				if os_sn in OsShortNameParameterList :
					os_matched = True
			
				# Be careful with this break statement, one position off would certainly break
				# the code and should be tab aligned to the inner if statement.
				break

		if os_matched :
			print ' Current running OS "{0} ({1})"\n'.format( os_ln, os_sn )
			print ' This OS is supported for this build plan. '

		else:
			print 'ERROR: This server is not running a version of Windows that is compatible with this build plan.\nThe',
			print 'parameters of this step indicate that the server be running one of the following operating systems:'
			
			for os_expected in [ (os_sn, os_ln) for (os_sn, os_ln) in OsNameTuple if os_sn in OsShortNameParameterList ] :
				print '\t{0} ({1})'.format( os_expected[1], os_expected[0])
				
			print '\nHowever, this server is running {0} ({1})\n'.format( current_os_tuple[1], current_os_tuple[0] )
			print 'Action: Please run the build plan that is appropriate for the version of Windows your server is running,\n',
			print 'or update the parameters of this step to allow running on this version of windows by adding \n',
			print '"{0}" to the parameter list.'.format( current_os_tuple[0] )
			
			sys.exit(1)

# Call the main with arguments
if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main(sys.argv))

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
"""
(C) Copyright 2014-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
"""

import sys
import re
import time
from optparse import OptionParser
from osprov import ilo
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.util.twist import toByteList, toPyString
from pytwist.com.opsware.common import OpswareException, OpswareSystemException
from pytwist.com.opsware.ilo import IloException

DEBUG=@Debug:0@

ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE = "TMP"
ICSP_UEFI_FIBRE_CHANNEL_FIRST = "ICSP_UEFI_FIBRE_CHANNEL_FIRST"

EC_SUCCESS = 0
EC_FAILED = 1

log = logger.getIt("configure_boot_from_san")

# Parses the command line arguments.
def parseArgs(args):
    parser = OptionParser()
    parser.add_option("--fibre_channel_first", 
            action="store_true",
            default=False,
            dest = "fibreChannelFirst",
            help = "Moves the fibre channel device to the top of the UEFI boot order.")
    options, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    if args:
        parser.error("Additional positional arguments are not supported")
    return options, args

# Writes an debug message to stdout.
def writeDebugMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stdout so that it shows up in the job output.
    if (DEBUG):
        print msg

# Writes an info message to stdout.
def writeInfoMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stdout so that it shows up in the job output.
    print msg

# Writes an error message to stderr.
def writeErrorMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stderr so that it shows up in the job output.
    sys.stderr.write(msg)

# Returns "True" if the server is in UEFI mode; "False" otherwise.
def isServerInUefiMode(iloMgmtProc):

    currentBootMode = iloMgmtProc.getCurrentBootMode()

    if (DEBUG):
        print "currentBootMode = %s" % currentBootMode

    # For UEFI, the boot mode can come back as UEFI, UEFI_OPTIMIZED, or UEFI_OPTIMIZED_SECURE.
    uefiPattern = re.compile(r".*UEFI.*")

    result = uefiPattern.search(currentBootMode)

    if result:
        uefiMode = True
    else:
        uefiMode = False

    return uefiMode

# Writes a blob to the specified namespace.
def writeBlob( iloMgmtProc, iloNameSpace, blobName, blobData):

    writeDebugMessage("Writing blob %s to namespace %s" % (blobName, iloNameSpace))

    maxTries = 10

    # Retry loop in case the iLO can't service our request and gives us an error.
    for i in range( 0, maxTries):
        try:
            iloMgmtProc.ims.writeBlobStore( iloMgmtProc.iloManagerRef, iloNameSpace, blobName, toByteList(blobData))
            break
        except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException), why:
            writeDebugMessage("Failed to write blob %s on try %d of %d" % (blobName, (i+1), maxTries))

            if (i < (maxTries - 1)):
                time.sleep(15)
            else:
                raise Exception("Failed to write blob %s: %s" % (blobName, why))

# Main Routine
def main():

    options, remaining_args = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()

    iloMgmtProc = None

    # Don't fail the step if the target server has no iLO, since the target server
    # may be a VM.
    try:
        iloMgmtProc = ilo.getIlo(targetServer, log=log)
    except (Exception), why:
        writeInfoMessage("This server has no iLO")
        writeDebugMessage(str(why))

    # Does the server have an associated iLO?
    if (iloMgmtProc is not None):
        uefiBootMode = False

        try:
            writeInfoMessage("Enabling boot from SAN")
            iloMgmtProc.ims.enableBootFromSAN(iloMgmtProc.iloManagerRef)
        except (IloException, Exception), why:
            writeErrorMessage("Error configuring boot from SAN:\n%s\n" % str(why))
            return EC_FAILED

        try:
            # Query the iLO to see if the server is in UEFI boot mode.
            uefiBootMode = isServerInUefiMode(iloMgmtProc)
        except (IloException, Exception), why:
            writeErrorMessage("Error determining boot mode:\n%s\n" % str(why))
            return EC_FAILED

        # We can only change the boot order if the server is in UEFI boot mode.  If the
        # server is not in UEFI boot mode, then we do nothing.
        if (uefiBootMode):
            writeDebugMessage("Boot Mode is UEFI")

            if (options.fibreChannelFirst):
                try:
                    writeInfoMessage("Moving Fibre Channel to top of UEFI boot order")

                    # Writing anything to the ICSP_UEFI_FIBRE_CHANNEL_FIRST blob causes
                    # the fibre channel device to be moved to the top of the UEFI boot
                    # order.
                    writeBlob( iloMgmtProc, ILO_TEMPORARY_NAMESPACE, ICSP_UEFI_FIBRE_CHANNEL_FIRST, "1")
                except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException, Exception), why:
                    writeErrorMessage("Could not move fibre channel device to top of UEFI boot order:\n%s\n" % str(why))
                    return EC_FAILED
        else:
            writeInfoMessage("Boot Mode is not UEFI.")
    else:
        writeInfoMessage("Target server does not have an iLO.  Skipping this step.")

    return EC_SUCCESS

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

log = logger.getIt("shutdown_server")

# Parses the command line arguments.
def parseArgs(args):
    parser = OptionParser()

    parser.add_option("--failVM",
           action="store_true",
           default=False,
           dest="failVM",
           help="Fail if target server is a VM")
    options, args = parser.parse_args(args)
    if args:
        parser.error("Additional positional arguments are not supported")
    return options, args

# Writes an debug message to stdout.
def writeDebugMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stdout so that it shows up in the job output.
    if (DEBUG):
        print msg

# Writes an info message to stdout.
def writeInfoMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stdout so that it shows up in the job output.
    print msg

# Writes an error message to stderr.
def writeErrorMessage(msg):

    # Write the message to stderr so that it shows up in the job output.
    sys.stderr.write(msg)

# Main Routine
def main():

    options, remaining_args = parseArgs(sys.argv[1:])

    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()

    iloMgmtProc = None

    # Don't fail the step if the target server has no iLO, since the target server
    # may be a VM.
    try:
        iloMgmtProc = ilo.getIlo(targetServer, log=log)
    except (Exception), why:
        if (options.failVM):
            writeErrorMessage("The server cannot be powered off because it has no iLO.\n")
            writeErrorMessage("If the server is a VM and you don't want the script to fail, do not use the --failVM option.\n")
            writeErrorMessage(str(why) + "\n")
            return EC_FAILED
        else:
            writeDebugMessage(str(why))

    # Does the server have an associated iLO?
    if (iloMgmtProc is not None):
        uefiBootMode = False

        try:
            writeInfoMessage("Powering off server via the iLO")
            iloMgmtProc.ims.setPowerStatus(iloMgmtProc.iloManagerRef, False)
            writeInfoMessage("Power off complete")
        except (IloException, Exception), why:
            writeErrorMessage("An error occurred while attempting to power off server:\n%s\n" % str(why))
            return EC_FAILED
    else:
        writeInfoMessage("Target server does not have an iLO.  Skipping this step.")

    return EC_SUCCESS

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())

	UUID 				UUID 					
	Serial 				Serial Number 			
	CPU 				# of CPUs 				
	Memory 				Memory 					
	NIC_Name 			Deployment NIC Name 	
	NIC_MAC_Address 		Deployment NIC MAC address 
	IP_Address 			Deployment IP 			
	iLO_IP 				iLO IP address 			
	Rack 				Rack 					
	Enclosure 			Enclosure 				
	Bay 				Bay 					
	SA_Object_Id 			SA Object ID 			
	Manufacturer 			Manufacturer 			
	Num_Disks 			Number of disks 	
	Disk_Size			Total storage assigned to server		
	Appliance_IP 			Appliance deployment IP 
	Media_Server_Share_IP 		Media server share IP 		
	Media_Server_Http_IP		HTTP media server IP 

==========================================================================================
	
ARGUMENTS AND IMPLICATIONS
--------------------------
The step offers several arguments which it supports for the users benefit.  Below is the 
list of arguments and their implications on the step.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
	Arguments			Implication
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
	
	--all				When specified, the script removes all of the custom attributes associated with that server.
								
	--allGeneratedAttrs 		When specified, removes only custom attributes that were set on the target server using the Collect and Store System Data  step.

	--custAttrNames	"CA1 CA2 ..." 	When specified removed just the specified custom attributes from the server.
								

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	


USAGE GUIDELINES
----------------
Following are the general guidelines for using the step.

	1. --all, --allGeneratedAttrs and --custAttrNames are mutually exclusive.  When both the arguments are passed the
		step will generate error and stop further execution
		
	2. --all or --allGeneratedAttrs or --custAttrNames is mandatory for the step. When none of them are mentioned the
		step will generate usage help and generate error

		
EXAMPLES ON THE STEP
--------------------
	To remove all the custom attributes set on the target server/machine 
		--all
		
	To remove all the custom attributes set using the step "Create Custom Attributes For Server"
	from the target machine
		--allGeneratedAttrs
		
	To remove only selected set of attributes from the target server/machine
		--custAttrNames "NIC_MAC_Address Manufacturer Appliance_IP"
		

'''

import re
import platform
import sys
import string

from pytwist 							import *
from pytwist.com.opsware.search 		import Filter
from pytwist.com.opsware.server 		import ServerRef, ServerDetails
from osprov.osbp 						import logger, thisServerID, ThisTargetServer
from osprov.decorators 					import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.ogfs 						import ogsh_spin
from osprov.server.sa 					import SAServer
from pytwist.com.opsware.server 		import ServerRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.shared 		import TwistConsoleService
from pytwist.com.opsware.mgmtservice 	import *

sys.path.append("/opt/opsware/pylibs")

# The log file
LOG = logger.getIt("Remove Custom Attributes From Server")

# Valid attribute list
ValidServerAttributes = [
		('Model', 					'Hardware Model'), 			
		('UUID', 					'UUID'), 					
		('Serial', 					'Serial Number'), 			
		('CPU', 					'# of CPUs'), 				
		('Memory', 					'Memory'), 					
		('NIC_Name', 				'Deployment NIC Name'), 	
		('NIC_MAC_Address', 		'Deployment NIC MAC Address'), 
		('IP_Address', 				'Deployment IP Address'), 			
		('iLO_IP', 					'iLO IP Address'),
		('Rack', 					'Rack'), 					
		('Enclosure', 				'Enclosure'), 				
		('Bay', 					'Bay'), 					
		('SA_Object_Id', 			'SA Object ID'), 			
		('Manufacturer', 			'Manufacturer'), 			
		('Num_Disks', 				'Number of disks'), 		
		('Disk_Size',				'Total storage assigned to server'),	
		('Appliance_IP', 			'Appliance deployment IP'), 
		('Media_Server_Share_IP',	'Media server share IP'), 		
	    ('Media_Server_HTTP_IP',    'HTTP media server IP')
	]
	
# Valid arguments list
ValidArgumentsList = [
		'--all',
		'--allGeneratedAttrs',
		'--custAttrNames'
	]

# Name of this function; helpful in uncluttering the code
FunctionName = 'Remove Custom Attributes From Server'

# Parameters passed for --allGeneratedAttrs agrument will be held in this
ParametersForAllVars = []

# Boolean flag to indicate whether its going to be a clean sweep or not
RemoveAllCustomAttributes = False

# Boolean flag to indicate whether we need to remove selected variables
# from the server or not.  We need a seperate variable for this as to seek
# whether or not all the parameters given to be removed are correct and there
# is actually something to remove.  Combining this with RemoveAllCustomAttributes
# might yield adverse results.
RemoveSelectedCustomAttributes = False

# Twiste server instance
TwistServerInstance = twistserver.TwistServer()

# Target servers reference object
ThisServerReference = ServerRef( thisServerID() )

# Target sever's server service instance reference
ThisServerService = TwistServerInstance.server.ServerService

# The usage display function that emits the help text on the right usage of the script.
def showUsageHelp() :
	index = 0
	
	print '\nStep : {0:s}\n\nUsage:  --all | --allGeneratedAttrs | --custAttrNames "CA1 CA2 ..."'.format(FunctionName)
	print '\n\tArguments --all, --allGeneratedAttrs and --custAttrNames are mutually exclusive.'
	print '\n\t--all               : when mentioned, this step will remove only the server level custom  ' \
			'\n\t\t\t      attributes assigned to this server' \
			'\n\t--allGeneratedAttrs : when mentioned, all the custom attributes that were create by the step  \n' \
			'\t\t\t      "Create Custom Attributes For Server" will be removed from the server.\n' \
			'\t--custAttrNames     : when mentiond removes a list of custom attributes supplied to it.\n'

	print '\n\tAttributes that will be removed when --allGeneratedAttrs is passed are given below.\n\t    ',
		
	for item in ValidServerAttributes :
		index = index + 1
		print '%-23s ' % item[0],
		if ( index % 3 == 0) :
			print '\n\t    ',
	print '\n\n\tNOTE: --custAttrNames, in additon to above listed parameters can take any other valid \n' \
			'\t      Custom Attribute associated with the server'
	

def validateArguments(argv) :
	# Extract only the arguments from the list of arguments provided
	args = [ argument for argument in argv if argument[0:2] == '--' ]		
	argLen = len(args)
	
	if ( argLen < 1 ) :
		print 'ERROR: No arguments are provided for the step. Please refer to the help on step.' 
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
	
	if argLen > 1 :
		print 'ERROR: Conflicting arguments are provided for the step.  Please refer to the help on step.'
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
		
	# Extract only those arguments that are not valid arguments
	notArgs = [ argument for argument in args if argument not in ValidArgumentsList ]

	if len(notArgs) > 0 :
		print 'ERROR: Invalid arguments passed for the step'
		print 'INFO : List of invalid arguments are : ', ', '.join(notArgs)
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
		
	global ValidAttributesList
	global ParametersForAllVars
	global RemoveAllCustomAttributes
	global RemoveSelectedCustomAttributes

	ValidAttributesList = [ key for (key, value) in ValidServerAttributes ]
		
	if '--custAttrNames' in args :
		if len(argv) < 3 :
			print 'ERROR: No attribute names were specified. --custAttrNames requires a list of attribute names to delete.Please refer to the help on step.'
			showUsageHelp()
			sys.exit(1)
		RemoveSelectedCustomAttributes = True
		ParametersForAllVars = argv[2].split(" ")                 
		# Check for  any invalid set of attributes from ParametersForAllVars
		invalidAttributes = [ attr for attr in ParametersForAllVars if attr not in ValidAttributesList ]

						
	if '--allGeneratedAttrs' in args :
		RemoveSelectedCustomAttributes = True
		ParametersForAllVars = ValidAttributesList
		
	if '--all' in args :
		RemoveAllCustomAttributes = True

		
	return True
	

	
def deleteCustomAttributes() :
	# Place holder for filtered custom attributes
	filteredCAs = {}
	# Every possible attribute that is inherited or set for the server.
	allAttributes = ThisServerService.getCustAttrs(ThisServerReference, None, False)
	
	# In case the step has to remove all the attributes set on it. Then we exclude
	# the facility level or appliance level attribute here from the list
	if RemoveAllCustomAttributes :
		for elem in allAttributes :
			if elem[0:6] != '__OPSW' :
				filteredCAs[elem] = allAttributes[elem]
	
	# Pretty print flag 
	printOnce = True
	
	# Print/Log all the attributes that do not exist or many be incorrect to the 
	# admin for reference
	if RemoveSelectedCustomAttributes :
		for elem in ParametersForAllVars :
			if allAttributes.__contains__(elem) :
				filteredCAs[elem] = allAttributes[elem]
			else :
				if printOnce :
					printOnce = False
					print 'The following custom attributes do not exist on the server'
					print '-' * 86
					
					
				LOG.info('Custom Attribute ' + elem + ' does not exist')
				print elem
		
	# If there are valid set of custom attributes that are to be removed knock them
	# off from the target server.
	if filteredCAs :
		print '\nThe following custom attributes have been removed from the server'
		print '-' * 86
		
		LOG.info('\nThe following custom attributes have been removed from the server')
		LOG.info('-' * 86)
		
		for attribute in filteredCAs :
			ThisServerService.removeCustAttr(ThisServerReference, attribute)
			LOG.info('{0:25s} : {1:50s}'.format(attribute, allAttributes[attribute]))
			print '    {0:25s} : {1:50s}'.format(attribute, allAttributes[attribute])
	
		print '-' * 86
		LOG.info('-' * 86)
		
def main(argv) :
	if validateArguments(argv) :
		deleteCustomAttributes()

	
if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main(sys.argv))
