#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#

'''
(C) Copyright 2014-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

STEP FUNCTIONALITY SHORT NOTE
-----------------------------
This script queries properties that pertain to the target server, such as model, UUID, deployment IP address, etc. 
and either creates a custom attribute for these properties, where the custom attribute name is the same as the property name, 
or writes properties to a text file as tag/value pairs.  
These properties can then be read by your custom scripts to perform actions based on the property values.


PROPERTIES & generated CUSTOM ATTRIBUTES 
----------------------------------------
Following are the list of System properties that this step supports and generated Custom attribute name.

==========================================================================================
	Generated CA name				Description
==========================================================================================
	Model 				Hardware Model 			
	UUID 				UUID 					
	Serial 				Serial Number 			
	CPU 				# of CPUs 				
	Memory 				Memory 					
	NIC_Name 			Deployment NIC Name 	
	NIC_MAC_Address 		Deployment NIC MAC address 
	IP_Address 			Deployment IP 			
	iLO_IP 				iLO IP address 			
	Rack 				Rack 					
	Enclosure 			Enclosure 				
	Bay 				Bay 					
	SA_Object_Id 			SA Object ID 			
	Manufacturer 			Manufacturer 			
	Num_Disks 			Number of disks 	
	Disk_Size			Total storage assigned to server		
	Appliance_IP 			Appliance deployment IP 
	Media_Server_Share_IP 		Media server share IP 		
	Media_Server_Http_IP		HTTP media server IP 

==========================================================================================
	
	
ARGUMENTS AND IMPLICATIONS
--------------------------
The step offers several arguments which it supports for the users benefit.  Below is the 
list of arguments and their implications on the step.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
	Arguments			       Implication
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
	
	--allProps 			       when specified, the script will create custom attributes 
					       or write variables for all the supported properties listed below. 
								
	--props "Property1 Property2.." ...    When specified, followed by a list of supported properties, the script 
					       will create custom attributes or write variables only for the properties that were specified
								
	--varfile "file-name"		       When specified, this parameter will cause the requested properties to be written to a file on the target server 
					       and a series of name/value pairs. The file name specified should be fully qualified (for example C:\ManagementSpace\Attributes.txt for Windows based systems and /home/management/attributes.txt for Linux based systems). Note that the format of the specified path (Windows or Linux) is checked against the running OS type, and if there is a mismatch, the step will fail.
								
	--CA				       When specified the script will create custom attributes on the target server for all of the specified properties. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	


USAGE GUIDELINES
----------------
Following are the general guidelines for using the step.

	1. --allProps  and --props are mutually exclusive.  When both the arguments are passed the
		step will generate error and stop further execution
		
	2. --varfile or --CA are mandatory arguments and the step expects at least one among them
		to be mentioned in the list of argument.  Absence of both will result in a error and
		step stops further execution.  However, both the arguments can be passed to the step
		together.

		
EXAMPLES ON THE STEP
--------------------
	To dump all the supported keywords to be dumped onto the target server/machine 
		--allProps  --varfile "C:\ManagementSpace\Attributes.txt"
		
	To create custom attributes on the server/machine for all the supported keywords
		--allProps  --CA
		
	To dump only selected set of keywords onto the target server/machine
		--props "NIC_MAC_Address Manufacturer Appliance_IP" --varfile "C:\Temp\Attributes.txt"
		
	To create custom attributes on the server/machine for a selected set of keywords
		--props "NIC_MAC_Address Manufacturer Appliance_IP" --CA

'''

import re
import platform
import sys
import string

from pytwist 							import *
from pytwist.com.opsware.search 		import Filter
from pytwist.com.opsware.server 		import ServerRef, ServerDetails
from osprov.osbp 						import logger, thisServerID, ThisTargetServer
from osprov.decorators 					import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.ogfs 						import ogsh_spin
from osprov.server.sa 					import SAServer
from pytwist.com.opsware.server 		import ServerRef
from pytwist.com.opsware.shared 		import TwistConsoleService
from pytwist.com.opsware.mgmtservice 	import *
from pytwist.com.opsware.locality		import *

sys.path.append("/opt/opsware/pylibs")

LOG = logger.getIt("Collect_and_Store_System_Data")

# Valid attribute list and keywords mapping
ValidServerAttributes = [
		('Model', 					'Hardware Model'), 			
		('UUID', 					'UUID'), 					
		('Serial', 					'Serial Number'), 			
		('CPU', 					'# of CPUs'), 				
		('Memory', 					'Memory'), 					
		('NIC_Name', 				'Deployment NIC Name'), 	
		('NIC_MAC_Address', 		'Deployment NIC MAC Address'), 
		('IP_Address', 				'Deployment IP Address'), 			
		('iLO_IP', 					'iLO IP Address'),
		('Rack', 					'Rack'), 					
		('Enclosure', 				'Enclosure'), 				
		('Bay', 					'Bay'), 					
		('SA_Object_Id', 			'SA Object ID'), 			
		('Manufacturer', 			'Manufacturer'), 			
		('Num_Disks', 				'Number of disks'), 		
		('Disk_Size',				'Total storage assigned to server'),	
		('Appliance_IP', 			'Appliance deployment IP'), 
		('Media_Server_Share_IP',	'Media server share IP'), 		
	    ('Media_Server_HTTP_IP',    'HTTP media server IP')
	]
	
# Global variables, though can be avoided helps in optimizing too many references 
# being opened at later point in time
#
# Variable holding the reference to the Twist Server
TwistServerInstance = twistserver.TwistServer()

# Variable holding the reference to core facility
TwistCoreFacility = TwistServerInstance.shared.TwistConsoleService.getCoreFacility()

# Variable holding the reference to twist servers facility service
TwistFacilityService = TwistServerInstance.locality.FacilityService

# Variable holding the value of server id aka SA Object Id 
ThisServerIdentity = thisServerID()

# Variable holding reference to instance of target server object
ThisServer = ThisTargetServer()

# Variable holding reference to target servers reference structure
ThisServerReference = ServerRef( ThisServerIdentity )

# Variable holding reference to server service of the twist server
ThisServerService = TwistServerInstance.server.ServerService

# Variable holding reference to the server hardware inventory 
ThisServerHardwareVO = ThisServerService.getServerHardwareVO( ThisServerReference )

# Variable holding reference to target servers inventory
ThisServerVO = ThisServerService.getServerVO( ThisServerReference )

# Function that returns the iLO ip address associated with the server, in case the target
# is a physical machine.  For physical servers iLO ip address is returned and in case of 
# of a virtual machine or non-iLO based servers 'iLO not found' is returned.
def getIloIpAddress() :
	iloRef = ThisServerService.findManagersOfType(ThisServerReference, ManagerTypeConstant.ILO_MANAGER_TYPE)
		
	if iloRef :
		MgrService = TwistServerInstance.mgmtservice.ManagerService
		iloVo = MgrService.getManagerVO(iloRef[0])		
		return iloVo.getConnection().getNetworkAddress() 
	else :
		return None
		
# Function that returns the model of the server		
def getServerModel() :
	return ThisServerHardwareVO.getModel()
	
# Function that returns the UUID assigned to the server	
def getServerUuid() :
	return ThisServerHardwareVO.getUuid()
	
# Function that returns the serial number associated with the server
def getServerSerialNumber() :
	return ThisServerHardwareVO.getSerialNumber() 
	
# Function when called returns the number of CPUs present on it.
def getServerCpuCount() :
	return len(ThisServerHardwareVO.getCpus())

# Function when called returns the total physical memory or the RAM 
# associated with it.
def getServerMemorySize() :
	memoryObj  = ThisServerHardwareVO.getMemories();
	totRamSize = 0
	
	for elem in memoryObj :
		if elem.getType() == "RAM" :
			totRamSize = totRamSize + int(elem.getQuantity())
			
	return totRamSize
	
# Function when called returns the management ip address assigned to it
def getServerIpAddress() :
	return ThisServerVO.getManagementIP()
	
# Function when called returns the MAC address associated with the NIC that
# is used as management node
def getServerMacAddress() :
	interfaceObj = ThisServerHardwareVO.getInterfaces()
	theIpAddress = getServerIpAddress()
	
	for elem in interfaceObj :
		if elem.getIpAddress()  == theIpAddress :
			return elem.getHardwareAddress()
	
	return None

# Returns the NIC name aka slot value associated with the card that is used
# for management
def getServerNicName() :
	interfaceObj = ThisServerHardwareVO.getInterfaces()
	theIpAddress = getServerIpAddress()
	
	for elem in interfaceObj :
		if elem.getIpAddress()  == theIpAddress :
			return elem.getSlot()
	
	return None

# Returns the Rack details if the server is associated with a rack and the
# information is assigned within the appliance. If no rack information is 
# found then 'Rack information not set' is returned.
def getServerRack() :
	hwLocationObj = ThisServerHardwareVO.getServerHwLocation()
	
	if hwLocationObj :
		return hwLocationObj.getRack()
	else :
		return None

# Returns the Bay details if the server is associated with a Bay and the
# information is assigned within the appliance. If no Bay information is 
# found then 'Bay information not set' is returned.		
def getServerBay() :
	hwLocationObj = ThisServerHardwareVO.getServerHwLocation()
	
	if hwLocationObj :
		return hwLocationObj.getBay()
	else :
		return None
		
# Returns the Enclosure details if the server is associated with a Enclosure and the
# information is assigned within the appliance. If no Enclosure information is 
# found then 'Enclosure information not set' is returned.	
def getServerEnclosure() :
	hwLocationObj = ThisServerHardwareVO.getServerHwLocation()
	
	if hwLocationObj :
		return hwLocationObj.getEnclosure()
	else :
		return None
	
# Returns the information about the server manufacturer 	
def getServerManufacturer() :
	return ThisServerHardwareVO.getManufacturer()
	
# Returns number of disks that are associated with the server.  The function only 
# considers physical disks that are connected to it, any other types (like CDROM,
# USB, Virtual Drive etc) are ignored
def getServerNumDisks() :
	serverStorage  = ThisServerHardwareVO.getStorages()
	drivesAttached = 0
	
	for elem in serverStorage :
		if elem.getMedia() == 'SCSI DISK' :
			drivesAttached = drivesAttached + 1
			
	return drivesAttached
	
# Returns the size of disk space allocated to the server. The function only 
# considers physical disks that are connected to it, any other types (like CDROM,
# USB, Virtual Drive etc) are ignored
def getServerTotalDiskSize() :
	serverStorage  = ThisServerHardwareVO.getStorages()
	totalDriveSize = 0
	
	for elem in serverStorage :
		if elem.getMedia() == 'SCSI DISK' :
			totalDriveSize = totalDriveSize + int(elem.getCapacity())
			
	return totalDriveSize

# Returns the SA object id assigned to the server
def getSAObjectId() :
		return ThisServerIdentity

# Returns the IP address associated with the appliance
def getApplianceIP() :
	return TwistServerInstance.shared.TwistConsoleService.getTwistIP()

# Returns the media servers IP address. If no media server is setup then 
# 'Media Share not set' is returned.
def getMediaServerShareIP() :
	mediaShareIp = TwistFacilityService.getCustAttr(TwistCoreFacility, '__OPSW-Media-WinPath', False)
	
	if mediaShareIp :
		mediaShareIp = mediaShareIp[1:].split('/')
	
	if len(mediaShareIp) > 0 :
		return mediaShareIp[0]
	
	return None

# Returns the media servers HTTP publishing IP address.  If not HTTP server is set
# then 'HTTP Media share not set' is returned
def getMediaServerHttpIP() :
	httpShareIp = TwistFacilityService.getCustAttr(TwistCoreFacility, '__OPSW-Media-LinURI', False)
	
	if httpShareIp :
		httpShareIp = httpShareIp.split('/')
		
	if len(httpShareIp) >= 2 :
		return httpShareIp[2]
		
	return None
	
# Dictionary of keywords to API mapping.  This technique is adopted to avoid huge list of 
# if else conditional branching further in the code.  Any function which will be added in
# future as keyword support should be added above this declaration, otherwise Python will
# raise an error of unknown symbol.	
ApiMapping = {
		'Model' 				: getServerModel,
		'UUID' 					: getServerUuid,
		'Serial' 				: getServerSerialNumber,
		'CPU' 					: getServerCpuCount,
		'Memory' 				: getServerMemorySize,
		'NIC_Name' 				: getServerNicName,
		'NIC_MAC_Address' 		: getServerMacAddress,
		'IP_Address' 			: getServerIpAddress,
		'iLO_IP' 				: getIloIpAddress,
		'Rack' 					: getServerRack,
		'Enclosure' 			: getServerEnclosure,
		'Bay' 					: getServerBay,
		'SA_Object_Id' 			: getSAObjectId,
		'Manufacturer' 			: getServerManufacturer,
		'Num_Disks' 			: getServerNumDisks,
		'Disk_Size'				: getServerTotalDiskSize,
		'Appliance_IP' 			: getApplianceIP,
		'Media_Server_Share_IP' : getMediaServerShareIP,
		'Media_Server_HTTP_IP'	: getMediaServerHttpIP
	}

# Valid arguments list
ValidArgumentsList = [
		'--allProps',
		'--props',
		'--varfile',
		'--CA'
	]
# Name of this function; helpful in uncluttering the code
FunctionName = 'Collect and Store System Data'

# File name to which the data should be dumped 
DumpFileName = ''
DumpFileHandle = None
UseFilteringOfAttributes = False
SetCustomAttributesToServer = False

# Specific variables that the caller is interested in
UserPreferredVariables = []

# Just the attributes, not necessary but optimizes the code
ValidAttributesList = []

# The usage display function that emits the help text on the right usage of the script.
def showUsageHelp() :
	index = 0
	
	print '\nStep : {0:s}\nUsage:  ( --allProps  | --props "Property1 Property2..." ) ' \
		  '--varfile "file name" [ --CA ]'.format(FunctionName)
	print '\tArguments --allProps  and --props are mutually exclusive, and mandatory.'
	print '\tWhen option --CA is mentioned, step will create Custom Attribute for all ' \
		  'the supported properties on target server\n'
	print 'INFO: Extended help on the OSBP step ...\n\tValid argument list is : ', ValidArgumentsList
	print '\tValid attributes for --props\n\t    ',
		
	for item in ValidServerAttributes :
		index = index + 1
		print '%-23s ' % item[0],
		if ( index % 3 == 0) :
			print '\n\t    ',
		
		
# Function that validates the arguments passed and sets the global data structures	
def validateArguments(argv) :
	# Too few argument check!
	argLen = len(argv)
	
	if ( argLen < 2 ) :
		if argLen == 1 :
			print 'ERROR: No valid arguments were supplied for the step'
		else :
			print 'ERROR: Mandatory arguments were not passed for the step'
			
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)

	# Extract only the arguments from the list of arguments provided
	args = [ argument for argument in argv if argument[0:2] == '--' ]
	# Extract only those arguments that are not valid arguments
	notArgs = [ argument for argument in args if argument not in ValidArgumentsList ]
	
	global ValidAttributesList
	global UseFilteringOfAttributes
	global SetCustomAttributesToServer
	
	if ( len( notArgs) > 0 or ( ('--allProps' not in args and '--props' not in args) or
	                                 ('--allProps' in args and '--props' in args) ) ) : 
		if('--allProps' in args and '--props' in args):
			print 'ERROR: --allProps and --props arguments can not be used together in step invocation'
		else:
			print 'ERROR: Mandatory arguments are missing in step invocation'
		print 'INFO : Invalid argument(s) :', ', '.join(notArgs)
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)

	if ('--varfile' not in args and '--CA' not in args ) :
		print 'ERROR: Mandatory arguments are missing in step invocation'
		print 'INFO : Arguments must have at least one among --varfile or --CA'
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)

	ValidAttributesList = [ key for (key, value) in ValidServerAttributes ]
		
	if '--props' in args :
		extractpropsCompanions( argv )
		
	if '--varfile' in args :
		prepareDumpFile( argv )
		
	if len(UserPreferredVariables) > 0 :
		UseFilteringOfAttributes = True
		
	if '--CA' in args :
		SetCustomAttributesToServer = True
	
	return True

# Finalizes the dump file and closes the handlers
def finalizeDumpFile() :
	if DumpFileHandle :
		DumpFileHandle.flush()
		DumpFileHandle.close()
		
# Function that extracts the dump file name from the list of arguments
# that are passed to the step
def prepareDumpFile(argv) :
	global DumpFileName
	global DumpFileHandle
	hasErrors = False
	
	varFilePosition = argv.index('--varfile') + 1
	
	if ( len(argv) > varFilePosition and argv[varFilePosition][0:2] != '--' ) :
		DumpFileName = argv[ varFilePosition ]
		
		if 'win' in ThisServerVO.getOsVersion().lower() :
			if ( (':' not in DumpFileName) or ('/' in DumpFileName) ) :
				print 'ERROR: File name convention is not standard to WINDOWS platform ,please review the File name (%s).'%DumpFileName
				hasErrors = True
		else :
			if ( (':' in DumpFileName and '\\' in DumpFileName) or ('/' not in DumpFileName) ) :
				print 'ERROR: File name convention is not standard to UNIX platform ,please review the File name (%s).'%DumpFileName				                                           
				hasErrors = True
				
		if hasErrors :
			sys.exit(1)	
								
		try:
			filePath = ThisServer.pathToOGFS(DumpFileName)
			DumpFileHandle = open( filePath, 'w' )
		except:
			print 'ERROR: A file could not be opened for writing on the given path . Please ' \
				  '       check if the given path exists and should not be write protected'
			sys.exit(1)
			
	else :
		print 'ERROR: No parameter was found for --varfile'
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
	

# Function that extracts the arguments or variables passed to the --props
# arguments, also validates the rightness of the arguments.  Prints the 
# warning on invalid set of attributes, if any found
def extractpropsCompanions(argv) :
	index 	  = 0
	hasErrors = False

	global UserPreferredVariables
	global ValidAttributesList
	
	UserPreferredVariables = argv[ argv.index('--props') + 1] 
	
	# Make sure that the value for --props is not another argument type
	if UserPreferredVariables[:2] == '--' :
		print 'ERROR: At least one attribute is expected for the argument --props'
		showUsageHelp()
		sys.exit(1)
	
	# Populate the attributes a elements of an array
	UserPreferredVariables = UserPreferredVariables.split(" ")
	# Populate a valid list of attributes from defined custom attributes
	ValidAttributesList = [vt for (vt, va) in ValidServerAttributes]
	# Get a list of invalid set of attributes from the given or passed list
	invalidAttributes = [ attr for attr in UserPreferredVariables if attr not in ValidAttributesList ]
	# Yank any invalid set of attributes from UserPreferredVariables
	UserPreferredVariables = [ attr for attr in UserPreferredVariables if attr in ValidAttributesList ]
	
	if len(UserPreferredVariables) == 0 :
		print 'ERROR: At least one valid attribute is expected for the argument --props'
		hasErrors = True

	if len(invalidAttributes) > 0 :
		print 'ERROR: Found invalid set of attributes for the argument --props'		
		print '     ', ', '.join(invalidAttributes)
		hasErrors = True 
		
	if hasErrors :
		print 'INFO : Valid set of attributes for --props are given below\n\t',
		
		for item in ValidServerAttributes :
			index = index + 1
			print '%-23s ' % item[0],
			if ( index % 3 == 0) :
				print '\n\t',
		
		sys.exit(1)
	
		
# The main function that assembles rest of the functions in a orderly fashion		
def main(argv) :
	if ( validateArguments(argv) ) :
		# Proxy variable that would point to right list of attributes once the
		# arguments are assessed
		attributesToQuery = None
		
		# Check for user preferred attributes enablement, if not grab all the 
		# attributes from the defined dictionary
		if UseFilteringOfAttributes == False :
			attributesToQuery = [ attrib for attrib in ApiMapping.keys() ]
		else :
			attributesToQuery = UserPreferredVariables
			
		#print DumpFileHandle, DumpFileName
		
		if SetCustomAttributesToServer :
			print '\nThe following custom attributes have been created on the server'
			print '-' * 86
			
			LOG.info('\nThe following custom attributes have been created on the server')
			LOG.info('-' * 86)
		if DumpFileHandle :
			print '\nThe following custom attributes have been written to file (' + DumpFileName + ') on server'
			print '-' * 86
			
			LOG.info('\nThe following custom attributes have been written to file (' + DumpFileName + ') on server')
			LOG.info('-' * 86)
			
		# Now we have set of attributes to be queried.  So go over them and 
		# invoke all the functions to get the data
		for attribute in attributesToQuery :
			if (attribute in ApiMapping and ApiMapping[attribute]) :
				# The function is invoked from the dictionary definition 
				# directly here, this technique avoids a large amount of 
				# conditional branching statements
				result = ApiMapping[attribute]()
				
				# If file dumping is enabled write to the file
				if DumpFileHandle :
					DumpFileHandle.write( attribute + '=' + str(result) + '\r\n' )
				
				# If --CA is chosen then set the attribute to the server
				if SetCustomAttributesToServer :
					ThisServerService.setCustAttr(ThisServerReference, attribute, str(result))
					LOG.info('{0:25s} : {1:50s}'.format(attribute, str(result)))
					
				# Print the attribute information to the console
				print '    {0:25s} : {1:50s}'.format(attribute, str(result))
		
		print '-' * 86
		LOG.info('-' * 86)		
		
		# Finalize the dump file and complete the execution
		if DumpFileHandle :
			finalizeDumpFile()
			

# Call the main with arguments
if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main(sys.argv))

Collects system properties and stores the values in custom attributes or a text file.

Required Parameters: 
 --allProps - Collect and store all supported properties
 --props Property1 Property2" - Collect and store only the properties specified 
 --varfile "file-name"  Write the collected properties to the specified file
 --CA - Creates custom attributes for the collected properties.

Usage:
 --allProps and --props are mutually exclusive
 You must specify either --varfile or --CA

Examples:
 --allProps  --varfile "C:\ManagementSpace\Attributes.txt"		
 --allProps  --CA		
 --props "NIC_MAC_Address Manufacturer Appliance_IP" --varfile "C:\Temp\Attributes.txt"		
 --props "NIC_MAC_Address Manufacture Appliance_IP" CA

Prerequisite:
 Target servers run a service OS or supported Operating system.

Available properties:
Model, UUID, Serial, CPU, Memory, NIC_Name, NIC_MAC_Address, IP_Address, iLO_IP, 
Rack, Enclosure, Bay, SA_Object_Id, Manufacturer, Num_Disks, Disk_Size, Appliance_IP, 
Media_Server_Share_IP, Media_Server_Http_IP

                  - the following service OSs are possible: linux, winpe64
            network - configures PXE network booting into the selected Service OS
                  - specifying an ogfs PXE-option as the Service OS is supported
                  - if the IloService is enabled on the target server it will also set the one time boot option to NETWORK
--force - Forces the boot configuration and reboot of the target server.
--wait <time> - Specify a new wait time.  Default is 45 seconds.

#!/usr/bin/python
# -*- mode: Python; tab-width: 4; indent-tabs-mode: nil; -*-
# ex: set tabstop=4 :
# Please do not change the two lines above. See PEP 8, PEP 263.
#
# Also note that a Python version greater than 2.3 is needed
#
 
"""
(C) Copyright 2011-2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.
 
This python script tries to boot a machine into the user selected Service OS.
 
"""
 
import sys
from cStringIO import StringIO
 
import time
from optparse import OptionParser
from osprov.decorators import HandleShowErrorMessage
from osprov.netconfig.helpers import getNetconfig
from osprov.parsers.netconfig import SmartNetconfig
from osprov.osbp import ThisTargetServer, logger
from osprov.power import getPowerController
from pytwist.com.opsware.common import OpswareException, OpswareSystemException
from osprov import boot
from osprov import ilo
 
log = logger.getIt("Boot")
 
EC_OK = 0
EC_INVALID_ARGS = 1
EC_UNSUPPORTED = 2
EC_FAILED_BOOT = 3
EC_FAILED_BOOT_SETUP = 4
 
HPSA_NETCONFIG="""@hpsa_netconfig@"""
REQUIRE_NETCONFIG="@require_netconfig:false@"
 
 
class BootStepOptionsParser(OptionParser):
 
    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        OptionParser.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
        self.add_option("--serviceOS",
            help="The Service OS to boot into." \
                 "Possible options: linux32, linux64 (linux), winpe32, winpe64 (winpe)")
        self.add_option("--method", default="auto",
            help = "it represents the boot method to be used.")
        self.add_option("--wait", default="45",
            help = "Specify the duration before server power off.")
        self.add_option("--force", default=False, action = "store_true",
            help = "Forces the boot configuration and reboot of the target server.")
        self.add_option("--ipv6", action="store_true", default=False,
            help="Starts the selected Service OS in IPv6 mode")
 
 
@HandleShowErrorMessage("boot target server", log)
def main():
    """ build plan script to boot the target system """
    parser = BootStepOptionsParser()
    options, args = parser.parse_args()
 
    serviceOS = options.serviceOS
    method = options.method
    waitTime = int(options.wait)
 
    targetServer = ThisTargetServer()
 
    print("Boot method: " + method)
    bootController = boot.getBootController(targetServer, method, log=log)
 
    if serviceOS not in bootController.getSupportedServiceOSs():
        print("Service OS %s not supported for boot method %s" % (serviceOS, method))
        return EC_INVALID_ARGS
 
    if targetServer.isMaintenance():
        if not targetServer.isAccessible():
            print "The target server is in MAINTENANCE but not accessible, continuing..."
        elif serviceOS[:5] in targetServer.PXEOption and not options.force:
            print "Skipping boot configuration, the target server is booted into the same Service OS"
            bootController.storeBootInformation(serviceOS)
            return EC_OK
 
    try:
        print("Configuring boot to Service OS: %s" % serviceOS)
        netconfigParser = SmartNetconfig.readonly(StringIO(HPSA_NETCONFIG),
                                                  activeMacAddress=None, ipv6default=targetServer.isIPv6Managed())
        netconfig = netconfigParser.info()
 
        bootController.configureBoot(serviceOS, netconfig, ipv6=options.ipv6)
 
 
        print("Rebooting the target server...")
        targetServer.reboot(getPowerController(targetServer, log = log))
 
        print("Waiting for the target server's BIOS to reset...")
        time.sleep(waitTime)
 
        print("Powering off target server...")
        iloServ = ilo.getIlo(targetServer, log = log)
        iloServ.ims.setPowerStatus(iloServ.iloManagerRef, False)
    except (OpswareException, OpswareSystemException), why:
        log.exception(why)
        sys.stderr.write("Failed to boot:\n%s\n" % str(why))
        return EC_FAILED_BOOT
    return EC_OK
 
if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())
